title: I think the sound quality is good when you get the earbuds to stay in your ...
body: I think the sound quality is good  when you get the earbuds to stay in your ear firmly and sealed in your ear.  You don't want any air gaps that's where you  loose sound quality.

title: I was expecting more
body: I feel like $50 is a reasonable amount to spend on a pair of headphones. These didn't seem any higher quality than any $20-$30 pair I have purchased in the past. The sound quality is average. It was actually very difficult to get them to stay in my ears, even with the extra attachments on as they sit a little to far away from the ear insert. And they stick really far out of your ears.  I returned them.

title: Ive had these headphones for a little over a month ...
body: I had a problem with these headphones and I talked to the support who was very kind and got me my replacement in 4 business days I have had no problems sense.

title: Great Customer Support
body: Really liked this product for the first few months and then they just stopped working mid-run one day. They were completely charged prior to the run and within an hour they just stopped working and will not charge now and are completely dead.  I contacted the company and they responded with great customer service. I would definitely do business with this company again.

title: Five Stars
body: amazing pair of earbuds very very high quality for the price

title: Stopped working, very disappointing
body: Got these bluetooth earbuds at Christmas, and they worked great for the first 2 months, then suddenly, they wouldn't stay connected and dropped bluetooth connection, and turned off. Tried double checking the charge was full, and once again, they dropped off and turned off. I have 2 pairs of these, and the first pair did it, I thought it was defective, but then a week later, the second pair did the exact same thing. Very disappointing. Compared to a different pair, SoundPEATS Bluetooth Headphones In Ear Wireless Earbuds 4.1 Magnetic Sweatproof Stereo Bluetooth Earphones for Sports With Mic (Upgraded 7 Hours Play Time, Secure Fit, Noise Cancelling) - Red, and these are still working great without issue, again, bought at Christmas and no problems so far. There is no indicator to report battery life. Description says it has a 9 hour battery life, but never got more than 4-5 hours of listening to music or talking on calls.

title: I highly recommend
body: Perfect sound. I bought these for my wife and he loves them. In the past she had issues because her previous headphones kept falling off her ears. Not these. They sit comfortably inside her ear and my wife is delighted by the quality of the sound. She is even working out more than she used to as a result.

title: Way better than you thought
body: This product is simply amazing premium quality headphones for a budget price.

title: AMAZING!!! But broken within a month!!
body: I love then they were almost entirely sound proof. Though I’ve had them for about a month and I take them everywhere, there is a short in one of the wires so only one of the earbuds works.

title: My friend bought these bluetooth earbuds and recommended for me and I'm really happy with them
body: My friend bought these bluetooth earbuds and recommended for me and I'm really happy with them. Good value for this price.

title: Worked great, when they worked!!!
body: Worked great when tbey worked, now its about 3 months in and they are going out. The left ear speaker is completly out.

title: This our the best wireless headphones that I've used
body: This our the best wireless headphones that I've used. I'm an avid runner and couldn't seem to find headphones to fit correctly and these do the trick!

title: Best bluetooth for me.
body: Best I have used. The cord is just the right length to drape behind my neck. The variety of earbuds include three sizes of my favorite foam tips. The sound quality is great. They are so comfortable that I keep forgetting to pull them out when I am not using them. I wear a lanyard for an e-cig, and I used the included flat clip to attach the cord to my lanyard in the back. The earpiece is right there whenever I need it. Pop it in the right ear and take the call. Callers are able to hear me clearly, and I am able to hear them. I could not ask for more.

title: Calling them "noise cancelling" is deceptive.  // UPDATED review to 3 stars from 2.
body:
For the money, these aren't terrible wireless earbuds, however they aren't actually noice-cancelling as the description suggests. They are noise-isolating, meaning the earbuds block out a portion of your ambient noise. Noice-cancelling would mean they capture ambient noise and play the negative, or inverse sound waves to cancel out the outside noise. They do come with several sizes of the eartips, plus three sizes of the expandable-foam eartips which are the best for isolating outside noise. All that said, the sound quality is just ok, the sound is a little muddied compared to other headphones & earbuds I've used.

UPDATE: The company itself gets 5-stars for their efforts. After finding out I had returned them, they offered to send me their XR700 model free of charge for me to evaluate. The TREBLAB customer service team is pretty outstanding, so I upgraded my review of these earbuds from 2 to 3 stars.

title: I will recommend these to everyone
body: Absolutely outstanding!  I will recommend these to everyone!

title: Great value Bluetooth Earbuds for the money.
body:
These are awesome! Contain several sizes of memory foam tips, super easy and fast at pairing via Bluetooth. Sound quality is great and noise cancelation is great with memory foam tips. Very  comfortable and great battery life...

Negatives? Honestly I can't think of anything, probably not the best sounding Earbuds ever made, but to me they sound great. They appear to be made of high quality materials, only had them a few days so hard to judge.

ONE MONTH LATER. still nothing bad to say about them, i wear them around my neck with them magnetically linked like a necklace wherever I go!

title: It's okay for the most part
body: Though this worked wonders when I first bought it....it stopped working just now...I only had it for 4 months.

title: Broke within a week of purchase
body: Broke within a week of getting them. And before that the sounds went out in one year and then the other. Not happy at all with these!

title: Really nice pair of earbuds
body: I really liking these earbuds. Great sound quality and great bass. They’re great for working out and they block out all excess noise in the gym which is very nice. Overall a really like these earbuds

title: I would say this is the best sounding earphones i have ever had sadly it only ...
body:
I would say this is the best sounding earphones i have ever had sadly it only lasted for two months. I would love to buy a new one but i don't know if i would risk another $40 after the first one i had :(

Update: May 16 2018

I tried to contact treblab about the issue and now they are giving me a new one! Their customer service is really good! They would reply within 24 hrs. Thanks Treblab.

title: very good for the 2 weeks before they lost sound in ...
body: very good for the 2 weeks before they lost sound in the left driver. I am disappointed in the durability but the cost was good.

title: Yeah, these are actually decent
body:
Honestly an exceptional product. I didn't but it expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised at the build and sound quality. The usability is also exceptional. I have a friend who recently bought a $20 pair of Bluetooth earbuds, and he said he had connection issues and asked me to try them for a day to see if I had the same issues. His seemed good enough (I think the connection issues were with his phone), but when I tried putting his in one ear and the j1's in my other ear and switched back and forth.... Holy smokes.. his sounded like tin cans compared to these babes. Also his had a seriously annoying method of pairing with the phone that wasn't clearly explained. I love how the j1's have voice feedback to tell you when they're on, dying, pairing or connected. Personally this is my second only my second pair of Bluetooths, but so far that's a feature I've only seen in high end Bluetooths like those by Bose.

Personally though I found I didn't like the things that are supposed to hook into your ear. I took mine off.

Side note, I also appreciate that the CEO of the company reaches out to request a review, I thought that's kind of interesting. However the link included I thought might be kind of sketchy, so I initially wasn't going to review. But after trying my friend's tin cans, I thought: "hey why not, these guys did a good job."

I still didn't use that link though, haha.

title: Excellent product
body: Excellent product. I have purchased other items as well from treblab. Excellent quality. For me better than all similar commercial products.

title: Great fit + sound
body: They are small and light but still have impressive sound!

title: Worth it
body: Yea these headphones are pretty sweet, better noise cancellation than I expected

title: I love them but.....
body: One side doesn't work anymore,  just got them in April.

title: Mostly great.
body: I tend to wear my earbuds all day around my neck.  I put them in when I am on a call or listening to music.  When not in my ear, they are constantly slipping around my neck to the side with the controls.  I have to adjust them multiple time throughout the day or the will completely slip off.  When I do have them both in my ears they work great.  Callers have said they can hear me fine, and music sounds good.

title: Great sound! Needs stronger Bluetooth connection.
body: There are times that it works great at a distance like when I’m home cleaning and the phone is in the other room. The rub for me is when I’m walking down the street and I place my phone in my pocket, the sound is staticky and seems to cut out. Otherwise, I love them.

title: Rip off
body: I bought these headphones in hope they would be as great as advertised,  they are definitely not. Honestly my skullcandy headphones are better than these in the sound category . Most certainly do not recommend

title: I love these.
body: I waited a while before reviewing to see how these did and I love them. They sound great, stay in place and are long enough that I can actually connect them around my neck. I'm definitely a fan!

title: The charge have to be better
body:
For 2 week used
Now is very good
Just the charger is very delicate for use

title: Exceeded my expectations!
body: These ear buds sound great and have an impressive range.  I can easily walk 40ft away from my phone and still clearly hear a conversation. Comfortable in the gym and the controls on the cord allow you to easily change the volume or advance songs.  The battery life is very impressive given the very small size.  Comes with a great carrying case to keep the cords all together and preventing them from being stretched or otherwise damaged.  Multiple ear inserts included to fit any human size ear.

title: Five Stars
body: Very nice, works well, good sound, great battery life.

title: Buenos
body: Muy buenos

title: Best bluetooth earbuds I've owned so far
body: So far very satisfied with them. Lives up to all descriptions. Only wear them on average 6 hours per week when I work out. I hope they last.  Worth buying.

title: music skipping and comfort issues
body:
I was hyped after reading all the reviews but i faced a couple of issues with these earbuds
1. they were not quite comfortable for me...i played around with different combinations of the provided earfins and buds, but it just didn't work out...now this is a personal thing and may not apply to everyone
2. this was why i returned them - when i played music, it got cut off intermittently and that was annoying...so i could never hear the entire song...it always broke off and skipped parts of the song...

title: Sub par sound quality
body: Really low sound quality. None of the ear bud fittings work well. The choices are either too small which allows outside noise through our slightly too large which ends up being uncomfortable. I contacted the manufacturer reacted than just returning them and that turned out to be a mistake since they simply offered me a 15% refund to "increase the value of the product for me" (their words). However the battery life and Bluetooth connectivity are decent. The low rating comes from the sound quality, comfort, and customer service.

title: Good buy
body: Great earbuds!!!

title: Good Headphones, Questionable Build Quality
body:
I purchased these headphones in September 2018, and have been pleased with the style, sound, and battery life. I mostly listen to podcasts while commuting or running, so fidelity is not the highest priority on my list. They sound good enough for my uses. One initial complaint from their use is that, when I listen with only one earbud in, the weight of the other causes the whole affair to shift to the opposite side, threatening to pull out the earbud I am using. I feel that, if there were some method for clipping the wire to my collar, this would not be an issue.

In February of 2019, however, I have noticed the right earbud had started to crackle, and lose audio completely. By holding the wire at the proper angle, I would get audio back, but only intermittently. This could be due to normal wear and tear, or caused if I have pulled the earbuds in adjustment, weakening the connection. Either way, some sort of reinforcement might be a better design. I will look at headphone designs in the future with this in mind.

title: Comfortable, with a great run time
body:
Sturdy construction, solid sound, and a very long battery life at up to 9 hours. What’s not to love? I got these headphones to use while I’m doing yard work and running, so I wanted them to be durable and stay in place well with a long run time. When I get moving they do have a tendency to need adjustment even with proper earbud sizes which is a little annoying, but they weren’t falling out of my ears so it’s not the worst. As far as the run time goes, it’s top-end for even the best Bluetooth headphones at 9 hours. Beyond that, once you’re out of battery it only takes 1.5-2 hours to get charged to 100% again.

These are very solid headphones, not even just for the low price.

title: These headphones are greate for the gym. Had some ...
body: These headphones are greate for the gym. Had some other more expensive bluetooth ones and barely lasted a couple of months. For the price you cant go wrong with these.

title: A Quality Earphone Set For Exercise
body: I remain impressed with the high quality build and sound quality of these earphones.  My main form of exercise is to complete a daily 10K walk  before seizing the day.  Even after two hours of effort, the earbuds remain comfortable in the ear.  The price point was attractive  and I can enthusiastically recommend this product.

title: Hit the purchase now button!
body: These buds sound fantastic people. I use Sony Bass (corded) which sound great and these beat them in sound and bass.  Range is better than any wireless buds I've had so far. I hate the ear wing thingys so I tossed them, but they give 3 different sizes in both rubber and foam tips. So no problem with fit. Just fantastic buds.

title: Good all around earbuds
body: Second pair of treblab buds. At this price point, you won't find better.

title: I had to rebuy this product
body: I like these headphones but I don't love them. But for the price they are great. I had to rebuy because the ear piece started to wear and I couldn't hear out of it anymore. I only had them for a year. I hope this pair last longer.

title: Well worth the cost
body: These are well worth what they cost. They sound good and are plenty loud for my needs. I use them while I'm working out and I haven't had them come loose very easily. My workouts typically lasts between 75 and 90 minutes and I only need to charge them after every three workouts. My only complaint is that the wire running between earbuds is far too long, but I was able to fix this by folding the cord and securing it with a couple pieces of electrical tape.

title: Light with good sound
body: Not great sound and not great run time. Mine only last around 3 hours of listening. My previous brand lasted 6.....I think I'll go back.

title: Could have been, but wasn't quite right.
body:
Purchased these for ~$20 on a special coupon I saw on Facebook.  I was looking for a set of bluetooth buds to use at work with my computer, instead of using my workout set, and felt these would fit the bill.  Upon receipt, the buds themselves look pretty decently built, except for one of the earpieces that looked a bit deformed.  I plugged them in to USB to charge, and it took over 4 hours for these to go from red to blue.  Tried using them for music, and found that the sound was very treble heavy with very little bass/low end.  I tried using other earpieces to get a better ear fit, but that didn't change the sound quality.  I then linked them to my VoIP application for use as a headset making calls, and the microphone quality made me nearly inaudible on the other end, unless I was yelling (not quite good etiquette for use in an office.)
I was looking forward to having a pair of headphones dedicated to office use so I wouldn't have to drain my gym set, and need to charge them before working out, but I'll have to suck it up and buy a second set of my originals.  Also, a side note, they were a bit dusty for brand new earbuds.

title: Great earbuds!
body: The noise cancellation is very good. I can hear the person I am talking to very clearly and vice versa

title: Terrible longevity
body: Very disappointed In these earbuds. They just stopped working for no apparent reason. First the left ear went out then the until won’t turn on. It won’t last don’t buy it. I threw them in the garbage today and bought Tozo T10.

title: These are the real deal! BASS!
body: I never write reviews, but these things are fantastic. Took me a little bit to get them to fit in my ears properly, but after I did, wow the BASS! Incredible headphones. If you’re on the hunt for a great pair of Bluetooth earbuds at a reasonable price, these are it. Stop looking lol

I ended up returning them because they wouldn't stay in my ears and were not comfortable. The Bluetooth connection was spotty and came in and out. I guess these just weren't a good fit for my ears.

title: Five Stars

title: Amazing
body: Very useful

title: My go-to earbuds
body: This was my 2nd pair of Treblab earbuds, and I would absolutely purchase Treblab audio gear again. They fit comfortably in my ears, and the sound quality was incredible for their size. I couldn't believe the bass levels that came out of them! They paired well with my iPhone, Android (Samsung Galaxy and Google Pixel), and my Windows laptop. When I did have questions about charging and pairing, Treblab support was very responsive and helpful. This is my go-to brand for earbuds, whether I'm in the gym or in the office. The only thing that seems to have a little room for improvement is the audio levels that the mic is able to pic up when I use these to place phone calls.

title: Sounded great

title: Defective Unit! (high chance of getting a defective unit)
body: I purchased this model just a couple of days ago. The left earbud was significantly louder than the right earbud. A couple of friends who ordered this also had the same issue. These might be good earbuds, but there is a high probability that you will receive a defective unit. Now I have to go through the hassle of returning these for no reason. I experted better than treblab considering they are a rising brand. But nope, I am ultimately disappointed. I just recommend spending extra 20bucks and going for a more reliable brand.

title: Great pair of earbuds
body:
Was stuck for the longest time between two pairs of earbuds that were both well-known brands at $100+. Having had a pair of Beats earbuds break on me twice, I wasn't too fond of using them again. I came across these and I'm glad I did.

The sound quality far exceeds that of much more expensive earbuds. The headphones themselves come with several buds so that it should fit your ear. These also hold a charge really well. I'd say I get about 7-8 hours of use before I have to recharge them. My only gripe about these would be the low battery warning. You only have about 15 minutes from the warning to when they die.

title: Three Stars
body: Sounds good. Some Bass is to much for the speakers to handle

title: Mostly excellent
body: 2 complaints are when having it connected to 2 separate devices it continually connects and disconnects. So I only keep it on one. The range isn’t too far but I can handle that. Other than that the sound is excellent so far the build is excellent battery life is excellent comfort is excellent packaging is excellent price is excellent. I have already recommended to others.

title: These are awesome Earphones!
body: I needed something to make sure they stay in during my workouts. I can say they last through at least a week of workouts without having to recharge. Even after low battery warning I can still can use them. They stay in when I'm upside down or moderately cycling. If they don't fit just right, there are other interchangeable pieces to make sure they stay put. Been dry during sweaty workouts,. Like the color signals it gives, red for not on, blue on and connected, blinking both when waiting for Bluetooth connection. Great sound and bass.

title: Oh yeah!
body: Love these headphones! Sound quality I have been searching for a long time. Bass that can make your ear drums feel it and yet highs that cut like a razor. Well worth the money spent and only had to wait 2 days and they at my door step. Battery life is great. Listening to music at max volume for 3 hours plus and never got the alert to charge them! The magnetic ends are a awesome thing. I have lost or damaged a lot of ear buds because of dropping them or getting caught up on something. I wouldn't hesitate to buy these. You are missing out if you don't own a pair!!!!

title: Excellent sound, great value.
body:
The key to getting surprisingly good, balanced sound from this headset is keeping them seated in your ears. That means taking the time to test the headset with different tips on them until they feel well seated and stay in. This set includes two different sets of ear tips, a nice case, and a clip to keep the cable attached to your top.

If they are deep enough in the ear canal, the bass is just right and not overpowering without applying any equalization.

I bought these primarily for listening to music, so I have not tested the microphone to make calls.

The Bluetooth range is excellent and pairing was easy with my iPhone 7 Plus.

I really enjoy the magnetic earbuds; they keep the headset from getting knotted and tangled.

This is a really nice wireless headset for the price, and I managed to get these on a sale that brought the cost down to just under 20 bucks. They look and feel like a much more expensive pair.

title: Two Stars
body: They stick way to far out of my ears.

title: Broke after two months.
body: Everything started off great. Good sound easy to link to. Two months later and now the left side does not work.

title: Finally, some decent bass.
body: I've only been using these for one day, but so far, I love them!  There are so many different size options to choose from in the box, you just have to play around to find the perfect fit for you, and once you do the sound is great.  Good bass and highs for this price range, some of the mids get lost but I'm okay with that because I was looking for decent bass and these deliver. Of course the bass doesn't compare to a large stereo system or even over the ear headphones, but these are far superior to other bluetooth earbuds I have tried. I  tried a few other pairs recently and was starting to think that I was going to have to jump into the higher end price range in order to get the bass I was looking for.  I also like the magnetic feature so that when I stop to talk to someone I don't have to worry about the earbuds falling off.  They stayed in ear for an intense HIIT workout and the case that it came with will travel well I think. The only potential problem I see is that the noise cancelling on these is very effective and may be too much for an outdoor run if I need to be able to hear traffic etc, but for all other activities, these are great!

title: Very happy with the sound quality of these
body: Very happy with the sound quality of these.  I was very surprised on how good the sound was and they are very simple to use with the Bluetooth on my Iphone.

title: Great Sound, Convenient Wear.
body: My second set of headphones by TREBLAB.  A great choice of headphones for people who like to workout with very little background noise. Has pretty solid bass as well. I often wear them outside the gym, because the magnets on the outside of the earbuds make it convenient to just sling around my neck.  They also come with different sizes of earbuds, so be sure to find out what works best for your own comfort. You won't be disappointed.

title: Uncomfortable, and poor quality
body: I was not impressed with these earbuds. They are uncomfortable, and not made to last. After about one month of use my battery would only last one hour. After two and a half months of light use they stopped working all together. Spend more money, get something higher quality.

title: Excellent product matched with excellent after-sales service
body: I’ve had these amazing earphones about a year now. Somehow it stopped pairing with my iPhone and I contacted the Treblab team and without hesitation they sent me a replacement. An excellent product that is matched with exceptional after-sales customer service.

title: You can't beat these under $100
body: No complaints on these at this price point. So many different ear buds, ear retainers, etc. Sounds is good, not great, but for this price??? you cannot complain. I own overly prices bluetooth beats ear buds and I would choose these every time. The magnet feature is great, the battery meter on the phone is great. I would put these at $100+ based off the other crap out there. Not for audiophiles for, but they also aren't $300.

title: Great buy
body: Impressive sound quality, long lasting battery. Great buy indeed. Thank you

title: Five Stars

title: This product is good. I wish l knew this product l wouldn't ...
body: Normally I don't write reviews to me writing review when you just got the product don't make sense. What if the product got messed up within days after writing review. This product is good. I wish l knew this product l wouldn't waste my money in buying Bose. Bass is awesome. Good product.

title: Great earbuds for the money!
body: Item has great sound for the price, item paired up with my phone right away and the sound was some of the best I have heard in earbuds, just the right amount of bass. Also comes with nice case.

title: Great clean sound + Bluetooth
body: Excellent audiophile sound and fit for the price. Very good bass, clean mids, great clean treble. I have other earbuds that cost a lot more that can't match the Treblab J1. Love the Bluetooth. Can't beat these for the price.

title: Two Stars
body: Liked them until they stopped keeping there charge...

title: I'm satisfied, hope this review helps
body:
I had blue ant pumps prior to these and what I liked about those was the battery life, and that was about it, I didnt like the way the fit nor the sound. So I knew what didn't and did want when reading and watching reviews before buying these.

Battery life. I've had these for about a week. I drive a propane truck (I'm in and out of the truck all day), so I needed good battery life (I work 8+ hrs a day) and decent noise cancelling microphone (big trucks have a tendency to be noisy to those on the other end of a call). So far battery life is right around 8hrs. And thats with high usage. The first day I did a  2hr phone call with a buddy, several phone calls from my office, all day listening to Spotify and music on my phone; I turned them on at 8am, they beeped "battery low" about 6p. Btw, you have approx 6 min, from the low battery prompt till it dies.

Noise cancelling mic. The secretaries at my job and my friend say the noise cancelling is pretty good, better than my blue ants.

Sound, is a tad on the bass heavy side. I have a Samsung S7 and use a media player app called Power Amp. It has a 10 band eq. So I was able to tweak the sound to my likings. My S7 also has a stock eq which allows me to tweak the sound outside of my media player app (which helps reduce the bass in voice calls if needed). So don't be alarmed, there are ways to get the sound you want, I wouldn't count being bass heavy  as a  deal breaker.

Range. This is probably the only major draw back I've found so far. Range is about 20ft CLEAR VIEW, meaning absolutely NOTHING in between the ears buds and your phone. If objects are between you and your phone, range is about 10-15ft maybe! I also noticed dependant on my body position, they may crackle as though the connection is not that good, even though my phone is in my rear pocket on the opposite side of the mic. Once I move my phone to the mic side (which is the right ear bud) the crackling stops. I have a smart watch on order so maybe that's a work around to remedy this small issue.

Fit. I have really small ears with large ear canals. They come with a wide array of replacement bud tips. These are the first buds I've used with the foam tips, I love them! The foam tips block out way more background noise vs the rubber imo. They also come with the little rubber things to help the buds stay in your ear.  As I said my ears are super small so, I'm still experimenting with those to get a good fit. (Not a negative thing just a personal issue) One small gripe I do have, which is probably just a personal another thing. The cord is rubber, meaning it grabs my skin on the back of my neck. Causing one earbud to try to pull out depending on which way I turn my head. An idea to remedy this is some type of fabric covering for the wire that lays on the back of my neck.

One thing I love, are the magnets! They keep them in place around your neck when you are not using them. I see in the reviews quite a few broken ones...so far so good for me. If things change I'll update this review.

Syncing to my phone was super easy, just follow the directions that come with them.

Water proof\sweat proof, I can't speak on that, I haven't gotten them wet.

Overall, I'm happy with them and hope they hold up quality wise. I trully believe the only draw back to these buds are they lack range.

I didnt give them 4 or 5 stars not because they aren't good. But because they are a very solid 3 star buy for the price. If they had better range, and A-1 sound (along with all the good qualities they already have) they definitely would be 4 or 5 star ear buds, but they wouldn't cost 40 bucks, they would probably cost double or triple that.

Hope this review helps, I tried to hit the key points that mattered.

Update: it's been several months since my initial purchase. Unfortunately the first pair failed about 3 months after. One of the speakers in the buds blew. I contacted Trelabs via their website and it was hassle free to get them replaced. I received my new ones promptly. Unfortunately it was about another 3 months and that pair failed also. They developed a short in the cable on the right ear bud. I would lose sound in the right ear bud depending on my head position. Again I contacted Trelabs and again hassle free customer service!!! I hope my failures don't deter you from experiencing these value priced ear buds. When working, I'm very satisfied with them. I upped my rating to 4 stars because I've had excellent customer service with Trelabs.

title: GREAT BATTERY LIFE!!!
body: I liked the ear phones I just didn't understand nore like that rubber part above the ear peace. you should have sports ear hooks .

title: Great
body: Great bluetooth headphones.

title: Top Quality Low Price
body: Amazing wireless earbuds. They connect to Bluetooth on the iPhone almost instantaneously. The bass the pitch and the overall sound quality are just fantastic. I would expect the same from some of the big names in the industry, move over Beats, Bose, Apple you have competition that undersells you. I am looking for this brand going forward for any of my tech purchases.

title: Four Stars

Just only one thing, the cables should has a kind of glue that can keep it firm at the board because fail easily,

title: Poor battery longevity
body: There were really good headphones for the few months they lasted. Sound was good and good materials, however after only about two or three months, the battery was no longer able to hold a charge and would die after just 15 to 20 minutes of use despite charging for a normal amount of time. This could have been an isolated incident, but ai would still be cautious of these earphones.

title: Good earphones
body: Use it when I run. It can stay in my ear without falling. The price is good.

title: Great quality great product
body: For the price of around $30 you get a very premium feeling and comfortable pair of Bluetooth headphones. The quality of sound and the battery life is very impressive and I am very happy with my order.

title: They Stay Put !!
body: These are great earbuds.  I use them while riding a motorcycle and they work awesome.

title: Easy to break
body: While I liked the fact that these were bluetooth and they connected well to both my computer and my phone, after a while they started having trouble turning on or disconnecting when I wanted to switch devices. The biggest problem, however, is the fact that the right side has died because the wires inside were torn. I will admit I'm not the best at taking care of headphones but I thought that them being bluetooth would help with how much the cord got tugged when I use them. Additionally, I thought they would last longer than this compared to other headphones I have used.  I guess at this point I should try buying completely wireless earbuds.

title: Sound quality wasn't what I expected. Returned them.
body: Build quality was good, wires were a little thin. Sound quality wasn't all there. I returned them for Anker ones. So much better than these Treblab.

title: I use them primarily for listening to lectures and speeches but music sounds good to. Plenty of ear pieces so its no ...
body: Love'em ! I use them primarily for listening to lectures and speeches but music sounds good to. Plenty of ear pieces so its no prob finding a comfortable fit. I only wish they came with a clip on so when one side is removed it won't pull the other side .

title: Very Happy! with my purchase of the Treblab J1 headphones
body:
Excellent! headphones. Very good sound. I always have issues with earbuds fitting in my tiny ears, and the extra hook thingy makes all the difference for me.
My only main issue I personally have with them is the controls and mike are placed a little bit too high for my taste.
I think if the controls and more importantly, the mike was a little bit lower and closer to my mouth the other end of my phone calls may be a little bit clearer for the person I am on the phone with. While at the same time, I have had several phones calls with them. with only one complaint so far of them not being able to hear me clearly. this was fixed by my re-adjusting the mikes position.

title: Treblab J1
body: I like the amount of choices for the ear pieces. Once I figured out what I liked best I turned them on. They connected immediately. The sound is rich and very enjoyable. I’m not big on the thumping bass so these are perfect for me. The music is great and listening to audio books and podcasts are great too. Excellent product. Hopefully they really are sweat resistant ... we shall see

title: Five Stars
body: Great product. I am very happy with the sound quality and the ease of functionality paired with my Iphone.

title: Sound and fit...
body: I like treblab, I have the xr500 earbuds and they work good. I like the fact that they are water resistant and I can wear them when it rains and have no worries. The J1 can be challenging to fit because they either slip out, or you can use the foam tips and feel the sharp edges rub against your ears. It is hard to get a comfortable fit. Once that has been figured out, the lack of bass and balance is disappointing. A shame because these are ipx6 and have a 9 hour battery life. Unfortunately, they are not comfortable enough to wear that long or listen to because of the sound.

title: Good buy for the money
body: They fit securely in my ears and the sound quality is very good for the price.

title: Good Sound But Feel Weird In My Ear
body:
Giving these 4 stars because they are pretty good ear buds but feel weird in my ear.

Nice sound - similar to the ear buds that came with my iPhone.  Noise cancelling works ok (not as good as Active Noise Cancelling on Bose or even Treblab's over-the-ear phones) & makes the office environment nice.

I like the magnetic power to keep these together around my neck when not wearing them (so they do not flop around).

I am not a huge fan of ear buds because I never feel comfortable wearing them & prefer over the ear headphones.  These, however, seemed even more uncomfortable and cumbuersome, as if bigger or a different shape than cheaper earbuds.  If you can get over that, these are a very nice pair for the price.

title: Great earbuds
body:
Just stop working, very lightly use.
Do not recommend.

title: Good Value
body: For the price, you get a really great product. Only drawback for me is the battery life. In comparison to the wireless Beats, the battery seems to die a bit quicker. However for the price, it’s a good buy.

title: great bass, and volume
body: These ear buds are phenomenal, great bass, and volume, shake proof. Also I get a solid 7 hours of music playback full volume. The magnet on the back of these make it easy to keep them around your neck. Recharge takes less than 2 hours for me normally, if I use a wall charger. A great buy, price is definitely justified.

title: I loved them while I had them
body: I loved them while I had them. The bass was very deep and punchy, and did not interfere with the mids or highs. The mids and highs were quite crisp and clear. The sound never mixed or sounded distorted and chewy when they were at full volume.

title: do not work with Siri
body: The quality is pretty good, but these do not work with Siri.

title: I strongly advise everyone to avoid these earbuds. I ...
body:
I strongly advise everyone to avoid these earbuds.  I bought them to use while exercising or working the yard & at first were ok.  After the first month they started shutting down w/ a full charge, failing to take a charge & activating my Google asst on their own.

I'll avoid all TREBLAB products in the future.

title: Best esr buds
body: Love these ear buds. Great noise cancelation and comfortable to wear. The magnet ends are toltally awesome

title: Not for smaller ears
body: While these sound fine, they are very uncomfortable for small ears.  I cannot keep them in for any length of time.

title: Very stylish bluetooth earbuds, love them!
body: Very stylish bluetooth earbuds, love them! Especially magnets, that hold the earphones together around my neck when not using them.

title: Excelente
body: Excelente

title: Amazing Product
body: The earbuds are amazing. I am a student and use them when walking from class to class. As well as P.E. these earbuds are definetely worth the price. The earbuds feel great after you get used to wearing them. The ear sizes are great. The overall sound quality is just superb. The noise cancelling comes in handy when i'm surrounded by 20+ students talking at once. I highly recommend getting these earbuds. For the price you're getting so much.

title: Excellent bluetooth headphones
body: I have had so many Bluetooth headsets since I bought the moto z. This is by far the best sounding, most comfortable and easiest to pair set I've owned. I have been through dozens and I'm 100% satisfied with these. Treblab will be my go to for future Bluetooth purchases. Battery life is on par with Apple and way less expensive.

title: Really Love it. Great sound and battery life
body:
Really Love it. Great sound and battery life. Only thing which I dont like is quality of wire, its not very good and flexible.
But still good to have it :)

title: Good
body:
These are good headphones but they are not waterproof
They stay put very well and almost no noise comes in from the sorounding

title: Best headphones I've ever had
body: The sound is just great, nice deep bass that will make you smile. I'm using these for work and the sound reduction is awesome. They don't move at all and with all the fitment pieces you will find the perfect fit

title: could be good if it lasted longer
body: microphone went out after 10 mo

title: Made for giants.
body:
Great low end sound, exactly what I was looking for. You can get better sound but this is right where it should be on price point.

That being said, these were designed for huge ears. I don't have freakishly small ears or anything, I usually use the medium size pads. I might be returning for this reason unfortunately.

The magnetic was another feature I was looking for so you don't have to worry about them falling off your neck.

The bass is so kicking you cannot crank these up.

title: There ok
body: They do work the sound is good but not great. Bass is ok, I got these for work but I wear a hoodie and they stick out far  Enough for the hoodie to hit them. So they come out a little.  In the description says it shows battery percent on my Samsung 8 plus it does not

title: very poor bass sound
body: My expectations in terms of sound quality was higher than the present quality. very poor bass sound, very low sound volume. The battery life is very good. let's see how much time I can enjoy this headset at the GYM

title: Happy.
body: Very Happy with product. Sound is good and the charge holds.

title: I did a lot of research
body: before I finally settled on Treblab J-1 bluetooth earbuds.  I've had them now since November 2018 and they continue to work well.  Excellent sound quality.  I especially appreciate the bass.  The range is extraordinary.  I've left my phone in the house and gotten halfway down our backyard before connection started to cut out.  I'd guess that was about 30 feet.  They pair easily and quickly with bluetooth car systems and with my iPhone 8 plus.  I'm not a gym rat, but I have walked to work in mist and rain, getting a bit wet in the process, and they still work as well as when I first got them.  Overall, very pleased with this brand and the performance of these headphones.  Excellent value for the money.

title: Five Stars
body: Great sound quality and battery life. The shipping was very fast.

title: TREBLAB J1 Bluetooth Earbuds
body:
These are the first Bluetooth earbuds I've owned and I'm happy with my purchase so far. Upon receiving I charged them as instructed until the red light turned blue, about an hour and 15 minutes, then powered  on and connected them to my phone as instructed with no problem.  One of my biggest concerns before purchasing was the sound quality on both ends of a phone call.
I've had had no complaints on the receiving end (multiple calls daily) by anyone that leads me to believe the call is of poor quality and they sound as good as corded ear buds on my end.  I started an audio book to play at 100% volume (not wearing) to see how long the battery would last and got 7 hours and 5 minutes before they died. My only complaint is that the instructions said if I over charge the unit, the battery life will decrease, so I took off 1 star.  I would give this 5 stars if the charging stopped on its own if I couldn't unplug them. I would highly recommend these.

Update Jan 14, 2019 after having two pair for over a year and loving them, they both had one side go out. I read there's a lifetime warranty on these so I contacted the company and they sent me 2 replacement pair. I didn't even have to ship the bad ones back they just asked me to cut the cord on them and send a picture of them destroyed. Great customer service.

title: Great headphones
body: These sound great, are comfortable and last forever on a charge.

title: Worth every cent
body: Really are enjoying these headphones. Bought 2 pair 1 for me and 1 for the wife. They work great at the gym they stay in during lifting exercising and the cardio we do.

title: Beware of the loose bass!
body:
Purchased them more than a month ago. Was looking for good sound , decent comfort and good battery life that wtould last 8 hours to get me through the working day. I own two pairs of Jabra, one of Sony, one JayBird, another pair of Treblab. I’m not going to write an endless review going into all the small details. Let’s just say that the build quality is good, the comfort is good too.
When it comes to sound, well this is it’s Achiles anklet! I’m not sure what genre of music do you have to listen to for the bass to sound good. It’s overpowering, loose and tiresome. To best describe it is to imagine trying to listen to music through a bass heavy cinema theater system! Highs are not much better either. Dull and not crisp at all. You could fiddle with all the eq presets on your player as much as you want, you will not be able to achieve a balanced sound where the bass is punching but tight, mids are natural and the highs precise and crisp.
Like I said, I do have another pair of Treblab and they sound just the same. I thought in the meantime that they have progressed and did some work in that respect but it looks like this is their signature sound and that’s about it.
I think the name Basslab would probably be better to the true nature of the product than Treblab. Would I buy it again? Not without trying that’s for sure.
Add on. Quite a bit of time has passed since writing all of the above. The earphones have connection issues by cutting in and out. Have run some trouble shooting but the result is the same. So I guess the no matter the price, they are not worth the hassle.
I’ve given up on them.

title: Won't stay in ears
body: The earbuds were too heavy and wouldn't stay in my ears at all. I never even tried the sound quality because they wouldn't stay in long enough to give it a shot.

title: Value to your money
body: The sound effect is amazing, yet with an outstanding grip onto the ears.

title: Great and the price is amazing!
body: I love these so far. Great sound quality, pairing was easy, call quality and clarity was great as well. I am not a lover of ear buds, but these are the first I've liked. Having bigger ears I appreciate all the sizes and the foam bud option as well. I'll buy these again.

title: UPGRADED TO FIVE STARS
body:
EDITED 08/24/19

Why upgrade to a five star rating? Excellent customer service in a world that rarely cares, and a replacement product that really hit the mark.
Trelab contacted me and replaced with TRELAB XR700.

These are a great value.

I have waited almost a week to post my revised review. I used them:

✓All day at work, for 3 days
✓In the garden
✓Heavy yard work in 100 degree weather
✓walked 11k trying to impress my
  Pokemon Go loving kid. Didn't impress the
  kid, but the wireless earbuds made it a
  pleasure.

30 foot range - no problem at all, I'm pretty sure I strayed further than that. This is important to me because it's still hitting 110 here and I have to leave the phone in the house or it'll overheat in a matter of minutes if I leave it in my pocket.

Great sound - I'm really pleased. My test songs were Thunderstruck by 2Cellos, followed by the AC/DC version. I got all the highs, all the lows, all the juice.

Pairing was so simple.

They fit well. I have small ear canals: the soft wire around-the-ear support is very reassuring. There are many fittings included, both firm and soft. I wear one of each so I can still hear the world around me if I choose.

Battery time was all they claimed, a full workday, recharge with their short ribbon connector was two hours or less.

I did sweat, it did not falter.

At one point, first thing in the morning, they stuttered for a few moments. I re-paired them and it stopped stuttering. It hasn't done that again.

So hey, I really put them through these places and they did not disappoint. Great value for the price.

title: great value.  recommend.
body:
These are great!  I received my first pair of treblabs xr100s as a gift and loved them.  Unfortunately, I lost them. I got this set as a replacement. These are a step up as far as sound, volume control, fit/ comfort, and waterproofness.  I have not tested the waterproofness of either of them. The sound is quite good and the noise cancelling is almost too good for my needs. The microphone is excellent for phone calls.
There is one thing that I would like the Treblab people to consider for the next model.  Please, do an automatic shut-off feature.  These headphones are easy to accidentally leave on or turn on when I'm putting them away.

title: Five Stars
body: Fantastic sound for the price.

title: Work pretty well overall
body: Earbuds are good overall.  It took a little while to get the earbuds to fit best in the ear, but once I got it, they fit and stay pretty well.  I've gone on two runs of 30 minutes each with these earbuds, and the first time, they worked well, but the second time, the music didn't sound good whenever I took a step.  While wearing the earbuds inside and mostly stationary, earbuds are very good, and block out most noises.  Earbuds also block out some of the noise while running outside.

title: Great product, great support
body:
I loved these earbuds and purchased a third pair (lost first one, second one was stolen at the gym).  I use them regularly for work and workouts.  Great sound and perfect fit- Apple earbuds don't fir my ears at all.  Love the magnetic connector that keeps them secure around my neck when not in use.
Third pair had a problem after eight months- one earpiece started shorting out.  Within minutes they were corresponding with me and promised me a replacement headset.  Thanks for your prompt and efficient support and service.

title: Great price

title: Good product
body: Good quality product and sound. Range from phone is around 20-30 ft. I use it for hiking and work occasionally.

title: i don't know guys
body: I got a pair but it was hard to keep them in my ears.  THe adaptes don't work well.

title: Only good for light jogs!
body:
Pros: good sound quality, good battery life and easy to set up. Decent noise cancellation. The ends have magnets which comes in handy when you start doing intense workouts. Since they won’t stay in, it’s best to just wrap them around your neck.
Cons: right side stopped working after 2 months. The headphones are a bit heavy. They would stay in during light jogs but would immediately fall out during more intense runs. Call quality was awful!
Overall: I would not buy these headphones again.

title: Great sound quality
body: Great sound quality; able to block out annoying chit chat in the train.  I can enjoy my music as I commute to/fro work.  The ear buds are too big though and I have to keep pushing them in as they tend to fall off when I turn my head.

title: Good Enough Ear Piece
body: It's definitely not noise cancellation - it's noise isolation.  The sound quality is ok, BT is easy and fast to pair with my Galaxy S9+.  Works as expected.  The quality of the rubber 'buds' are a little lacking - rubber a bit too stiff making the fit feels odd (perhaps its only me).  Didn't use it for workout, so cant say much of it during activity.

title: Great bluetooth
body: The sound and quality  is great. Should have bought one for the wife when they were on sale .Update great customer  service.

title: Great sound and barttery life
body: Good sound, great battery, pretty comfortable they don't fall out, just wish they were a little smaller but thats being nit pickey. They are durable I wear them at work all day long 10 hours a day 6 days a week. Will update if anything changes

title: sound profile is fairly balanced
body:
I use these at my office desk job and while jogging. I haven't used the microphone and I don't use these near or in water.

That being said, these are good and worth the money. The J1's sound profile is fairly balanced and the aptX support makes music sound crisp and high resolution for what these cost. The battery will pretty much last a whole work day of 6 to 8 hours. The design is simple and easy to clean. Fit and comfort are good, but not the greatest. The provided set of interchangeable eartips and fins definitely help, but I find noise isolation is still lacking and the J1s still might fall out during an intense running session, especially with the cord dragging and weighing down the whole unit.

title: Not satisfied with this product
body: Im writing back to u cause I'm super super upset & dissatisfied about this product today I went to work like usual & turned my head phones on to start working & suddenly I saw smoke coming out of head & head phones were super hot so I rapidly took them off & threw them cause I got scared thinking da they were gonna catch on fire they burned little bit of my hair need a phone number from who ever is making this headphones & to who I can speak in regards to this matter this is da second pair da I get but others just stopped working or only one worked but never something this serious like catching on fire on my neck😡 my number is 956 777 4522 need some answers asap or a phone number thank u

title: Refunded after multiple replacements failed in the same way.
body:
Worked great for the last 6 months.  Then the volume in the left earpiece all but disappeared.

Support has been responsive and replaced the headphones several times.  Unfortunately, they don't last.  After a month or so they no longer hold and charge and then don't turn on at all.

I should have asked for a refund instead of getting a replacement each time.  These headphones simply don't last.

Customer service finally refunded the purchase.  Initially I was told they could not, so I went with replacements.  But the replacements didn't last even as long as the original pair.

title: Good sound
body: Great product clear crisp sound good battery life and great sleek design and for the price you can’t go wrong

title: Five Stars
body: Great sounding earbuds!

title: Slick ergonomics, very good sound and focus on consumer satisfaction at a budget price
body: For a modest price, I purchased the TREBLAB J1 Bluetooth Earbuds to be able to take advantage of an upgraded android cell phone and reliably listen to music (without the wire) during gym workouts. I paid twice the price for other Bluetooth headphones for the same purpose, they died after 1.5 years, so I decided to economize. I read many reviews and decided that the ergonomics of the J1's suited me the best, and favorable buyer reviews, although mixed, had much to say for these earbuds. I have opened them, charged them, and tried them out at home, and they seem to measure up to my expectations. The audio is good enough to make me happy not to have spent 3 to 4 times as much on high-performance audio equipment. I cannot evaluate the telephone connectivity since I am retired and have rare occasion to chat, unless my spouse of 46 years has a flat tire and needs to contact me. I think TREBLAB has zeroed in with focus and dedication to consumer satisfaction on a market that seeks music and phone service at moderate cost in the sweaty exercise arena. The tech support service sounds outstanding from all reports, so I look forward to a fine experience with this product, founded admittedly on a very modest investment. I would add that if you buy them, do read the instructions provided since so many customer complaints could have been avoided by referencing the enclosed instructions and trouble-shooting tips. “Handle with care” is probably another worthwhile recommendation since $40 does not pay for bullet-proof goods.

title: I would like to thank personally to Dmytro from Productech who solved ...
body:
I would like to thank personally to Dmytro from Productech who solved my problem and took care of me.
Very Good product and great sound.

body: The sound is a little tinny but I got used to it. It has stopped working properly and needs to be replaced  but don't know how to make it happen.

title: good sound for price
body: High quality, good sound for price

title: One Star
body: 3rd day of use the left side stopped working... what a pain!

title: Better-than-average earbuds for a great price
body:
Sound: Bass is present, not very punchy or muddy, above average for the price. Mids/vocals are clear but lack depth and definition. Treble is average, doesn't sound tinny or piercing.

Build quality: Cable is sturdy as well as the volume rocker. The buttons don't feel like they're gonna fall off and don't wiggle much either. The headphones have some satisfying heft to them, the metal assures that they should last. The carrying case is very tough but soft to the touch, the inside is smooth and cozy.

Battery: ~6 hours of use on my first day, don't need to worry about running out of juice.

Comfort:
-UPDATE-
I believe I found the correct position in how these should be put in. I feel no discomfort and they slide in easily. Unfortunately, my right ear canal is smaller than my left, the silicone and foam small tips don't fit too well. However, this isn't the company's fault. Fit and comfort are good, you have to play around with it.
-END OF UPDATE-
 I have a small head with small ears, these are EXTREMELY uncomfortable. The metal rings that surround the wings constantly irritate my ears and they become red afterwards. After ~20 minutes it becomes painful and I have to take them off. I've tried the smallest silicone, foam and wing tips and they hardly help. I've also tried multiple positions and the one that hurts the less is where they feel as if they're about to fall off. Headphones of the that are oval or rounded are infinitely more comfortable since there are no sharp edges and everything is smoothed out.

I really wanted to love these headphones since I was content with most of its features, however, as someone who goes to the gym 6 days a week for 2 hours (lifting and light cardio), I can hardly recommend these headphones. If I'm feeling PAIN from my headphones, there's a grand flaw. I'll try these out for a week or so to see if things change (most likely to return). I will update this review if anything significant happens.
-UPDATE-
Changed my review from a 3 to a 5. Not only did I find these comfy to wear, but when I posted my review, soon after I was contacted by customer service (Lena) who made sure that my needs were met. Good fit deserves 1+ star, good customer service gets another star. If you're on the edge of buying this device, make the jump, there's no harm trying as you can receive a refund.

title: sound is awesome especially for the price
body: sound is awesome especially for the price. I would compare the sound quality to a $100 pair of headphones. I like them so far but I just got them yesterday so i will update my review in a couple months to see.how they wear over time.

title: Steer clear, overall disappointment
body: Worked decent for a few months. None of the silicone sizes really fit very well. Sound quality is just OK. Recently I've started getting a hissing sound and can't connect to my phone. Signal strength is weak - in and out when the phone is in my back pocket, better in front pocket, fine on my desk in front of me. But if I wanted to use it right in front of me I'd just buy wired headphones. Don't waste your time with these. Had high hopes, got what I paid for I guess. I've had other inexpensive sets that worked much better.

title: Great set of earphones
body: These earphones are some of the best I have ever had, the sound quality is amazing alone, and when paired with the airtight system of blocking out any background noise, they are arguably better than most headphone 4-core drivers. The battery life is also good, I find that they retain their charge pretty well so they don't really need charging that often. However, if you are looking for a pair of earphones for working out, then there is a small problem, which is that the connecting wire of the 2 buds tends to bang around a lot and the vibrations will drown out whatever you're listening to, although this can be fixed by attaching the wire to your collar with a clip or anything really. One last thing as well, due to the connector wire being flat and relatively short, it doesn't get tangled much/ at all so you don't have to waste your time furiously untangling them.

title: Lasted only 2 months
body: CONSTANTLY fell out of my ears while working out. Also stopped working after 2 months. Waste of money.

title: So glad I made the purchase
body: I have an iPhone7. I had no trouble pairing with my phone. I've only had the earbuds about a week but have used them multiple times with no problem. One caveat - I use them to listen to podcasts and talks on YouTube. I'm not using them to listen to music but the sound is very clear for my choice of use. Sometimes I'm walking where there is traffic and it's hard to hear. I haven't taken the time to try out different ear buds so that might change the situation. Have just been using the ones that were installed when I received them. Overall I'm very pleased.

title: Short battery life, but outstanding customer support!
body:
Sound quality is very good, but the battery lasts only about 2 hours while playing music.

Edit: I was pleasantly surprised when Treblab contacted me after they read my original review. They offered me a new pair of earbuds and promptly sent it out. I've already received them, but have not yet had a chance to test them. I'll post more after the test. However, I must say that it is very refreshing to deal with a company that cares about the customer this much. It's been a pleasure dealing with them.

title: Five Stars
body: Great fit. Does not fall out of my ear and the sound quality is stellar.  Treblab J1 don't disappoint!

title: because the music sounded pretty good.
body: The volume buttons on the earbuds do not effect the volume on the actual phone, so this causes big issues when also trying to use these for making phone calls, as you never really know what the volume is on the phone and no one can hear me, nor can I hear anyone else talking! Its just lazy, on the part of the manufacture to not make sure this feature integrated. Bummer, because the music sounded pretty good.

title: works great
body: great sound quality

title: Disappointed
body: I was excited for these headphones when they first got to my house. I opened up the box and took them out and immediately turned them on. When I started playing music on them I realized it was only coming out of the left ear. So I figured maybe it just needs to be charged. I charged them and turned them back on to find out that the right ear was still not playing anything. Disappointed that from right out of the box these headphones were broken.

title: Can't get warranty
body: Bought in May. Quit working. Return window option closed. So much for 1 year warranty.

title: Four Stars
body: Work well- great value

title: Worth the price
body: I liked everything about it. It was exactly what I wanted.

title: Bass Bass Bass!!!
body: If you care about the bass these headphones are for you.

title: Awesome budget headphones
body: Love these headphones. Can’t go wrong with a Bluetooth pair of earbuds for under $50. Comes with a really nice zip case, other ear bud sizes, and other ear fin sizes. Great sound quality too especially the bass. Really great for the money.

title: great sound quality/noise canceling
body: I'm still getting used to wearing the earbuds. They tend to fall out; maybe I haven't figured out how to properly insert them. They are great for listening to music. Also great for using as a phone receiver. It does cancel out noise which helps when trying to talk to someone. It comes with a cute case which holds the various sizes so you can adjust the fit. Having it around the neck is a bit awkward at times but it just takes getting used to. I do like it and would buy it again. it has great sound quality/noise canceling. just struggling with the fit.

title: Amazing for the price
body: These are replacing my jaybird X3. They sound almost exactly alike for one third of the price. The only thing I would change on these is that I wish the earbud itself entered the ear canal on an angle. They stick out a bit from my ears and gives that Frankenstein look. And maybe replace that weird Cable Management clip with a cinch cord. Those are just small grapes for the price. Don't waste your time with overpriced bose or jaybird. Durability is the only question and I have not had them long enough to determine

title: These headphones are great in that they don't slide out of your ears ...
body:
These headphones are great in that they don't slide out of your ears when they get wet from rain or sweat & they don't make jostling noise while running. My previous pair of a different brand were terrible with jostling, slipping out of my ears & sound cutting in & out. The Treblab phones don't do any of those things. They are very solid.
My only complaint is that the sound is a little tinny but at least it doesn't cut in & out.
Overall, they are serving their purpose for me & the price is very reasonable!

title: Three months later and they’re useless!!

**UPDATE**
After my review I was contacted by email by the tech team at TreLab. Igor was very helpful in giving me troubleshooting techniques and when they didn’t work he issued me a replacement. 👍🏾👍🏾
Very Happy Now.

I bought these to use at work and the gym. The sound is good, I liked what little noise cancelation they provided (w/foam earbuds) but as other reviews stated, the foam earbuds just crumbled apart, then the week or so later the Bluetooth stopped pairing. It would pair for a minute or two then drop. Every time I’d press the Play/On button it would start over from beginning. I’ve had these for 3 months!.

title: Five Stars

title: They are good but they didn't last.
body: I used this product for music and streaming movies. The product worked fine for about 3 and 1/2 months but then srarted to lose sound on 1 speaker. It feels like one of the cables is losing contact, and there's no power going through it. I rarely took them out of the house. I did like them at first. I was getting at least 6-7 hours, and the sound cancelation was great. So great that I was afraid to wear them outside. It's just sad that they stopped working. I never contacted the company. I'm still looking for another set. I just returned the Mpow headsets, the TBI Pro, and about to return the Enacfire e19.  I also purchased one from Walmart called skullcandy jib which sound so so but they have a thick oval ball that sits on top of my neck that's a pain in the butt. I just wish those treblab j1 were working because they were pretty good.

title: Honest Review of an Audiophile
body:
Honest Review of an Audiophile:

Sound Quality:
Scale of 1-10: 8

Review:
Well the reviews and company don't lie about the sound quality of these. The sounds are well balanced, lows are low, mids are mids, highs are good. These do have bass, but is somewhat lacking, just a bit. Bass isn't a huge deal to me, as I'm not a bass-head, so it's not a deal breaker. The vocals are also great, clear and easy to understand. Generally I listen to rock and hard rock music, so for earphones it's a big deal for me. Depending on the song, the instrumental parts may get a bit heavy and overpower the vocals, but it's not a big deal, and is an easy fix with an equalizer.

Calling and bluetooth are also great. Easily able to hear the other person on the other line, and they can easily hear me, even in wind.

Build Quality:
Scale of 1-10: 7

Review:
Durability and build quality are good. The headphones are made of metal and plastic parts. I don't really know what else to say besides that I believe they'll last awhile if I take care of them. The end parts are a magnetic metallic composition that hold the earphones together when you place them together for safe storage / when they are around your neck.

Noise Isolation:
Scale of 1-10: 9

Review:
These really do isolate background / outside noise. I used these today in several loud instances.

1.) In gym - Blocked out all noise of others around me, blocked out the music that was playing in the gym, even with music off (in earphones) they still isolated some noise, sort of like ear plugs.

2.) On bus - Loud bus engine was not able to be heard at all, traffic was not heard, people were not heard.

3.) In heavy wind - Wind did not bypass these, they even blocked out the wind and stayed in my ears.

4.) In busy store - While in walmart, blocked out all outside noise and only heard my music.

Price to Overall Value:
Scale of 1-10: 10

Review:
For $36, you really can't get a better pair of bluetooth headphones. Treblab is all about quality over hype, they sell at realistic prices and sell you quality rather than hype and brand name. For $36 you get the headphones, a carrying case, 2 types of earphone tips (Silicone - 3 sizes: S, M, L) (Expandable Foam - 3 sizes: S, M, L), 2 sizes of Ear Fins, Charging Cable (Micro USB // Android), and a free Treblab sticker.

title: Sound quality and signature are pretty decent, however, they need to provide bigger earbuds and tips
body:
Sound is not bad and so as the volume level.  Some reviewers said that it has very loud volume level, but according to my testing, it is just par with other bluetooth earbuds that I have owned.  And as far as sound signature is concerned, it is pretty good.  Everything is very clear and precise.  The bass is not overwhelmed (personally, I do not like boomy bass) and mid & high are clear.
However, the biggest issues that I got from this earbuds are "fitting" of the earbuds / wing tips into my ears.
Perhaps my ears are big. But even with the large ear tips, they are too small to block out the noises and the ear wing tips are also too small that they are keep coming out of my ear which bothers me a lot.

I like the design and they are light.  I have not tested the battery life yet, but if it truly gives full 8 hours in 70% volume, it is a pretty decent earbuds.

title: Love it!
body: Great earbuds. Comes with different sized buds so that you can find the right fit. Solid quality sound. The bass could be slightly fuller and the treble could be just crisper but that is my personal taste so it is not a deal breaker. In fact, for the price, this is a fine product. Bluetooth pairing is easy. I would highly recommend these earbuds.

title: Great battery life, but didn't last long before they broke!
body:
Battery life is great, but after owning it for a month, the right earbud shorted out. Pretty disappointing. It should not have broken so soon.
Edited: after posting this initial 2 star review, a representative from the company contacted me wishing to replace the defective earbuds. It was all very quick and I'm happy to say they are working wonderfully. I'm actually excited to try their wireless earbuds as well, really great products and customer service!

Edited again 10.28.18- pretty disappointed overall with these products. I received the replacement and it worked well for 2 months, then the SAME THING HAPPENED!! They don't even remotely work now.  I'm very disappointing about it.
Edited again 11/18/18.- Although I am disappointed about the fact that these broke, their customer service is pretty outstanding. They are very big on making things right with their customers, which is definitely lacking in most companies these days. They offered me a replacement, credit for a new item, or a full refund.  I took the full refund. I hope that they can figure out the issue with these earbuds, because I really do like the company. Looking forward to seeing what else they have for their product line.

title: I have had 8 pairs of these and they all failed the same way
body:
Update July 2019.

I have bought 4 pairs of these in the last 2 years.  Every pair has been replaced under their 1 year warranty and they all failed the exact same way in the same place.  I believe I have even had to exchange at least one of  the warranty replacements they sent to me as well so that would be 9 pairs of these at least that failed in the same way.

Every failure started with the earpiece that has the controller dangling from it, cutting in and out.  And I have had a desk job this entire time so I am not out running in these or doing any activities really while wearing these  When the earpiece cuts out I push up on the wire going into the earpiece and it miraculously starts working while I am holding it. Then if I let go it constantly cuts in and out again.  Keep in mind there is no visible damage to these.  There are no cuts, or nicks in the outer wire shield. The wires are not visible. This is an internal break in the wires or something to do with the connection from the wires to the circuit board.

The last failure I had was 2 weeks ago. I received my replacement pair. I took them out of the case and charged them up. I put them back in case without using them and  a day or 2 later I took them out of the case to use them for the first time.  I sat in the airport lounge waiting for my plane, removed the earbuds, paired them to my phone and %^$$%$  if the exact same cutting in and out wasn't happening on a never before used set of earbuds.  I was so ticked off.  I ended up going through my 9 days of vacation with one working earbud and then sent them back to Amazon since I had just got them.

To Treblab's credit, their customer service is excellent and they ship me out a new set right away every time.  But this exact same failure, 100 percent of the time, is not acceptable and they are failing to address it.

************************************************************************************************************************************
Update about 9 months later,.........
I see they changed their advertised time to 6 hours instead of what used to be 9. The 6 hours is pretty much what I was getting.

The other day one of the earbuds stopped working. The other was working fine so it was easy to determine the wiring going into the one earbud was defective. Customer service was fantastic with quick response times to my email. They have a lifetime warranty. They wanted me to cut the earbud wire in half akd send them a picture to show it is no longer usable and also I don't have to ship it back to them. They have already shipped me a replacement.  This all happened within a day of notifying them.

#####################s

I can't stand the way they just hang on my neck.  Irritating as hell really.  The fit in the ear is pretty solid and I have tried all the various sizes of ear pieces and retainer pieces but it still makes my ear sore.

They advertise like 8 or 9 hours use but I get about 6 and for some reason I get it cutting out a lot with my phone only a few feet away.  Maybe it is interference I don't know but these seem to have more interference than other bluetooth devices I have used.

Once you turn them on they connect to my phone quickly.  I have made several phone calls and I can hear clearly and I asked people on the other end and they say they can hear me fine as well.

Pros..connects quick. Has a large assortment of earpieces and retaining pieces for a custom fit.  Long battery life but not the advertised life.  Sounds ok and works well for calls.

Cons. Too much interference or cutting out or whatever you call it.  Just a bad design with this hanging on  your neck. WTF

title: Doesn’t fit smaller ear canals
body:
Pros:
Strong Magnetic buds that hold around your neck when not in use.
Easily pairable, and strong connection.
Pairing stays in phone memory and all I have to do is turn the buds on, and my phone automatically turns on Bluetooth and connects.
Memory foam ear buds that fit well for sound isolation.
Cons:
The wing that fits into your ear cartilage is too wide for smaller ears. I have to bend it to stay.
The same ear wing sits too far from the ear-bud; I have to painfully jab the bud into my ear canal to get the wing close enough to sit in my ear cartilage.
I did box-jumps and the weight of the buds kept pulling the buds out of my ear. Won’t stay seated.

Overall good buds for larger ears, but does Not fit or work well for mine. (Yes I am using the small buds and wings. I’m an adult male, 5’10” with an average head)

What lacked from my X3 was the bass. This one covered really well at that frequency. Only thing that was a little bit of a concern was the cover for the USB on the remote. Mine came and it would never shut flush. It will find it's way out to unsnug itself from the port. Also, the plastic part that is used to shorten the cord did not do its job so I just let it dangle behind my neck. No a problem but it would be nicer if they have a better piece to shorten the length. Earbuds came in 2 different types. I like using the memory foam one (sorry forgot the name) as it snugs in your ears and don't even have to use the wings to have it stay in the ear canal.  For the price, this unit is golden.

title: Sound lovers rejoice. These can hang with any music you play.
body:
These are possibly the best headphones I've ever owned, including my Bose over-ear headphones.
I got these for listening to music at work, and they are amazing. They block out all the outside noise (people have to wave at me before I know they're talking to me!).
The sound is perfect, especially for bass lovers. These have a great, well sculpted sound that I've never found in ear buds. I listen to a lot of trap and dubstep, and these headphones can deliver in spades.
They are heavier than most earbuds (need it to provide the sound quality I guess) so you notice them in your ears a bit more if you keep them in for long periods like I do.
I have not used them for running or working out, so I can't speak to how well they stay in during rigorous activity.
I have also not taken any calls on them, so I cannot speak to the microphone quality.

Overall, these are fantastic headphones, and I've been incredibly impressed with them.
