title: Good model; requires some charging management; mine broke.
body:
On the upside, these are well designed:
 - fit well in my ear
 - click 'on' wait a moment, and a voice in your ear says 'power on' - simple and easy to understand
 - good sound
 - good noise isolation
 - appropriate length cable
 - nice indicator of battery life in the phone's bluetooth icon
etc

on the downside, the charging is difficult because:
 - the manual says something like 'overcharging will diminish battery life', so there's no leaving it overnight to charge
 - the plug isn't exactly easy (sometimes you plug in and charging doesn't start), nor is it the same power socket as any of my other devices
 - the battery life jumps from 70% to 30% to zero in leaps

and finally, mine broke after the first full charge, turning itself off every few minutes, so I've returned it.  That said, I may replace it with the same device and hope I get a better pair.

title: They don’t have great sound
body: These head phones are built well on the exterior. The sound is ok but started vibrating after a month.

title: if you want a definitively better product, go with these - don't worry you're ...
body:
edited review: I would not recommend these. The hardware is good/fine, but the SOFTWARE is BROKEN.

1. Device volume is not remembered. By device volume, I mean the volume determined by pressing the vol controls on the earbuds (not your the controls on your phone etc). There's a pre-set level chosen for the buds when you turn them on, but to adjust besides this default you have to press the buttons each time you go to use the buds. That's retarded... but making it absolutely unforgivable is that the volume controls don't work unless something is currently using them. Meaning you have to turn the buds on, then start your music, THEN adjust the volume on the controller. What??

2. There aren't different volume profiles, or call volume is broken? Say you want music/media at 80%, calls at 50% Can't have that. Music/media volume does respond to the device's volume settings (phone etc), but call does not?? As another review said, the battery warning and beeps are loud. What I think s going on is there are only 2 volume categories - "music/media" and "everything else." And "everything else" is only controllable by the controller on the earbuds. So you can't go from music->quickly pause to make a call - unless you want to go deaf from the call -- the only way to lower this volume is to press -Vol on the controller --- and having to pause music, fumble with the buds, THEN make a call, THEN fumble again to turn the volume back up (see #1) is ridiculous.

3. The battery indicator, which I mentioned below, is useless for Android. This is because battery indication isn't a built-in feature of ANDROID (so if you have it it's because of your phone's manufacturer e.g. Samsung, LG, HTC etc). The bluetooth protocol can transmit the info, but reading it is not an official android feature - but IS iOS (iPhones). Take a look at other 'buds claiming battery indicators - they specifically state iOS indication/compatibility. The problem is on ANDROID, since the feature isn't official, accuracy of this is a gamble -
 if it works well for you, cool, but if it doesn't? It might as well not be a feature. e.g., I've run my earphones to death two times, but the battery indicator never showed ~<90% battery - meaning it's useless for me. WHY THIS SHOULD BE DIFFERENT ON iOS is because bluetooth battery indication is an official feature, I can only assume it works functionally (since it's then Apple's problem, the creators of all iOS, not just LG which makes a few phones, Samsung which makes a few, etc).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Before this pair, have only had the Taotronics TTH-07u or whatever it is. Since the tao's were giving me a very slight build quality issue, these were the same price (got same deal of the day as another recent reviewer - probably would've skipped right over if it had been priced what is the norm (only $10 more, but I'll explain), and these to my knowledge are a unique/orig design unlike tao's which are just anonymously manufactured buds that are licensed out and slapped with a million different brands... I bit on these.

First, these are definitely worth the $10 more than the taos - I just would have instantly scrolled passed them if not the same price for complicated reasons. Point is, if you want a definitively better product, go with these - don't worry you're getting scammed by weird amazon pricing, you're not, these are indeed a level in every respect than the "#1 inexpensive bt buds on amazon" the taos.

Compared with the taos, sound quality was definitely better - clearer, separation of dif stuff, crisper. Sound gets louder too, not that I max it in use but when I first put them on I did and the difference struck me first second - so I'm just noting. Also, the sound quality doesn't get washed out or fuzzy at higher volumes - the REAL plus of higher volume output.

Build quality is superior as well. The taos are plastic or something, these are metal or something? Not at increased weight either, I can't tell a difference. The taos charging cord is ~8inch long - way too short - the ones here are ~3ft (bit too long for my personal usage, but too long >> too short as with the taos). This has voice signals vs bees on the taos, I don't see the necessity for "power on" etc vs beeps, to be honest. This indicates battery life, the taos DO NOT. This claims 9h battery, haven't put em to the test yet, but many others say ~6h and I'd say at least that is right from my 3h usage today - compared to the taos, which get 4-5h.

The taos come with a very small mesh bag carrying pouch, this has a very premium softshell/hard case - the tao bag is so small I never used it, this TREBLAB case has fantastic usability (currently have my old taos in it, along w/ the dif ear tips etc that came with the TREBLAB's that were already stored in the case when opening). The J1's cord is .5-1inch longer - not a big enough difference to affect things, but just saying. The strength of the magnetization on both is the same (I'd like a strong magnet, but because it's so weak it doesn't work for ME so I just didn't use em on the taos and don't use em here and no love lost).

You get 3 sets of silicone tips and fins here, same as the taos. Except the fins here seem much more sturdy; the tao's hooks did their job, but after the 4months I've had them they were having issues staying affixed to the buds (the buds, not in my ears as hooks)(this is the issue I referred to at the beginning). These also come with foam tips, an excellent extra but I'll probably never change from the defaults they came on with (I'm a 'if it aint broke, dont fix it' kind of person largely).

These also have a much smaller profile than the taos. Those stuck out a bit too much.

All in all, get these. Even for $10 more. The taos make you go "meh, I got a good price so whatever" - these make you happy and go "these are awesome for the price". (reason for 4 and not 5 stars is because I had some comfort issues I think are totally unique to me (small/weird ears) so I didn't get into it)

title: Most comfortable, best sounding earbuds for the money
body: The value for the quality of J1 ear buds is unbeatable. The sound is great and the battery life is fantastic.  I am a heavy business traveler and these ear buds last me an entire travel day.  I also use these when working out and they never fall out.  My one recommendation would be to include additional foam tips since after daily heavy use, thry start to fall apart.  Not Treblabs fault since I use them heavily everyday for 1 year.  I have replaced them with the included rubber tips, but I miss the comfort of the foam.

title: Five Stars

title: 3.5 Hour Battery Life
body:
The sound is fine on these, the fit is as good as any other set of earbuds (I don't get good fit so I always make my own ear molds anyway). Treblab has changed the "power on" and "power off" voice from when I got my X11s a year ago to a robotic British-sounding voice that I don't care for (it just sounds lower quality and staticky compared to what it used to be).

But the main problem I have with the J1s is the battery life. I powered them on this morning to listen to some music and get a better feel for the function of them after unboxing them yesterday. They immediately powered down about 1 second after a "low battery" voice warning (ugh, that voice). Odd. I fully charged them yesterday when I unboxed them, as they arrived with zero charge - they had to charge for a while before the charging LED even came on (this is normal for devices that have lost all charge). They had less than 30 minutes of use since being fully charged. I decided to time them with constant use, so I plugged them in again, charged them fully until the blue LED was lit, and powered them on. They immediately paired with my phone again and I launched Pandora. I sat and worked while my phone sat about 6 feet away in line-of-sight with the headphones.

They lasted 3.5 hours before powering off, this time with no low battery warning.

My TaoTronics cost less and sound great, and I can get more than twice the use out of them, so I see no reason to keep these J1s. My Treblab X11s were great for just over a year but the left bud hardly lasts an hour anymore, while the right one will go about 2 hours. I have a pair of X5s on the way but I'll be scrutinizing the battery on those because I'm just losing faith in Treblab batteries overall now.

title: Almost Perfect
body: The sound quality of the Treblab J1 is superb and the ear buds comfortably stay in place for what I use them for. The only down fall to the product is at times I prefer to use only one of the earbuds and I wish there was a clip to control the excess cable.

title: Can't maintain bluetooth connectivity
body:
Trash. Had the product for two days and on the first day, the audio was patchy (seemed like it kept loosing bluetooth connectivity). Gave it another chance on day two thinking it was probably a fluke and the same poor bluetooth connectivity returned. Never had this issue with the Beats wireless earbuds, so clearly just an inferior product. You get what you pay for.

The cord certainly feels fairly cheap as well. Overall, the earbuds have a good look and for ~$40, I thought they were a steal, but you can't sell a product that can't maintain bluetooth connectivity.

title: Nice earphones at decent price.
body: First of all, I'm not an audiophile by any means, but I know good sound and these buds sound good. I listen to a variety of music genres and these deliver on everything. They are just punchy enough that hip hop beats sound nice, but not so punchy that rock/metal doesn't sound good, Sinatra and Adele sound nice too. The build quality feels good, although they might feel a little bulky for some; the wife thought they felt a little too big for her ears. IPX6 water resistance is great. I'm a heavy sweater and these guys handle it like a champ. Plenty of interchangeable ear tips in different sizes are included as well as nice hardshell carrying case. For the price, I think these are very good value.

I was at first skeptical because I have heard nothing about this product but eventually I caved in and bought them and boy oh boy do these earbuds sound amazing. I bought these earbuds for about $30 and compared to my jaybirds these knock them out in every aspect. The price is cheaper, better sound quality, and the bass is amazing. So the rundown is that if you're skeptical just trust me and buy it. Hope this review helps anyone who is skeptical to buy this earbud.

title: Not great for running
body:
The sound quality is excellent and battery life seems good.  The magnetic catch on the back is really handy and lets you take the earbuds out and run without fear of losing them.  I was able to get these to fit comfortably in my ears using either the included silicone or the foam ear tips.  Sound isolation with the foam ear tips is *fantastic*.  Unfortunately, any movement of the cord is channeled loudly and uncomfortably into the ear canal; this is especially true if you use the foam tips, but it happens with both kinds.  I tried to use these for running and walking and either activity turns the earbuds into painful hammers on the ear drum; running was especially painful.  I tried using the included clip to limit the movement of the cable and I can’t tell if it helps at all.  They’re really nice, high quality earbuds; I wish I could recommend them, but I can’t use them for the intended activities so they’re basically useless to me.

UPDATE: the company reached out to me after my initial review and offered to exchange this set for a pair of the TREBLAB XR700 headphones. The XR700's are wonderful! I highly recommend them.

title: The battery life is not very good though. It is advertised for up to 9 ...

It is advertised for up to 9 hours of use but I don't even think they lasted 3 hours on a full charge and I've charged them 3 times already.  I think I'm going to return them.  I need them to last more than a couple of hours especially if they are supposed to go up to 9 hours.

title: The earbuds started out with fairly good sound quality - TREBLAB replaced
body:
The earbuds started out with fairly good sound quality, but certainly not worth $37. I used them for three months before the left ear completely went out. They also developed a scratchy sound in the right ear after a month and a half. Prior to owning these, I had a cheap $20 pair that had the same sound quality and lasted me a year and a half without problems. I would not recommend buying these.

Update - TREBLAB provided excellent customer service helping to debug the problem and eventually replacing the bad ear buds.  I'll bump the review to a 3 for their service. If these phones last I'll increase to a 4 if they don't I'll drop it to a 1.  Stay tuned.

title: Awesome sounds, big and little ears
body: I have tiny ears, think of me as having a child sized head. I have a hard time finding ear buds, sunglasses, hats, blah blah. These are awesome. I ran 55 miles last month with them and no problems. The charge lasts a very long time and I only really charged them because I didn't want to be stranded during longer runs. They successfully got me through a 1/4 marathon and fit very comfortably. They travel well and even on the dreaded treadmill are fine. There is a bit of noise from the cable, but you can get them situated so it's not terrible. The sizing allows myself as well as my hubbys big ears to wear them -- while I don't exactly share, it's a worth while point!

title: these can be really good. My first pair sounded great and I could ...
body:
For $30 wireless earbuds, these can be really good.  My first pair sounded great and I could get 100 feet away from my phone with them.  Unfortunately, I lost them and had to buy another pair.  With my second pair I couldn't get 5 feet away from my phone with it cutting out.

Like with any low budget product, the quality control can be marginal, so some work well and some don't.  My suggestion is that if you get a pair that doesn't work,  return them and buy another pair.

Connectivity to my iPhone is almost instantaneous when I power them on, and battery life is decent for BT earbuds.  I have been jogging with these as well and I had no worries of them falling out, the expanding foam ear pieces are super comfortable.  The backsides of the earbuds are magnetic so they stay in place around your neck when not in use.  If you are in search of BT earbuds without breaking the bank, these are definitely worth looking into!

TREBLAB J1 are even better sound wise... had us both shaking our heads on how good they sound at the price... I must add without a equalizer its sounds... very very bassy note download Mixzing from google apps,  battery life is dying.. its only 5 hours or so now.  No where near 9 hours with regular use.  The magnet feature is SOOOO good It shocks me why no other brand is doing it would fall out to create a chain like necklace so you never have to worry about them falling off.  A few months in and still unbeatable.  One thing that would make this even better would be a rubber tie to tighten the cords so they wrap behind the neck closer the cords a bit too long.

title: Not for me
body:
The sound was fine but they would NOT stay in my ears!! I tried every single attachment that comes with the buds but no matter what I did, I always had them falling out mid-workout. It was very frustrating and not worth the cheaper price tag.

I also didn't like the cord that wraps around to keep them secure. It was too long. It also didn't help when the magnetized and somewhat heavy ear buds would fall, dragging the cord and the other bud with it and falling to the floor.

title: Sound okay but are uncomfortable
body: They sound okay!!! But man they are uncomfortable!!! Even with the attachments finding a proper fit is difficult and then you can't keep them wearing for more than 15 mins. Not a good purchase!!! 🤮

title: Worked Great for Awhile but...
body: Device looks great and paired easily with Apple TV1 (gen 4). Really enjoyed it. Then, I turned off the Apple TV1, moved to bedroom where attempt to pair with Apple TV2 (gen 4) was unsuccessful. While trying a 2nd time with TV2, the device stopped speaking in English and switched languages (Chinese possibly?). Tried unsuccessfully to reset per the provided instructions with no change. Went back to family room, turned on Apple TV1, unpaired the device, turned Apple TV1 off again, moved back to the bedroom and was then able to connect to Apple TV2. However, the device now issues status in non-English voice, which is unintelligible to me. There are no answers specific to these issues in the instructions or FAQ. Contacted Treblab support via email who responded very quickly asking for Order number and merchant channel but has not yet provided an answer. Will update this review if a response resolves the 2 issues. I hope they do resolve as I really like the fit, finish, and performance as compared to the relatively fair price for what you get.

title: Home Run!!!!  After 3 strike outs!
body: I have purchased and returns 3 other brands due to quality issues, battery won't hold a charge after several months, speaker in one started making a crackling noise in another, and one just stop working all together.  TREBLAB J1 have awesome sound quality. So far they are doing great! Just had to figure out which ear tip and ear fin was the best fit for my big ears.  I like a snug fit!  I don't mind spending the money as long as I get a quality item and it lasts more than 6 months, none of the others made it that far. Treblab puts a 1 year warranty on the J1's, so I feel these should last for quite awhile. I have had them 2 months now and they are great!

title: The sound wasnt that good with no bass at all
body: The sound wasnt that good with no bass at all. Left side was louder than the right and on top of all after 3 hours of use the right earbud stopped working. Sending them back 40 dollars is too much dont even think of giving 180 bucks

title: Awesome customer service
body: I love these earbuds. The battery lasts about 8 hours, and are very user friendly. When there was an issue with my first pair customer service was very polite and helpful. I was instructed to cut my defective pair in half and email a picture to customer service. They promptly shipped me a new working pair. The sound quality is comparable to the apple earbuds that come with the newer phones. Sound quality is definitely better than any earbud you'll find at Walmart like skull candy or sony ear buds with a mic. The mic is also of great quality, I can use it in the wind and have no interference during my call! These ear buds are a staple for my everyday life, I use them at work and at the gym. One of the great things is that they come with 3 different sizes of silicone ear cushions, and cotton ear cushions ad well as an inner ear sizer to prevent the buds from slipping out. Totally worth it if you are not willing to spend $100+ on the more popular brands!!

title: Five Stars

Being professional athlete, consider TREBLAB best ones for the work out and trainings.

title: Pretty amazing for price.

Maybe the highs are a little high and not much deep sound but these little things are loud as I had to keep turning them down, loud and clear. No complaints on hearing me with phone conversations as well. I like not having the bulky plastic piece around my neck, they're light weight and easily hidden when not in use. I looked at a lot of bluetooth, especially for phone calls and I'm glad I went with these.

title: Wow
body: These are just awesome headphones for the price. Treblab really nailed it with this one. The sound quality is amazing, the noise cancelation surprisingly is a really nice touch, and you can easily find a fit with the amount of ear tips and wings. They also have a good build quality and look nice. I would highly recommend these to anyone as they look and feel like very high end wireless earbuds.

title: Decent, while they last
body: Worked good for what they were, always felt like they were a bit too long. Bad review cause they only lasted 3 months before the audio cut out on them. EDIT: changed to 5 stars trelab reached out and resolved the issue. Their customer service can’t be beat!

title: They seemed to work fine; but today only one earbud is working
body: I bought these just over a month ago. They seemed to work fine; but today only one earbud is working.  I only hear out of the right earbud.  Which is pretty useless when listening to music.

title: Shelf Life is Approx. 5 Months UPDATED: Great Customer Service
body:
2ND UPDATE 6.17.19: While I appreciate Treblab’s customer support, these replacement head phones lasted about 6 months with regular, protected use out of the weather. There’s little visual physical defects but the left earbud has faulty output; it generates no sound unless in a particular position I can’t hold it to regularly.

Based on my experience with other Bluetooth headphone companies, I can hardly blame Treblab as it seems headphones in this price range are simply not meant to last.

UPDATE 1.16.19: Treblab's customer service got in touch with me a couple months after my review with a handwritten letter. I had a pleasant exchange with them and they replaced my headphones with a free, brand new pair. They arrived about a week ago, and the new pair does seem to be made of sturdier construction. They're working great and I will update this review after a few months of regular use. I've changed my review from 3 stars to 4 stars based on their empathetic customer support.

When I first got the white Treblab headphones, they were comparable to their price & other bluetooth headphones I received in the past. Though not as sleek and the fine-tuned, they operated and produced great sound and shut off ambient noise around me. The adjustable features were appreciated and the battery lasted a full day, or close enough to.

After normal, protective use for 5 months, the sound in the right earbud (with the microphone/volume control) has begun to cut out. See photos for the wear and possible corrosive damage from the battery. These headphones have never been out in the rain unprotected and have been stored in cool dry places. Though these headphones were great for the 5 months I had them, I'd prefer them to have lasted at least twice as long.

title: GARBAGE PRODUCT COMBINED WITH NON-EXISTENT CUSTOMER SERVICE
body:
So, three things. But most importantly, don't even think about buying this. It's garbage combined with horrendous customer service (actually non-existent customer service)

One, the right earpiece (on the same cable as the microphone) stopped working after two and half months. I guess it has a short or something. I don't use these for any sports activity just because I don't listen to music or take phone calls when I'm exercising so it doesn't have anything to do with an impact or sweat or anything. It's just a defective product.

Two, when I first got this, prior to the defective earpiece, I noticed that if I got more than ten or twelve feet away from my phone, the signal would just break up. But I just let that go. As I said, it cost $39.95, what do I expect? Well, I should have expected much more. But that was my mistake

And now, for the clincher, customer service. Are you kidding me? They have zero customer service. You call, a recording answer. It's the only thing that ever answers. Never, ever a human being. The recording tells you that if you leave a message that they will get back to you. It says that they will do that by the next business day. Apparently, it leaves out that it's the next MONKEY business day. Well, they must have the world's largest voice mail box or it doesn't record anything. Apparently you are just talking to yourself because I left five messages on five consecutive days and never got a call back.

Don't waste your money. Go to Las Vegas and gamble your $40 away. You would get better value for your money

title: I recommend these Bluetooth earbuds
body: The Treblab J1 meet my expectations. Have not conduct a battery longevity of 6 hrs yet. I fully charged it upon arrival, used it on and off on the running trail, but seem to fall short of the claimed 6 hrs. However, I recommend these Bluetooth earbuds. They fit comfortable, has not fallen off when running.

title: Very impressive
body:
This is 1 week after receiving my product

Pro:
Good sound quality (excellent highs and lows)
Good price
Excellent accessories selection
Great battery life
With magnetic lock easy to not lose
Gets very loud
Headphones almost never fall out of ears even with strenuous exercise

Con:
Magnet on headphone isn't amazingly strong so general movement can unhinge
Cord is a little long (can be fixed with the shortener inside the case but only to a certain extent)
Buttons on control hub are far apart (in contrast are easy to identify and never press 2 at a time)

I will recommend to anyone looking for good sound quality at an impressive price

title: Trelab ayyye
body: So I needed Bluetooth headphones for when I work out or when I need to listen to something as I’m falling asleep. I already had the wireless set but I lost one earbud n need a new set. I love that these magnetically fasten to each other. Battery life is amazing. Great for working out cause they don’t slip out ears. I recommend this product od.

title: I will say that they have a good fit, better then most Bluetooth headphones you can ...
body: The left earbud was DOA. It seems that these headphones are very hit or miss. I will say that they have a good fit, better then most Bluetooth headphones you can find for this price point.

title: Volume control is really bad to the point of being hazardous
body:
The headphones are generally pretty good.  The controller has a small slim profile and is not too heavy.  The controller is closely positioned to the earpiece, so it doesn't dangle too low and get caught up on your clothing.  Unfortunately, I have some clothes that have turned up collars, so the controller gets caught up anyway (I don't blame the product for this).  The sound is good for music and Podcasts.  I have an iPhone, and when I activate Siri, its voice is muffled, so that's weird.

I have to activate Siri from the phone, rather than on the controller.  I am not counting this against the device because I don’t know if it's an Apple thing or the headphones themselves.  I suspect it's an Apple thing.

So, why the single star?  It has to do with the volume control, and in particular the UP volume action.  When I quick-press the button to increase the volume, the damn device puts out a rather loud and obnoxious high-pitch tone.  It totally sucks; the tone is really loud (and really close to the threshold of being painful) and somewhat startling because it is unexpected.  Here's what happens: when I do an up-volume the first few times, it usually works OK.  If I do another up-volume, the beep happens. Further up-volume actions produce the beep tone, and it seems the volume doesn’t increase.  I haven't fully characterized the behavior because I don't care to waste my time on it; what I have experienced is unacceptable, hence the one star; and I have returned the product.

title: Good quality and cheap
body: Cheap, Connected easily and stayed connected, many options for ear size, nice carrying case and good sound quailty. Only fault I found is the mic side/right side is a tad heavy so that earbud wants to come out. I haven’t tried all options yet

title: Great earbuds for a great price!
body: I purchased these headphones first for myself 6 months ago and loved them, so when my brothers birthday rolled around I purchased them for him. He cannot stop thanking me, loves the quality and I loved the price. Grateful value.

title: Awesome!! But 1 out of 3 received was a damaged piece
body: Everything was excellent and hence i bought 3 to be gifted to my family back in India.Everyone liked it. But, unfortunately after 2 days, i opened the 3rd piece, and saw that the left earpiece doesnt playout and i felt dejected.  I cannot do anything now since i have shipped it to India and cannot get it back. I gave a 4 star even then since the other 2 pieces are still awesome but just bad luck.

title: Awesome earbuds for a great price
body: Over the past nine months I have used these quite a bit, while washing dishes for eight hours straight in my part-time job, or working out and on the treadmill. The sound quality was excellent and the battery lasted quite a while. They also worked great for phone conversations.  However, after nine months, of travel and sweat, the right side has developed a short, and cuts out quite a bit. I just re-ordered another pair, because I figure for the price, and nine months of use, I probably got my moneys worth.  I heard they have a one-year guarantee,  but not really going to sweat it, these things are worth it.

body: Its a great product for the price. I have 2 now.

body: The fit and finish of the product is good and the carrying case is a nice addition. Unfortunately, the product arrived broken. The left ear bud has almost no volume compared to the right. For what it's worth, the right ear bud has great sound and noise cancellation. It's comfortable to wear too. I just wish both ear buds worked.

If I go too fast they bounce around too much. the volume control smacks off of my neck and face, the cord gets tangled in my ponytail, and it's a real mood killer. save your money and invest in nicer headphones.

title: Excellent sound and fit!
body:
I love these earphones. They stay in my ear (the plastic butterflies they come with help), they last well over 5 weight training sessions (about 2 hrs per session), and I was actually surprised to find out the sound quality is even BETTER than my training partner's Beats by Dre "powerbeats" - WOW! Great job, TREBLAB!
The only thing I was a little upset about is that the memory foam tips didn't fit my ears, BUT I'm sure they'll fit most peoples' ears ANNNND I am more than satisfied with the sound quality and noise cancellation I get from the small rubber tips provided. I sweat a shit load (yes, that much), and I haven't had any issue with them falling off my ear.
So, if you're on the market for a pair... you should definitely get these! A friend of mine already got them (as per my recommendation) and he enjoys them as much as I do.

I bought these not quite a year ago and am disappointed to say that they started cutting out , then one ear completely died about 2 months ago and now they are completely dead.

title: Great while it works, but then broke.
body:
I had this product for a few months (Purchased August 2018) and they worked great for a while; good sound quality, nice material stayed in during workouts, etc.

However, the right speakers completely stopped working, possibly from a disconnect in the wiring from cutting corners in design aspects that aren't visible? Which is confusing as the left speakers still work fine.

Overall, if you NEED to have bluetooth earbuds for a few months, these will do fine.  If you need them for a longer period of time, you might be better off searching for another product.

title: For $30, it is a good buy!
body:
The bluetooth connection is very reliable and has not broken up on me even once, and the sound is quite commendable at the price you're getting this for. What I like best is the battery life: it is more than enough for a few days' use when exercising and commuting without me needing to get an extra battery case for it.

The fit was a bit problematic for me as the ridge digs into my ear painfully. Yet, the excellent customer service more than makes up for it -- they were prompt to offer refund options. I have exceptionally small ears so I do not expect other customers to have the same issue as me. Having said that, you can go ahead with this purchase knowing that if anything else goes wrong, you can simply contact Treblab and look forward to warm and understanding help.

title: it's flawless and the sound is amazing! Battery life is damn impressive as is it's ...
body: The sound, fit, and convenience is flawless in my opinion, but the initial connectivity leaves something to be desired.  It usually takes, at least, 3-4 attempts to synch up, but after it does..it's flawless and the sound is amazing!  Battery life is damn impressive as is it's durability.  I work outdoors for a living, in rain, snow, heat, humidity, etc.  After I can get that primary connection...these earbuds are bulletproof.  I hear that connectivity is an issue for a lot of earbuds but...this company offers a variety of "buds" and I'm impressed.

title: Sound is Amaxing but Bluetooth is lacking
body:
The sound from these things is GREAT, Like feel the bass without losing high tone quality great. Yet the Bluetooth reception is just NOT GREAT.

*To be fair I have not tested this with other phones.*

When I am using these headphones I can not put my phone in my back pocket or I will get a weak signal that causes my audio to skip. Also, if I am in a crowded area that has other peoples bluetooth devices running the headphones will really lose signal and skip or just stop working. For instance when I enter Grand Central Station I just have to turn them off because any audio I'm playing becomes incomprehensible.

I still just want to add though that when I am at work or working out with few people aroung around and my phone within arms reach the sound is incredible, better than any Skullcandys I have ever owned and better then the Beats I bought. I might even put the sound just under my wired Audio Technica buds.

title: ... experience with the blue tooth head set was a poor experience. They state that they are waterproof
body: My experience with the blue tooth head set was a poor experience. They state that they are waterproof, yet they broke very easy when they got caught on the back of my shirt on my neck rolling out of a bench press. While I would understand if pulled on them myself, but that wasn't the case as I was using them properly and they failed to measure up to standards. I contacted the seller on amazon and since it was a couple of days past the 30 days and because it apparently wasn't a manufacturer defect they poorly apologized and told me to get the warranty next time. They offered me a 30 percent discount on my next purchase but will of course not be using it as it was a poor product. If anyone would still like to purchase the product you can email me and I will gladly give you the promotion code for the discount.

title: Amazing Customer Service
body:
Bought these October 2018. January 2019, they stop working for no reason. Got a replacement through warranty. Four days after new set arrives, they stop working and will not take a charge. A new set is in the mail through warranty again.

If you're looking for something long term and durable, do not think about these. If this third set is defective as well, I will be getting a refund and taking my money elsewhere.

Edit: While the J1's may not have been the best for me, the Productech company is one worth your time. They did not stop until I was happy and satisfied, and offered me an upgrade to the XR700. I am happy with that product, and I recommend those, for the same price tag.

Update: Customer service was excellent and reached out to me, they sent new headphones to try. Will write a review once they arrive and have been used.

Treblab XR700B was sent to try. The fit was great with not only adjustable earpieces but also a piece that fit over your air. The sound proba The fit was great with not only adjustable earpieces but also a piece that fit over your ear. The sound  Quality is exceptional and the multi function buttons are very user-friendly and easily  accessible. Are use these approximately 4 to 6 hours a week. title: Better than bose earbuds (im being for real)
body:
Heres the thing: bose earbuds are expensive, stick out awfully off the ear, are comparatively impractical, and sound pretty much like these earbuds. The big difference is the construction...
These earbuds have broken fairly easy, but if you make a commitment to treat them with a reasonable level of care, they are in almost every aspect, better than then 99 dollar bose earbuds.
Theyre
1. practical. you can wear them as necklaces and dont stick out like crazy. theyre fairly slim against the chest, you wont lose them.
2. sound freaking amazing. I, an average person, dont notice any difference between the bose and these in sound quality.
3.  Battery is pretty impressive. WIth extended use (4 hours of studing and other listening along the day) every day, they last me about 3 or 4 days on one charge, and they charge fairly fast...unlike the bose earbuds, which eberytime you turn them on they have 10% less battery than last time for having used them 15 minutes.
4.  okay for workout. The right earbud tends to fall off during very dynamic exercise because of the sound controls and such, but if you change the eartips or wrap it around the ear, it works just peachy, sounds amazing and sweat doesnt harm it.

Now again, these arent very durable. I recommend you dont hang them for extended periods of time. Its okay to hang them as a necjlace cause your chest and shirt provide a bit of a lift, but hanging them in your room for a day may be stretching it. Try not to tug on the earbud, although it can take quite a beating, it has its limits, better to preserve it.

Just treat the joint between the wire and the earbud with care and youll be good

I honestly have nothing bad to say about these. For sure will buy these again if they ever die.

The bass is amazing and the clarity is out this world. I’m telling you all I will be by are these. I may baby another pair just to have Incase these ever die. Range is about 50 sixty feet. Battery is good too. Plenty of accessories and a case. You can’t lose. Do yourself a favor and buy these

title: New Treblab J1
body:
I have been using the J1 for about two weeks.  The sound quality is good for the price,  The noise cancellation works very well.  One concern I had was the buds would not stay in.  This has not been a problem.  I work out at the gym and sweat a lot, but the buds stay put.  There are a couple things I need to get used to.

The controls on the wire... My old Treblab's had the controls on the ear piece.  With the J1 I am always fumbling around trying to find the controls.
The wire for the controls tends to poke out and rub my cheek.  Kinda annoying.
The bluetooth range doesn't seem to reach at far.

For the price, the J1 is a good buy, just give it some time to figure it out and get used to them

To me they didn’t have the pattern down for ear canal so these would slide right in. I’m a Bose soundsport and beats studio and beats 3 earbuds anyway. Battery-2/5, sound quality- .5/5(horrible), material quality wouldn’t give it a star but fo the sake of being nice -1/5 needs better materials, and overall maybe a 1.5/5. Wouldn’t buy.

of these headphones is better than 2 other pair of bluetooth headphones I own. I also like the number of options there
are to get the perfect fit for your ears. I haven't had these headphones long enough to comment on the number of hours
you get on a single charge.That is my biggest complaint about all bluetooth headphones like these.
I would recommend these headphones if you are looking for good sound at a good price.

Other than that noise cancellation is good sound is awesome overall very happy with this purchase!

title: Great Customer Service!!!
body:
I'm adjusting my review below, due to the exceptional customer service Productech provided. Kate worked with me to replace the defective product and was extremely helpful. The new earphones work great.

I’ve had these about 3 weeks now. I’ve only been able to use them 5 or 6 times since they are always dead. I’ll charge them for the recommended 2 hours and try to use them for my run in the morning and they are dead again. So frustrating!

title: Good customer service
body: After some previous problems I got some help from customer service and overall I’m happy with the product.

title: I wanted to love these but comparing them to 3 other headphones I ...
body: These are very bass heavy. I wanted to love these but comparing them to 3 other headphones I tried, all under $30 (except for this pair) these felt the most cheap in build and material. Sound was okay if you love bass. I would have still kept these, when comparing them to the other headphones but when you use the control on the earbuds to fiddle with the volume, for some reason it does not change the volume on my phone, just in the speakers of the buds. This means, if my phone's sound is only halfway up I need to raise the volume on the earbuds all the way and then my phone as well. This just feels annoying and confusingly unintuitive. Battery time and range were decent.

title: The fit and sound quality are pretty decent considering the price of the earbuds
body: The fit and sound quality are pretty decent considering the price of the earbuds. Battery does not last for 9 hours, more like 5-6 hours and does not display battery status clearly on the phone. When the battery is low it will warn you of low battery and turn off within 5 min so not much of a warning.

title: Don’t last
body: I loved these earbuds at first, got them in February 2018 and have used them about 10-15 times and now they have stop connecting to my Bluetooth as of late March 2018. It just flashes blue and red but won’t connect even thought it had done so in the past.

title: Good while they lasted (a couple months)
body: Good while they lasted (a couple months). One side is broken even though itook good care of these earbuds.

title: Sound is really good. Maybe not as good as a Bose or ...
body: Sound is really good.  Maybe not as good as a Bose or Beats but for the price it is excellent.  I've never owned a pair of buds that gave so many options to fit different size ears and preference for the type of tip (regular and foam).  They are super easy to operate and easy to pair.  I have used mine 4 different times over the course of 10 days for 30-60 minutes each use and they are still on their initial charge.  This is the 2nd pair of bluetooth buds I have owned and these are superior to the other pair in every way.  P.S. They also have a magnet on the back which is convenient to keep them around your neck when not using.

title: Very pleased with quality and price of the Treblab J1; bought second pair for wife
body: Briefly, read most all of the descriptions and reviews avoiding wireless buds over $100 which included most of the big name buds. Usually I'm an Apple guy, but not this time.  I ordered Treblab J1 and used them for a few days and liked them so well I ordered another pair for my wife who really likes them as well. Yes, I would recommend them to friends and relatives and have. The buds fit and it comes with a variety of ear plug sizes. There is a true 9 hours of play time and a little warning voice if power is low, Sound seems a quality range to me (not returning to vinyl records so I can hear grooves and record pops),  I'm using Apple Music and satisfied with the quality of music and how it is transmitted on the J1. As a welcome intangible, I received two e-mails from Alexander Malamud owner of TREBLAB making sure I was pleased with my purchase. There is no doubt in my mind if there were any difficulties with this product and I want to emphasize I don't expect any, Alexander would trip all over himself trying to make it right. Because of the wide range of quality and price for wireless ear buds frankly with the help of reviews, hopefully like this one, I feel I was fortunate to "luck out" with the J1 from TREBLAB.  Thank you for all the wonderful reviews that helped guide me toward my purchase.

title: Plantronics Backbeat Fit vs TREBLAB J1
body:
I have been using Plantronics Backbeat Fit for almost 2 years, so this is a comparison.

(1) Sound is equally good. J1's volume can get louder than FIT
(2) Bluetooth range seems slightly better with J1
(3) When movie and audio are not in sync (because you moved a few meters away from the audio source), with FIT you could fix the lag by pressing a button once (which also tells you the battery level). J1 lacks this feature and you have to turn the device off and back on, which is a bit annoying
(4) I prefer the fit of the on-ear type FIT to the in-ear type J1, but J1's fit is by no means bad

Wish J1 included some sort of cord management clips. Also TREBLAB, please fix (3).

But with the much lower price of J1, this is not a bad purchase at all.

title: It’s very light!
body: This product is all it claims, I am the type of individual that sweats profusely at every run, my fear is that sweat will eventually find its in the most delicate parts of ear buds, so far I’m pleased!

title: Quality Bluetooth Buds at a Reasonable Price - Great Customer Service
body:
Overall I think these are a great set of headphones, specially for the price. They are water resistant and very light to wear. The backs being magnetic is a nice feature because you can clasp them together around your neck when they aren't in your ears. For my ears, they stay in better than most others I have tried. Very good battery life as well. I would say I get a solid 6 hours constant use out of them which is a little on the lite side for what I would like but compared to other bluetooth buds of this size you can't beat it. The sound quality is on par with the price as well. They have some noise cancelling abilities and after burnin (all speakers have a burnin time where the quality of sound stabilizes) I don't notice any distortion.

 My only complaint would be the microphone. It works fine, people can hear me clearly and I don't have to pay attention to where the mic is, however they pick up background noise. If in the house or a generally quiet place there are no issues but if you are walking in an airport or on the streets while on the phone, the mic picks up so much of the background your caller may have a problem hearing you clearly over cars or overhead speakers.

I did have an issue have 2 months of use with my first pair. The customer service from Produtech was one of the best I have ever had. Within minutes of sending an email over my buds no-longer charging I received a response with possible solutions. Once due diligence was done they promptly suggested a replacement. All products have lemons and this company stands buy the products they sell.

title: Good earbuds
body: I really like the fit and function of these earbuds.  They sound great and are easy to use.  The first pair I got wouldn't hold a charge which was frustrating.  Although the first pair I received were defective, the seller sent me another pair within a week without having to send the other pair back.  So far, so good with the new pair.  If they continue to work good, I will purchase my wife a pair as well.

title: Excellent customer service
body: I initially purchased the Treblab J1 headset for a long bus commute and was very happy with the quality, battery life and comfort.  After ~1yr I lost sound on one earbud, Treblab customer support quickly replaced my set at no cost.  Since then I have purchased an additional 4 pairs as gifts for my kids birthdays and Christmas.  The earbuds are high quality and Treblab stands behind it's warrentee!!  It's been a great experience from day 1 and continues to fill the sound void of a 5 hr daily commute - I am very happy with the product.

title: Amazing sound and very comfortable....not happy with fit for running.
body: Only reason I gave this 3 stars is because I could not get them to stay in during my runs.  The sound was amazing.  Literally dropped my jaw the first song I played through them.  I returned and got the xr800s for running and much happier with the fit.  But it bares repeating.....these sounded amazing!  For walking or just to have around the house these cant be beat!

title: best headphones
body: the J1 is an awesome update to my XR500s.  they are so much smaller and fit so much better for running. the XRs were a bit more bassy, which was nice but with the right foam tips the J1s sound great. i love the fact that I am free from the phone, no more ear yanks. I also use them at home on my PC. the Foam tips block ouot the AC noise so I can hear dialogue in movies.  I bought my wife some XR500s no she has her eye on my J1s. Treblab has been a great buy for me. the price is excellent. you can buy 4 or 5 pairs in contrast to the beats by dre or jaybirds. i am done buying headphones until treblab comes out with a true wireless.

title: They are all-around great. They have a great design and have great ...
body: They are all-around great. They have a great design and have great sound. However, when I am using the volume keys on the headphones, it controls its own volume instead of the volume of my phone. This is an issue for me because when you reach max volume on the device (even though the device volume isn't maxed) it beeps REALLY loud. Is there a way to prevent this from happening? Because I would love to be able to disable this feature. Realy, though, I would rather be able to control the volume from my phone using the little remote. Also, the cord clip is useless. It doesn't clip anything because there is no grip of any sort.

The company contacted me. I applaud them for following up on the review. They do work well and the sound quality is good.

title: Acceptable budget conscious option
body: They were good for the two months they lasted. Sound quality was acceptable and they’re a bit bulky in the ear. They’re acceptable if you’re looking for a cheap option. No battery gauge or no unified volume control with devices. For about $20 you get what you pay for. I’m going back to LG Tones

title: Sound good but have issues
body: I mostly use these for working out, listening to music walking to class, and w/e phone call that happens on the way.  They sound good and the battery lasts about a week of use.  The base is nice and the music comes in clear.  My biggest issues so far are the cable is way too long. They have the power buttons on one side and it makes it heavier so the entire cable shifts to that side.  There is a “cable shortening clip” but it doesn’t work.  Almost feels like it’s missing a piece to make it clip together and shorten the cord.  There is no noise canceling outside of what is offered from the plug style for the earplugs.  When using it for phone calls, they pick up all the background noise and end up having to disconnect and use the phone normally.  I have had a few times where they cut out but only for a split second or two and then went right back to normal.  I looked around at most of the options and took a chance on these.  I would maybe purchase again but after trying other options.

They sounded as if the speakers were blown out when I set the volume higher than half in my smartphone.

title: Buy Immediately! They are Awesome
body:
Everything about these headphones are great. The sound comes in clear and they stay securely in place when I am running.
They are super inexpensive compared to the average price of wireless headphones and they work so much better than Beats or even JayBird and have a much more low-key profile. I have only had them for a couple weeks but I am so happy I purchased them and I hope they last a long time.

Super satisfied  :)

title: Great product. Great design. I am probably gonna order my third pair. (They last about 6 months)

The only issue that I have is that they only last about 6 months before one of the ear buds stops working. I was about to order my third pair when I decided to check how long it was I ordered between pairs and it was about six months. After looking at other products these seemed to last longer than other products.

body: When they work they work pretty good. They worked fine for a few months, then the battery life falls, I lost sound in one side and now they wont turn on. Spend more if you can for a better product.

title: Great Bluetooth Earbuds

I found connecting with the J1 to be sometimes finicky, but they are a great pair of earbuds for the price.  The sound quality is excellent, the battery life does last the advertised 9 hours (give or take), and the recharge is fairly quick.  If you haven't purchased from Treblab in the past, I would recommend it.  You can't beat the price for good quality.

title: Suprisingly better than my Beats 2 If we are comparing value/price !
body:
These earbuds are SUPERB for there price! They fit inside your ear perfectly once you choose the correct ear plugs and wing tip. I run, play basketball, and lift weights with these.  The sound quality is crisp and THEY GET LOUD, so no problem extracting the bass out of them. If you put them in, YOU WON'T HEAR ANYTHING! This is mainly a gift for obvious reasons, but it could be a curse if you are around vehicles and you can't hear what's going on. Be Safe!  There is only one flaw I encountered:
After I put in the memory foam earplug, it started to top after about 30 insertions. But this is no deal breaker, they have more earplug options.
EXCELLENT earbuds for its price! (~$19) Honestly should be worth more than what they are.

title: these are WONDERFUL, also check your Cell Sound Settings for Orchestra ...
body: Living in the City of Chicago, I have found a few(VERY FEW) air war sound drop spaces, but it always comes back. When you get the proper Ear Size, these are WONDERFUL, also check your Cell Sound Settings for Orchestra Sound!!! DUDE!!! EPIC!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Not durable
body: First time I bought these ear phones, they didn't last long. However, after my review, a company representative contacted me about the same, and they asked me for photo proof of the earphones, I sent them a photo. They sent me a replacement no questions asked. As I waited for the replacement, I ordered a second pair from the same company because that's how good the sound quality was. The customer service was above reproach and I will not change my earphone brand anytime soon. Treblab all the way. Simply fantastic.

title: Well worth it
body: I have been using these for work. I work in construction and these have been great with noise. The different ear adaptation where a bit tricky to figure out but once I found the right ones they fit like a glove. The battery life is awesome. I charge it up on my drive into work and it last me the hole day 7HRS!!! I listen to music and get calls and the other person says my voice is clear. Great buy.

title: Very good headphones, sit comfortably.
body: Very good headphones, sit comfortably. Very good for a Christmas gift. Thanks

title: Treblab J1

title: Battery charge not 8 hrs
body: Sounds quality ok.  Manufacturer claims 8 hours battery.  More like 2 hours duration, not impressed at all.

body: You get what you pay for. Doesn't stay in the ear too well and I tried all the different ear cups. Sounds is decent, but volume isn't the best.

title: Item no longer works
body: I ordered these Bluetooth Earbuds back in June 2017. They initially were great and comfortable to wear. Music sound very good. However, these Earbuds only lasted so long. By September 2017 this product stopped working. They no longer want to recharge and no longer want to connect to my devices.

title: Great earphones and customer service
body: The sound is great and noise cancelling is adequate. The only caveat is ear canal size. If your ear has very small ear canal the earphones will pop out. It still worth a try. I liked their customer service on handling the return.

title: Very impressed!
body: I've owned 6 pairs of Bluetooth headphones in the $60-$120 range and these are by far the best. The sound is better than I'd ever expect from wireless headphones, they are comfortable, and I even get a cool battery indicator on my phone screen. I can't believe the value for the price.

title: Not dissapointed
body: This is my second pair of TREBLAB earbuds.  Unfortunately the first pair was lost on a recent flight and when I realized that I had left them on the plane I immediately went back to Amazon to purchase my replacement set.  They work great, have plenty of options for customization and the sound is as good as I could expect.  No, they don't sound as good as my Bose headphones but that's like comparing apples to oranges.  What they do sound as good as, if not better than, is any other wired or wireless earbud I've tried.

title: Delivered quickly and as described.
body: Delivered quickly and as described. Brought as a gift so I can't comment on quality or comfort.

title: Poor Customer Service by TREBLAB
body: I have had these for 4 months and wear them while working out. The largest foam covers fit my ears well and allow the deep base sounds to come through in the music, unlike the silicone covers. I needed some replacement covers and emailed the customer service on the Treblab website about ordering a set. I never heard from them.

title: Volume control
body: Ear buds protrude out a little to much. Would before something more descreet.  Also, the volume control limit is HORRIBLE!  It is just a little under the volume I want to be able to get to while running/lifting. There sound be a way to override it at your own risk.

title: They actually stay-in
body:
First the good: pairing to all my Bluetooth equipment was a breeze, amongst the different ear pieces, I found one that fitted snugly in my ear canal, I feel that these are much better than the XR500 for me, they just feel less conspicuous.
What could be improved is the piece that keeps the ear piece from moving around, I believe that it should be a bit firmer.

title: Great buy!
body: Great sound, and battery life.  For the 1st few time I wore, the fit was strange, and they hurt a little on the side of the ear.  But, now - they are super comfortable; so I guess you need to wear them in a bit.  They are my go-to earbuds now, and I own the Beats PowerBeats 3 as well,

They also provide you with 6 pairs of earpieces. 3 different sizes of silicone and foam. So far, I've been able to use this unit for 10 hrs before recharging the battery. Keep up the good work!

title: Comes with all the fixings for comfortable and stability
body: Everything you need in headphones! Comes with all the fixings for comfortable and stability.

title: Comfortable, Great Sound, questionable battery life
body:
Build quality seems good/average and they are comfortable. Sound quality is pretty good, i wouldn't say its amazing but the bass is there.  Some users are reporting they a whistling disturbance when they adjust the earphone; this is just the noise cancellation and its not louder than the actual music so its not painful or anything.  The battery life could be more, freshly charged i would say about 5-6 hours listening time tops, meaning not the full work day.  Microphone is also a bit finicky if you arent in a perfectly quiet environment.

I wish there was a clip, cuz i only listen to one earphone at a time so they dangle.  Which actually is a bonus by the way, i can drop one earphone from the height of my ear, and the other one will stay in, so thats how well they fit.

Plus the advertised nine hours of battery life is very accurate and prevents me from worrying about the head set dying on my so long as I charge it every other day.

I suppose I should have listened to others regarding the lack of bass. I've switched my smart phone to different settings but not much help. Also, there are breaks in the sound when listening to music from my smart phone (moto force Z). Phone on my side and unit fully charged.
I was expecting much more!

title: Good until...
body:
I thoroughly enjoyed these earbuds and took great care of them because they were the first pair of bluetooth earbuds I have ever bought. I really loved them but today, I started to notice that the left side of the earbud was not playing any sound or would make a weird beeping sound. These are one of the best-bargain earbuds I have ever had and I hope that I can be granted the opportunity to use them in the future as well!
Edit: The TREBLAB company reached out to me very quickly and provided exceptional customer service. I would definitely recommend these earbuds (and I have done so for the past months) to get these earbuds. They provide great value for a relative low price.

title: I would prefer them again

2. Relatively Okay battery life. Meanwhile it requires less time to charge.

title: Dead after 1month 1day
body:
Bought it exactly 1 month and 3 days ago. Left earbud went dead 1 month and 1 day into light use. Figures it would break a day after return policy.

When it wasn't dead, I thought it was fine. Wasn't the most comfortable, and didn't fit as snugly as I had hoped, but probably worth 3.5ish stars for price and quality. The fact that it died barely outside a month after maybe 8 1 hour gym session usages makes me sad.

I bought these earbuds based off of reviews. The earbuds worked fine for about 10 uses, then they failed horribly. The red light stayed on and cant turn on or off.

**Update** The company fully redeemed themselves by replacing the defective earbuds with new ones. They contacted me and we went through the steps to get me new o es and back a satisfied customer

Finally they told me to cut in half with scissors and send them a photo of destroyed unit so they could send a second unit. It stopped working too in right speaker!

title: Save your money
body:
I'm impressed with these headphones. For a great price also, sound quality is good and they feel like good quality

EDIT: They Broke after a few weeks of wear and the cord is very annoying there should be a clip included would not recommend these headphones. They also don't sound as good as cheaper headphones.

title: Design not so great for sports or gym session, but sound is good
body: I bought this to use for when I work out at the gym or go on occasional hikes. I noticed right away that the ear hooks are place too far away from where the ear tips are and would never be close enough for me to use in order to secure the ear buds to my ear. Another issue I noticed is that the control pods are too close to the right ear bud at a little over two inches from the right ear buds. This would cause the right ear buds to be a bit heavier and could possibly cause the tips to come out more easily as even the ear buds have no way to securely hold itself on the right ear. I also feel that the material feels a bit on the cheap side when compared to earbuds of another brand in a lower price range, but that is my opinion. I do however like the sound quality, so they do live up to their claim of better sound quality. All in all, I was not too happy for this product as it did not fit what my use case and their product description well.

title: Imperfect compatibility with iPhone. Some unfortunate design characteristics.
body:
Been using these for a few days now. Sound is pretty good for money, but I'm no audiophile. I love the freedom of not being tethered to the phone. Battery life is excellent for the price and light weight of these buds. However, I do have some complaints. Note, I'm using these with an iPhone 6. You may have a different experience with other devices and operating systems.

1. They're pretty uncomfortable. The smallest tips are still a bit too large for my ears. I guess my canals are on the small side, but I've never had this problem with other in-ear buds. In the past I've been able to use the mediums. Say, with the Marshall ear phones I bought a few years back. It's surprising that none of the offered tips are a good fit, because the treb labs come with several of them. It's hard to believe so many other customers have such gigantic ear holes. I really don't want to go hunting for more tips to make these feel right.

2. They have a very frustrating max-volume alert. So, let's say your track is a little on the quite side and you give the volume a bump trying to get it louder, then BEEP! Your ears are blasted with a loud warning that hurts way worse than the output of the actual media. Terrible feature. How about just allowing the customer to hit the volume button until they're at the max output? It doesn't take a warning beep to inform them there's no more to be had. Just plain stupid design.

3. The center button is all but incompatible with iPhone 6 features as accessed by corded three-button earbuds. It'll start and stop tracks, but it won't activate Siri when you hold it (no big deal for me as she's practically useless anyway). If, as is customary for iOS users, you want to skip tracks by double-clicking, it calls the last incoming phone number. To skip tracks on the treb labs, you need to press and hold the volume up or down button. Unfortunately, you get the beep again. Totally unnecessary.

I seriously wanted to love these, but I probably would not have purchased these for use with my iPhone, if I had known the above. They are a reasonable price, however.

Finally, I'll say that my original review was harsher, but Treb Labs contacted me to clue me in on the volume-hold feature to skip tracks. I had not caught this on my quick skim of the user manual. So I edited my review and bumped up a star for their diligent customer relations.

title: Okey product
body:
I am writing this review after ~15 days of active use.

Overall this is a nice product.

Nice to touch, good looks. Control block is not small (but not bulky either) - 43mm or ~ 1.7 in in length.
It has too many tips to choose :)
Batter life is good
It has nice BT range - I am not feeling attached to the phone.

Random notes with what bothers me a bit:
1. At some moment language switched to Chinese.
2. Instruction claims that earbuds should be charged with provided wire only. This claim for me equals that it provides non-standard charging port.
3. Instruction claims that you'd better not to charge it for more than 2 hours. I don't think producer should make this a consumer problem as it is could be easily solved by hardware/software
4. When track is too quiet and you raise the volume up to maximum - it beeps. The beep is way too loud. Same beep is repeated when you press pause/resume.
5. There are issues to use these earbuds with some iOS applications: for some pause button doesn't work, for some pause button will stop current app and resume play from native apple player. It might be app issues, but I don't have them with plantronics bbfit (that is another BT pair that I can compare with). No issues with native apple apps.

Good or bad?
1. case is bigger than needed, there is space for extra pair (or two) :).

title: So this review is pretty much me comparing the earbuds to them
body: I purchased these earbuds on a DEEP discount. they were stylish. I purchased them after my Powerbeats3 decided to breakdown. So this review is pretty much me comparing the earbuds to them. The battery life is just not as long as the Powerbeats. It was okay. The sound quality left much to be desired. Calls weren't that clear and sounded muffled. And I received many complaints from the other end about me sounding muffled or the picking up of all the other sounds around me. It was good for listening to podcasts tho. For me, the length of the cable was an issue. Maybe an inch or two longer would have made them more comfortable to drape around my neck when I was not using them. They have a feature of having a magnetic back to each of the earbuds, which can turn them into a necklace when not in use. This was cool at first, but it ultimately aided in my losing of the earbuds. My guess is that they might have gotten magnetized to the car door as I was getting in and flew off while I was driving down the interstate. :-/

title: Battery Life not as Promised
body:
Battery life is NO WHERE near as promised. I have had these for a month and the battery life is not as promised. I charged them fully at the beginning of this week and I worked out on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday for about an hour and 15 minutes each time. Came to the gym on Friday morning and they died about 30 minutes in. So that is about 4 hours and 15 minutes of battery time, which is far below the 9 hours as advertised in the listing and that was the biggest selling point for me.  On top of that there is only 1 battery low warning and then they shut off less than 5 minutes later. Of course my return window closed on June 14 and today is June 15, I will have to try and communicate directly to the manufacturer to try and fix this situation.

***Update***
Customer Service experience was good. They were very responsive and refunded the full amount to me even though I was outside of the Amazon return window. I still stand by my 1 star rating of the quality of the headphones.

So far so good I've used them almost everyday and not any problems other than the rubber wings that come with it to hold them more secure don't really fit that well and I've tried all the sizes it came with and the rubber that goes in your ear sometimes when really sweaty they feel like they are slipping out but other than that I can't complain. The battery life is good I've worn them around eight hours listening to iHeartRadio and taken phone calls with no issues.

title: Update
body:
The quality of these ear buds really is great. The Bluetooth connection is great. I can walk to the other side of my house I still have connection. The magnet feature that holds them together is great. Battery life is great. The multiple selections of ear fittings is great.
The ONLY complaint I have (which to me is the most important) is the lack of Bass. The highs are great, but the lack of lows is really disappointing.
I'm not saying I need 15 inch subwoofer thump in my ears, but I do like to have some Bass, and the lack thereof makes it hard to recommend these.

Revisited a month or so later:
Did some tweaking in audio settings per advice from the Treblab team. Was able to boost the bass don't get more of the desired sound! Thanks for the email Treblab!

title: Great headphones while they still work
body: I’ve bought 2 pairs now. I like the headphones, but both pairs I’ve bought started clipping out and eventually died, one pair within about 4 months, the little at about a year.

title: A step up in quality from the $20 range bluetooth earbuds
body:
I own several bluetooth earbuds from Tao Tronics, Mpow and Aukey and the performance on these Treblabs is superior. The listening audio is clearer, with noticeably better treble and mid-range. The bass on these headphones is good for me, but may not satisfy those looking to get a bigger thump.

I used these a lot for making phone calls and this is where they really outperform my other earbuds. I find that the outgoing audio quality is better when the cord runs in front of my neck rather than behind my neck. Both give acceptable quality, but putting the controller closer to my mouth gives a better quality. Background noise reduction is good too. Not as good as a dedicated headset like a plantronics, but good for most uses.

The one knock I have on these is that the earbud is a little larger than my other ones and the housing is made from metal. For me this makes them a little uncomfortable. Nothing major, but I do feel it.

title: Keeps turning off
body:
I studied different bluetooth earbuds before choosing the J1. Part of my research was whether to choose an over ear design or not. For years, I've used a Koss KSC32B Fitclips while running but I don't like having a cord connected to my phone. But the Koss are very comfortable in my ear and have wonderful sound. So I picked the J1, especially after reading that the more expensive models still have average sound and many were reported as being uncomfortable.

My first impression when I received the J1 was that they seemed well-built. The red and black carrying case was nice. But when I first put them in my ears I immediately noticed the difference in comfort from my Koss. They paired easily with my Samsung Edge 7 but the bass was nowhere near that of my Koss. I could push the unit into my ear and the bass would noticeably improve but as soon as I released my finger the earbud would loosen and the bass would decrease. The overall volume level, however, was acceptable. I have tried other bluetooth earbuds, one in particular that was about $10, and it just seems to me like no bluetooth set is going to equal a corded set. So I was willing to just accept that fact in return for the convenience of running without a cord.

My first run did not go well. Within one minute, the J1 just turned off. I checked my phone and bluetooth was still on and the J1 still showed up on the list but it was no longer paired. I tried to pair it again but my phone said it was not available. I long-pressed the center button on the J1 and heard "power on", telling me the J1 had just turned off, even though I never heard "power off". The unit automatically re-paired and I continued with my run. A few minutes later, it turned off again. Same thing as before - I long pressed the J1 and again heard "power on" with following re-pairing. A few minutes later, it happened again. Obviously, this interrupted my run. At the end of my run, I got a phone call and easily answered it through the J1. Halfway through the call though the J1 just turned off. Unlike my run, where I carry my phone in a fanny-pak, during the phone call I carried my phone in my hand. So it could not be a weaker signal due to my phone enclosed in my fanny-pak.

Needless to say, this is very frustrating. And there doesn't seem to be any pattern to it, for example, turning off after a certain amount of time. The pamphlet that came with the J1 suggested doing a factory reset  if there is "frequent disconnection". While my problem is not "frequent disconnection" but rather "frequent turning off", I did a factory reset and and am going to see if the unit still turns off on its own. I'll update this review in a few days.

Update: 10-18-2018

After the factory reset, I went on another run and it seemed to be fine. Then the J1 turned off again after about 20 minutes. That's certainly better than turning off after just a minute or so, like the first time, but still unacceptable. Once again, my phone showed the J1 unavailable. Long pressing the center button I would hear "power on" with auto re-pairing. My next run, I went back to my Koss wired set and I so enjoyed the vibrant bass and quality of sound. It made me think again whether I was willing to accept lower quality sound just to avoid the cord. I went back to researching more wireless sets and it seems that they all have issues and bad reviews, with hardly any earning more than 50% in the five-star range. That goes for the cheap sets as well as the most expensive. I've concluded, unfortunately, that the state of the art in bluetooth earbuds is just not to the point yet where it justifies throwing my wired set away. I'm going back to my tried and true Koss wired earbuds!

The J1 is going back for a refund.

body:

title: Very happy

title: Worked for about 3 weeks before it started dying mid-run ...
body: Worked for about 3 weeks before it started dying mid-run (like mile 1.5) with a drunken sounding voice before just shutting off. Spend the money and go for the ones you know won't fall out of ears or die so quickly.

title: One Star
