title: Not Noise Cancellingl
body: These are nice ear buds but they are not noise canceling. They are actually "passive" noise canceling which does nothing. They should be required to state the word "passive" in the description!  Very deceiving.

title: not as good as my Shure wired but good for Bluethooth
body: My dissatisfaction is totally my fault. I wanted waterproof so I could use in pool and hot tub, I misunderstood the "waterproof" rating and got water resistant instead of waterproof. My mistake. Headphones sound ok, not as good as my Shure wired but good for Bluethooth. Battery life is good. Directions on where the charging port is located would have saved my about 20 minutes trying to locate the charging port.

title: Great
body: Great

title: The bluetooth worked fine, all the buttons worked
body: The bluetooth worked fine, all the buttons worked, and sound quality was what you pay for, but one earbud stopped working only a few weeks into using them.

title: 3 and half stars
body:
Sound quality is 5 stars, volume 4 stars (not very loud but better i've tested), bluetooth range 5 stars (real good range), battery life 3 stars (around 7hrs no where near 9 hrs), comfort 2 stars (not so comfortable and does not stay in place, It will fall out with movement).
Overall nice pair of earbuds with good sound quality if you can find that right fit.

title: Not too tight
body: It doesn’t project the bass if you don’t hold it with the fingers

title: Honestly amazing. I am a music junkie and listen to ...
body: Honestly amazing. I am a music junkie and listen to music 24/7, especially music with strong bass. The bass is amazing and the sound is incredibly rich. I used to rock JBL headphones before this, although they were a little opd they were very good, but this is even better! I had a little trouble connecting to my phone, it would not recognize the headphones, but after restarting my phone and charging then a little bit they worked perfectly. I can absolutely recommend these headphones!

title: Headphones are average
body:
I had high hopes for these, and they’re just alright. The wings are a bit uncomfortable for longer sessions and the sound is not much better than my $17 dodocools. These headphones do not connect to multiple devices at one time, another point to the $17 headphones. I am starting to hear static as well. I really wanted to give these a chance, still trying, but it looks like they may go back if this keeps up.

Plus side: they look nice, part of the reason I bought them, but oh well

title: Excellent!
body: I've had these for about 6 months.  Awesome sound quality, good battery life, and superior customer service from the seller.  Highly recommended!!

title: replacement hell
body: The product itself is good, sound quality is what you expect in the price range and the accessories that come with it make it so they fit anyone very comfortably. the problem I ran into was with customer service. 4 months after purchasing mine I stopped getting audio out of the right ear piece. This lead me to find out the warranty is only a year long. The agent I corresponded with had me send a picture of the malfunctioning ear buds which is understandable to prevent scams. It has now been 2 weeks since that with a promise that i will get a replacement being unfulfilled without any compensation. This is a problem as i exercise daily and labor for a living. With the wide range selection in this price point for wireless ear buds I would recommend staying away from this as it only lasted me 5 months and Treblab feels it unnecessary to even update with me on or fulfill their warranty.

title: They look nice and feel nice when wearing them
body: Got these thru a promotion for $10. They look nice and feel nice when wearing them. look like a quality made item. BUT! They do not have much bass at all, so if you're into bass do not buy them. I gave mine to my wife who uses them for her android tablet for watching Netflix. They are definitely not made for music or at least on the three devices I tried them on. These include Samsung Galaxy S5 phone, Samsung Galaxy Tab A6, and a Windows PC with Windows 10 and an ASUS USB Bluetooth adapter.

title: Great Buy! No regrets
body: I bought these earbuds about a few days ago and they sound and feel great in my ears! I love bass and they serve just the right amount to satisfy me, if your looking for good wireless earbuds for a affordable price get these they truly are well made for the price.

title: good bang for buck
body:
I previously gave these 5 stars, because they couldn't be beat when you considered what they offered vs the price.  However, they only worked for about a month and now they no longer work.

This is what happened.  I charged them for about a day, and turned them on to connect to my phone.  They would connect for a second, and then turn off on their own.  So I put them back on the charger, left them for another day, and now they won't turn on at all.  End of story :(

title: Pretty good for the money.
body: These are great little buds, especially for the price. The battery capacity seems to diminish a bit in a rather short amount of charge/discharge cycles, but for $40 bucks, I guess it's the nature of the beast. They stay in your ears pretty well, even with difficult ears like mine. The sound quality and comfort-levels are pretty good as well. The rubber ends create a really good seal in your ear canal such that I can run my lawn-mower and hear music at a reasonably low volume.

title: Ear fit wasnt the best, Battery terrible, Rarely Pairs
body:
The ear bud fit wasnt quite that good. Many times one or both fell out during my run. The sound quality was nice. The battery was good for about 1 run.

Update: I had to buy another one because the battery would only last for about 40 minutes now after a full charge. It rarely pairs with my Samsung S9 as well.

title: Great customer service!
body:
The original set I bought I believe we're defective. The sound quality was not that good and I just wasn't very impressed with them. When the company read my review they went out of their way to try understand what went wrong and a correct the problem. Turns out the original set was most likely defective.

What I was most impressed with was the company's customer service. It was one of the few times I've seen a company more interested and what I thought of their product then the profit they were going to make or lose. They replaced the headphones with another set and a sound quality was much much better. Everybody is different, they like a different fit feel sound Etc... but I am happy with this product I would definitely recommend it. More than that I would recommend this company just for the outstanding customer service.

title: Love these!
body: I’m seriously very picky about audio and these are excellent! I bought them so I could listen to music and charge my iPhone X at the same time and I’ve made a great choice!

title: Great purchase
body: Great product wonderful sound amazing phone sound I'm satisfied.

title: Great buy
body: I use these earbuds for working out and they stay in place pretty good. The sound is very good for the price and the battery life is good for hours. The earbuds are a great buy.

title: GREAT PRODUCT
body: Hi.. The product is great... also TREBLAB customer service is outstanding

title: Worked great for about a week
body: Worked great for about a week. Then the right side would work off and on. Now it doesn't work at all on the right side.

title: Great for the price / good customer service
body: I’ll give it an 8/10,  is only 39 dollars. Mine had a problem, i followed the steps and got a new one totally free!

title: Love them. Several size selections to choose from
body: Love them. Several size selections to choose from. I have small ears and was able to find the right size for me.

title: SO MUCH better than my old headphones
body: SO MUCH better than my old headphones! Sound quality is great and they stay in while I'm walking/running! Very happy- thanks!

body: Bought these back in February.  As of last Friday they no longer work.  Absolute garbage.  This is the second set of Treblabs that I have purchased with equally disappointing results.

title: Great product so far!!👌
body: I'm trying the product so far so good , I see that most problem they have will be connections, but I've been used them for month and a half , will see what happens

title: Good
body: So far no complaints.  Easy to connect.  Good sound quality.  It appears others can hear me when it's a telephone call and most importantly, it stays in my ears.

title: Very good while they worked
body: One speaker stopped working after 1.5 years, just out of warranty but used everyday.. I have no idea if that’s average or not, seems like they should last longer. Other than that these are great. Sounds real good, good battery life, fast charge, easy controls.

title: I use them but...
body: I have small ears and so these are yet another set that don’t work well for me. The smallest set of buds are too larg. Sound ok but not great. Controls ok but not great. Connectivity range is less than with other makes I hav used. I would not purchase another set of these.

title: They fit great after major adjustment in stuffing them into my ears
body: They fit great after major adjustment in stuffing them into my ears. I changed out the earbuds and find to the sizes that best fit me, but they weren’t the greatest fit. Extremely great sound quality. I find that the ear buds fall out of my ear while running, and after testing out every possible combination on each ear, none fit right :( and the one that did fit the most on my right ear keeps falling off

title: I like it
body: I had a Dr Dre at 300.00 only last 2 years

title: Great value for money.
body: The headphones are really nice, packaged very well, I love the little round carry case. The sounds is clear with great beats and what is most important they are comfortable and do not sleep of the ears while sport activities. Worth the investment!

title: Poor battery life, good sound quality
body: Poor battery life, good sound quality, very easy to pair with my iPhone

title: Two Stars
body: Sound is good, but item so uncomfortable for ears.

title: A BIG WIN!!!
body: Finally some plugs that actually fit me right. I always seem to have issues with getting a tight fit to prevent bass bleeding and a weak sound. (Not a fan of over ear headphones for gym) and the unit itself?? Sound amazing to me and get me in my zone. I wish i would have found this brand sooner. #happycustomer

title: Five Stars
body: Great fit - fantastic sound.  Sound as good or better than the Bose headphones I replaced with these.

After numerous purchases of ear buds and trying to find a pair that was suited for the active lifestyle I live, I finally found a pair that not only blocks out any unwanted noises, but are Bluetooth. Crisp clear sound that actually produces adequate bass. For the price, I would recommend the Treblab J1 to anybody who is interested in a suitable replacement for their old ear buds.

title: Would recommend

title: Great Product!
body: These were the second pair of TREBLAB earbuds that I've purchased.  The J1 model is an excellent product.  One of my daughters borrowed them from me and she raved about the sound, ease of use and reliability.  TREBLAB you have a customer for life.

The sound is excellent and true noise canceling
Recommend others to purchase.

Another GREAT Thing iREALLY like  about Treblab is that you can talk with your phone.. I LOVE TREBLAB PRODUCTS...Nothing I dislike about them

title: The right headphone was not working
body: The product was defective and the sound was weak with no bass.

title: Not made for athletic purposes
body: Bought 2 pairs. Lost first pair and bought a second since I liked the noise cancellation and the sound quality was okay. When connected to computer Bluetooth, the sound quality is below decent. Used the second pair for 6 months with active gym and running use. These earbuds do not stay in your ear while running. Because of the weight of sound control connected to the right side earbud, the running motion causes them to fall out unless you lodge the earbud in your ear. After 6 months of use, the earbud began to make static noises from the sweat getting into the wiring. Overall, 2/5 stars since they really aren’t made to last if used for athletic purposes. Use your money on Apple Earbuds

title: Four Stars
body: They are working really well.  My only criticism is that they don't stay in my ears very well.

title: Great until they weren't
body: These headphones worked great (synced well, great battery life, good sound and noise cancellation), then one day one of the earbuds stopped working. I don't know why, but I definitely prefer to have 2 working earbuds, so I can't give these a good review. For context, I kept them out of water and made sure to handle them as delicately as was reasonable.

title: Battery life is not the best.
body: After 5 months of use. Battery got weaker every day. Until they just stop working one day.

title: We'll see if the customer service is better than the left speaker-----Updated!!!
body:
Unboxed.......charged.......left speaker doesn't work.......quality control????????
We'll see if the customer service is better than the left speaker.

Updated------IPhone 6 audio L/R settings needed to be changed in order for these to work correctly.
It was pretty difficult to navigate to the proper place in the settings menu ( Settings/General/Accessibility, then scroll all the way down to L/R balance)  , this was not an issue with the product.
They work great and the customer service was excellent with communication !

title: These are the WORST Bluetooth earbuds on the market
body: Thirds head phones are not worth your money or time. They constantly turn off. The don’t have good battery life and they are poor quailty

title: Great value for the price
body: Exceeded my expectations. This is the first review that I have ever wrote but this product deserved it. I originally bought the earbuds for running but I like them so much that I use them for work everyday. I make a ton of phone calls throughout the day as a truck driver and the call quality is very good and they allow me to be comply with the hands free cell phone use laws.  For the price I highly recommend them for exercise, driving or everyday use.

title: A few issues, but all handled great
body: For the first month, I really enjoyed the headphones. Some issues with the Bluetooth connection while my phone was in a pocket, but nothing too bad. After the first month, one of the earbuds stopped working, but the company was great about sending out a replacement.

title: Amazing sound but it does not fit well into my ...
body: Amazing sound, quality build, fast bluetooth connectivity but it does not fit that well into my small ear canal and  or else I would have given 5 stars.

title: Very nice, read the institution first, save your headphones
body: Nice for the money.  just don't forget to turn them off.  8 hours of power most days  Don't leave them on the charger all the time! only charge when you hear low power, and when charged don't put then back on the charger until you need to, unless you want to kill them.  Treblab J1 has a very small battery. powerful sound

title: Bud Went Out After a Year
body: Like the product sound is decent but the left ear bud went out on me after a year. I’ve had two pairs of these and the same issue on both.

title: not for people with small ears and does not work while charging but otherwise great
body:
I had great hopes for this headset based on the reviews. Unfortunately, it does not work that well for me. The  ergonomics of the earbuds are just not for people with small ears. None of the supplied earbuds worked. I have to constantly press on both earbuds to force them into my ears to  hear anything. clearly. Otherwise the sound is very faint even at max volume. Something about the design..  that  makes it not fit well in the ear. I bought probably over 30 "in ear" headphones over the years, and they all worked well, while they lasted. But unfortunately not this one. I even tried to to use silicone plugs  from my other headsets - that worked very well for me with these other headsets - but still, they do not sit well in the ear with this headset. Maybe the "stem" is too short? Or the base too big, preventing the earbuds from going deeper into the ear canal?

 Another problem for me  is that it  does not play when charging - at least I could not figure out how to make it play when charging.
 If not for these two issues, it would have been a fantastic headset. No clips, just a short wire from ear to ear. Wonderful design, but needs some  improvements as noted above.

UPDATE: The seller was very gracious and offered  fitting tips which I am going to try, and  a partial refund (if I keep the buds) or full refund if I return them.. Based on their prompt and gracious  response to my review I am upping my rating from 2  to 4 stars.

UPDATE 2: Per seller's recommendation I ordered another set of tips (small conical) and with these new tips the headset works great for me.  I am updating my rating to 5 starts now.

title: Great for my workouts and many earbuds for different size ...
body: Great for my workouts and many earbuds for different size ears their is surely one to fit your ear. Great ear buds!

title: Update
body: Well after a month, I have some issues with the headphones holding a charge.  I am having to charge them every day before my run.  Once I turn them off the do not power back up the next day.  I have contacted the support email we will see how the do with their warranty. It has been 3 days and still no response from the support team.  They got back to me and after some problem solving they decided to offer replacement or refund.  I chose replacement as the product worked well except for battery life.  I sent them proof of it being destroyed, but then told it was out of stock.  I was a little frustrated as I could have continued to use with a short battery until it was in stock.  Lucky it came back in stock the next day and they sent the replacement which I received the next day.  I have had no other problems.  Very happy with the replacement. Sound good and the battery lasts.  Worth the time to get a good one.

Thank you for standing behind your product. AWESOME CS. Raised to 4 stars. Will raise again if the replacement gets past 3 months.

body: Thoroughly enjoy the earbuds.Have been buying Treblab ear buds for a while,  and never been disappointed. I just over use and abuse them , so I have to buy new ones. I recommend these buds because of price and quality of the sound.

body: These are awesome they are way better then some top end brands. I am a runner and after 2 pairs of skull candy and a pair of JBL wireless went out on me I tried a brand I had not heard of. Sure glad I got these and didn't blow more money on high priced headphones the sound is great and they stay put when running.

title: Best I’ve tried!
body: I’ve tried several Bluetooth earbuds, and they either lost connection, or were just bad quality. These Treblab J1’s are awesome!  Great battery life, fit, and quality are the best!  For the money, you can’t beat them!

title: Four Stars
body: Fast service, excellente product

title: Just make sure the quality of the sound is bettered
body: Although I’m happy with the product the sound/v olume is too low. The price I paid was $39.99 but found the on Amazon for $19.97....all in all it was a so so purchase

title: Update......
body:
Initial review after 1 day. Charged till blue light appeared, took about 1.5 hours.
Connected fine to my iPhone X with no problems. Sound and volume were excellent, BUT.......shut down after about one hour of continuous use.  Recharge took 20 minutes from red light to blue(full charge?).  Lasted an hour again? Based on sound quality and volume I was initially thrilled with these!. What's with the lousy battery life?
Not good!

1 month update.
After following the manufacturers reset procedure and charging with their cable overnight, these things lasted well over 7 hours continuous! Now I need to brag about how great they truly are. Great sound, plenty of volume, convenient magnets to keep them secure, plenty of useful fit options and great battery life!

title: Ok good things: -the warranty for a yr
body:
Ok good things :
-the warranty for a yr.
-the easy to use and connect.
-the sound is great.
-it's a great portable device for every day heavy duty use.
-the shipping, cost and color.

The Bad:
-well I got it on Jan 12th it's now April 7 so it pretty much lasted 4 months strong, because one of the hear phones stopped emitting noise, unless you wiggle with it.
-it's a very sensitive type, I mean I wont suggest using these when knowing you will sweat alot or will be in extremely hot weather and or vice versa, i live in Florida so it sucks for me, I had to watch it and do not leave it in my car.
-overall If you pick white color your going to have to be careful and clean it because mine got really dirty quick.
-now this is, I believe a person to person thing. The thing that I value the most is the fit, and I never got these to ever fit right, but like I said I always had this problem before, but it's really annoying.
-I never really measured the distance of the Bluetooth range but it's little, I would say because of walls though but outside I'm sure it would reach the proper distance.
-personally I hate the fact that these don't skip the music it only makes call.

Summary :
I would recommend but with a warning.

title: Buy Them!
body: Omg! These headphones for this price is amazing like the only set back Is that the wing tips don't fit inside my ear but other than that they are worth it because wireless earbuds do have a drawback but these headphones sound like 300 or 400 dollar pairs.

title: Great headset with a good price
body: I was looking for the middle class of bluetooth ear buds. Something with good quality that isn't too expensive. I already have a wired Bose ear bud set and didn't want to spend that kind of money again. The quality did not disappoint and even exceeded my expectations. It does a great job at the noise cancellation but with this comes with a little discomfort from time to time because it feels like my ear canals are being plunged. This is only my experience though, everyone's ears are different. This does not deter me from highly recommending this product.

title: Five Stars
body: Price was unbelievable . Product is unbelievable

title: SIMPLY THE BEST FOR THE MONEY!!!!
body: READ THIS!!! These are by far the best sounding, longest time between charge headphones out there for this price. The sound is better than the big named brands. These will literally blow your eardrums out!  I am tempted to buy another pair just in case they ever stop making them. BUY THEM! You won't be disappointed.

title: 5 Stars
body: Very good quality, happy with the product. I love that it has magnets, making it easy to put these headphones together. Case also very handy and useful.

title: Solid, but will die/break when you sweat in them
body: I've gotten a replacement pair from the company, which was great. However, the replacement pair has died now as well. They can't handle sweat, unfortunately. Not good for workouts

title: Five Stars
body: Super product, easy to set up and use. Sound quality is excellent and the customer service is great

title: Buy it, I've tried several and own Power Beats.  These are awesome...AND CHEAP.
body:
Excellent product!

I have a pair of wired Power Beats and these sound every bit as good as they do without the wires and hassle of the connections getting damaged.  Easy to connect, long battery life.  The ear pieces need to be selected and inserted  correctly which takes a minute but worth it.

Far better than my LG with Harmon-Kardon sound
They are not as clear as my wired RHA 750i headphones but they cost one-sixth as much and are wireless so not a valid comparison.

Highs and Mids are clear, the Bass is solid, far better than the Apple Headset and although not quite as pronounced as the SkullCandy Ink'd 2 (wired), it more than makes up for it with the Mid/High clarity that isn't there with the SC Ink'd 2.

title: Five Stars
body: Great sound and easy to set up on iPhone .  Use in the gym and best I've had yet

title: Two Stars
body: Sounds is not that great. They are comfortable

title: These earbuds are pretty nice when they work
body: These earbuds are pretty nice when they work. Sound quality is not great, but what should be expected with wireless buds. The problem that ruins these earbuds for me is how poorly they stay in your ears. The product comes with many different sizes of rubber and foam buds however none of these make any difference because the large plastic part just behind the bud pushes on the outside of the ear, forcing the headphone out of your ear. Luckily I do not use these as sport headphones, because on the rare chance you do get the earbuds to stay in, they will pop right back out at the slightest motion. In my opinion this seems like a very easy design fix, as it seems like this plastic bit is purely aesthetic, and if Treblab would fix this, I would definitely recommend this product for the price.

title: They have a great sound, connectivity is good
body: They have a great sound, connectivity is good. My issue is I think my ears are too small and the little piece that is supposed to help keep them in my ears does not work for me. Also, even with the attachment for the cord, if you don't put both plugs in your ears one side gets a little heavy and pulls it out of my ear. I found a clip to put on it and it helps a lot. Overall I would recommend them.

title: Speaker stopped working after only 6 months
body:
The reason I purchased these earbuds back in May 2018 was because I work for the Airlines and wanted a pair of earbuds that not only plays good music but also blocks out noise from the aircrafts...these earbuds did the job.
UNTIL now 6 months later the right speaker stopped working.

title: Great sound quality
body: Charging device should be added

title: The Treblab J1's work great! Use them at the gym and on airline ...
body: The Treblab J1's work great! Use them at the gym and on airline flights. The sound quality is very good.  Prefer the foam ear pieces over the silicone for better sound performance. Well worth the money spent. And oh, a nice woman tells you when power is on, off, and when your battery is low.  :)

title: weak batteries
body: Good sound quality, but the battery life really declined after a few uses.  I'm lucky if these earbuds will even last an hour, which is not helpful at all in the gym or traveling.

i bought them as a budget earbuds and i wasnt expecting such amazing qualit.
it has wonderful bass, amazing high and lows and amazing quality build.
i love them

title: Rock Star
body: I use them when i'm working out. Sound quality very very good

title: Poor Sound Quality and NOT Noise Canceling
body:
I'm very surprised that these are an Amazon choice and at the good reviews.  They may be good headsets but the sound quality is absolutely horrible!  I use a lot of different headsets, I have several for working out as backups and backups of backups and have therefore gone through many headsets.  Though I found them comfortable to wear, they were constantly sliding because the volumes are one one side making that side heavier and therefore the wire lopsided. The good headsets have an anchor at the back to distribute the weight.

However, I would even settle for that if the sound was good but it absolutely is not.  I have JLB headsets as my main pair.  Listening to the same song on either headsets makes the song fall flat on these.  Listen to anything loudly with some treble and you'll see how they will fail.

Sent these back.  Definitely not worth nearly $50.  Also, they did not do anything for noise canceling.  I could hear everything around me at the gym.

title: these are just ok, sending them back because the ...
body: these are just ok, sending them back because the left driver started to crackle after only 30 min of use. plus they ready didn't fit that well either. oh well, ​I'll keep looking....

Yes there are better products out there but I Guarantee not at this price point.  They can contend on any upper levels.  Good product for 50 dollars.  YOU WILL NOT BEAT THAT or EVEN COME CLOSE.

title: Not for Me
body: This is my first set of Bluetooth ear buds. The Treblab J1 have been a little disappointing. The sound quality is sub-par, virtually no bass. They are uncomfortable and too heavy for me. They seem to be well made and have better range than I expected, but I'll be using my old Skull Candy buds.

title: Best value
body: I'm only a few days into using these, but so far so good. For the price, I can't imagine there are many better Bluetooth buds. Sound is great. Buds are comfortable once you get the right configuration of included accessories. They look clean and feel well-made (other than the flat wiring which feels like it might be an issue down the road--but that is speculation). We'll see how they hold up as I am about to take them on a trip and start using them daily at work, during workouts, etc. I feel positive about them and suspect they will be troopers. I'll update if there are any changes. Thanks, Treblab! Also, it came with a 10% coupon for Treblab once I registered the warranty.

title: These have the best sound and the battery lasts all day even when ...
body: These have the best sound and the battery lasts all day even when I forget to turn them off sometimes.

title: I cannot KEEP these in my ears!
body: I am not quite sure why but I cannot keep or even secure even the smallest of the ear buds into my ears properly.  They continually fall out.  I try to wiggle them into my ear canal but they just pop back out.  I am at a loss as to what I can do.  The smallest of the earbuds is too large for my ear canal, I guess.....I did read that there are other sizes (smaller, I presume as well as larger) and maybe someone can tell me how to get some smaller ones as I absolutely am having the hardest time trying to use and to like these earbuds.  Thanks

title: Great sound quality and comfy
body: My 1st pair of wireless earphones. These have great sound quality and fit perfectly. Great directions and ease of use. The only negative thing I dislike is the annoying beep, especially when changing songs and pausing. It is way to loud.

title: Closest to perfect.
body: OUTSTANDING. They're very loud, fit very well, noise cancelling, incredibly minimal noise bleeding to literally nothing in complete silenced areas, incredible sound quality, longlasting quality worth for a day of work and more. The best earbuds I've ever used in my entire life, I suggest these to everyone!

title: Long battery life  before recharge
body: Very easyPairing with iPhone.

title: Surprising
body: I had read an article reviewing the Trelab headphones some time ago on one of the nerdy tech sites I follow. The product reviews were very positive but the price point just made me too sceptical that they could back up the reviews. Well I stand corrected. I have been using them for two weeks now and haven’t one negative thing to say about them. Sound is on par with my Beats ear buds and they have not skipped or lost connection at any time.

title: Five Stars

Needed to replace my old earbuds and came across these ones
So happy that i found them

title: I REALLY wanted to like these.
body: I really wanted to like these but the sound just didn't impress me and they fit awkwardly in my ears, like they're too big despite using the smallest fittings. The left earbud of the pair I received also made an odd crinkling noise when pressed on, confirmed by multiple people.

title: Borderline wanting to get a refund
body:
PROS: This is my first set of BT headphones and the ease of pairing, connectivity and battery life is great.

CONS: The acoustic fidelity and fitment of buds themselves are maybe 6/10.  Just all around average.

title: Three Stars
body: The sound is great, but I guess for my ears they fall out easily than my other earbuds.

title: Right speaker stopped working after 2 months
body: Solid built headphones with decent sound and perfect for the gym but after only 2 months of use the right speaker stopped working.

title: Great!
body: Headphones come with multiple sizes to fit any ear. They are noise cancelling earbuds that are true to its advertisement. Base and sound quality is very good especially with the price. Charge time is very good with lot of battery life. They are a fantastic piece of headphones and I do recommend them.

title: Poor quality
body: Very poor quality. They were charged over night and lasted 1 hour the next day.

title: Better than J1 for storing in your pocket!
body:
The Treblab XR700 is a better choice than the J1 if you carry them in your pocket. The J1 turns on too easily. You have to hold the on/off switch for three seconds to turn on the  XR700. Also, the Custom Adjustable Earhooks work better than any I've tried. They actually adjust! Plus, the sound is great!

If you don't carry your headphones in your  pocket, the J1 is really good; good sound quality, good fit.

Plus, a word about Treblab customer service: when I complained about the J1 they reached out to me and have been incredibly responsive. With such outstanding customer service, I would buy anything from them.

title: These earbuds are great!
body: The only thing I dislike is the fact that they are wired together but I knew they were when I bought them. They are great quality!

title: Well worth the price! Great sound quality (better than the iPhone wired earbuds)
body: Favorite earbuds! I was skeptical, but the sound quality is outstanding! Crisp, clear, with deep, undistorted bass. They sound better than the wired earbuds that come with the iPhone. I was pleasantly surprised by the noise-cancelling quality as well. I use the memory foam tips and they block out pretty much all outside noise. I use them when I'm studying, at the gym, or going for a run. They're light enough that they stay in your ears and are comfortable too. So far, they've lasted about six hours per charge and fully charge in about half an hour. Seems too good to be true. I've had them for a couple of months now and use them every day. If the battery ever starts to degrade, I'd probably buy the same ones again. Well worth the price.

title: Surprised me, glad I got them
body: I seen these on a Facebook ad where I could get them for under $20. I was like that's not bad, so I purchased them. Let me say these are some very nice earbuds. They are loud enough where they drown out any sound. Talking to someone on the phone they are clear and no one had issues hearing me talk. There are voice prompts when the power comes on, when connected, powering off and when the battery is low. They are a bit uncomfortable after a while, but I can manage (that's just me), I take them off during each break at my job. I tried the memory foam ear cushions they weren't that comfortable so I went back to the that came on them. I will try the smaller ones to see if they help. Overall, I'm satisfied with these earbuds. I have other styles but I have come to like these better than the more expensive ones I have. You shouldn't be disappointed when you purchase these.

title: Good value product!
body:
Excellent product, good sound quality and comfortable. The magnet function is super practical!!!

Some times disconnect and reconnect... but for the price , great option!!!

title: UPDATE: They're great
body:
UPDATE: The founder of the company reached out and offered to send me a better set of headphones. The battery life is great and they came with foam earbuds that stayed in my ear no matter what. Much happier with the product and would definitely buy again.

I purchased these in February 2017 and one headphone doesn't work now for some reason.
For the time that they were working, they were okay.
Battery life wasn't great (I listen to them for about four hours continuously before they need to be recharged).
For gym people: they don't stay in your ears - no matter how clean your ears are. Probably wouldn't buy these again.

title: Amazing
body: Just got these bad boys... And I am blown away.. So much that I am writing my first review on a product.  Not only is the price amazing, but the quality is there, fit is great, sound is fantastic, my fiance is not into listening to music through headphones, and after trying these out, she's looking into downloading music just so she can order these headphones for herself ... I couldn't be happier with this purchase, and will definitely shop treblab for any future headphone needs

title: to each his/her own
body: Doesn't feel comfortable

title: Real problem solving service by the Treblab
body: One side stopped working after just 3 months and I was very disappointed with the issue. I took it up with the company, the  customer service is (5 stars) as they didn't waste no time to fix the issue by replacing my headset with a working one. I greatly appreciate that helpful gesture. Sound is 5 star, connectivity is also great and customer care awesome.

title: sound is great, fits great and doesnt fall out of your ...
body: sound is great, fits great and doesnt fall out of your ear.  The bad thing is they only last 2.5 hour battery life or at least mine do.  I worked with Tech support and they had me reset it. (all via email which took a full day every time they got back to me.)  after the reset nothing changed and still died. I just returned them and picked up the BeatsX instead.

title: as well as the three pairs of wings made it easy to find a good fit
body: I've only had them for a few hours but getting them to fit properly with the supplied three pairs of soft foam and three pairs of rubber tips, as well as the three pairs of wings made it easy to find a good fit. They are truly noise cancelling. Once they are fit, you get the full range of sound. They can go very loud. Controls are easy to work and pairing with my iPhone 7 Plus took seconds. The magnetic clasp makes them easy to wear around your neck when not in use. Three-year guarantee!  The sound is comparable to Apple earpods. Good value for the money.

title: Could have been perfect
body:
When it arrived, it looked nothing like the pictures. Flimsy. BUT sound quality is excellent, and the passive sound insulation out of this world. I used it for a few weeks, but suddenly the battery life fell from 8 hours to less than 3. Had to return it. I suppose it was a fluke, and perhaps I will buy another one in the following months.

If it kept its battery life, it would deserve the $40.

title: Five Stars
body: This is a great set of earbuds. Very impressed with the quality, sound, clear talk, and battery life.

title: Sound and fit is good, but I have two complaints.
body:
Sound quality is good and I like the way they fit in my ears but I have two problems with them.

The battery and volume control is far to the right ear side of the wire which seems to imbalance the wire behind my head and overtime it slides to my right side. Whenever I turn my head right my left earbud pulls on the tightened imbalanced wire and sometimes pulls out of my ear.

The second problem is charging the battery.  The manual says that leaving it plugged into the charger for more than two hours can damage the battery and void the warranty.  This is very annoying.  I like to charge all my electronics overnight so they are fully charged for the next day.  That is hard to do if I have to babysit this and unplug it after two hours.

title: Glad I bought
body: I really enjoy these. I've had for about 5 months and they hold up well in many situations. The magnetic clips on the ends is a must for me as I've lost another pair that had just a clip for my collar. They are so light I forget I have them on and realize it way later and wished I had remembered to take them off. Sound is great. They hook up to my ipad, iphone and imac seamlessly. Would buy as a gift or would buy again.

title: Fullness of Sound
body: While not the loudest earbids in the world the richness and depth of sound far exeeded expectation. The bass is full and all frequencies across the range came across fully represented. These are the best earbuds I have ever listend to. Do not think they are not adequtly loud because they are just not painfull considering buying a second pair.

title: Battery Charging not charging
body: I used this product once was very happy with the product but... It will not take a charge now and looking for replacement

title: Great sound quality, comfort, and battery. But don't expect to have them last for years.
body: Worked great up until a week ago when the left ear bud stopped working entirely. Lasted nearly a year before doing so and I used them almost daily when I was at school or working out. Only reason why I'm giving a 4 is because they didn't even last a year, but up until then they were perfect for sound quality, battery life, and comfort. Also, I did drop them a few times and went through the washing machine (on accident of course) twice. But somehow the ear buds lasted for a while after that. So it might have been my fault as well, but don't expect to get more than a year's use with these.

title: Five Stars
body: Best $40 or my life

title: In thE NYC Subway and at BLINK these have me covered
body: Great! I wear these on the subway and can hear every word of my downloaded tv shows. And, they never fall out of my ears. Seriously thinking about getting their earbuds.

title: Not Durable
body: I have had these for a month and some change.  I run 4 times a week.  This week they switched off on and died after 30 minutes of running two days in a row..... after the return window closed.

title: great purchase
body: i really like this product. i had to buy smaller earbuds. i got this for my nephew. he uses and wears it everyday. great balanced sound.

title: Meh...They’re ok.
body: The headphones these replaced had shorter battery life but much better sound quality. The battery life also didn’t live up to expectations as advertised on these either. That’s issue 1. Issue 2 is the sound quality. It’s not very dynamic. It’s rather thin and tinnish lacking low lows and high highs. Saving grace is that they are more comfortable than the Plantronic Backbeat 2s they replaced.

title: Great Headphones. Great company.
body: Very solid product. Good build quality and they get quite loud as well. Battery life is quite excellent and overall a solid headphone. Also their customer service is amazing!

title: Good
body:
Unexpected
Ultra nice

title: Very good purchase
body: Really happy with this purchase my boyfriend wants mine so I will Be ordering another pair.

title: Quality product
body: For driving

title: The serrated edges on the earbuds were a great touch, now I can bleed from the ears ...
body: The serrated edges on the earbuds were a great touch, now I can bleed from the ears while listening to static because my earbuds can't maintain a connection for more than a second at a time. Apparently it can connect from 30 feet away but the distance from my back pocket to my head is just too much. I get that these are budget Bluetooth earbuds, but these are the worst of any Bluetooth earbuds I've purchased.

title: Great quality. Make sure to fit the right earpiece
body: Great quality. Make sure to fit the right earpiece. Definitely a steal for the price. Calls come through clear. No complaints

title: Get the Warranty
body: Product was initially good but after just five months, the right side started to cut out so buyer beware. The four year warranty is probably a must if you decide to purchase.

title: Great customer service, great headphones
body:
The headphones are really pretty good, but they just don’t last. One of the ears goes out. True lab was nice and sent me a replacement pair but the same happened with those. I really want to review these better, but they’re just not reliable.

Edit: My original review stands, but the customer service team was prompt and professional in reaching out to me to replace these headphones.

title: Revised After Extremely Helpful and Dedicated Customer Service
body:
These earbuds sound great for the price, and personally, I vastly prefer the earplug type earbuds to apple-type earbuds since I can hear my music and the sound quality is good without having to listen at a volume that is dangerous to my ears. These also have insane battery life. I've not actually measured or kept careful records, but in my experience, I can use these to periodically listen (maybe 1-2 hours a day) and these will nearly go a week before I have to charge again. The main reason for 5 stars, however, is the customer support. I got two duds before I got a working pair, but both times the company was quick to respond and the replacement process was painless. Though I wish I got a working pair the first time, their great customer service tells me that I was probably just unlucky and that if you have a problem it will be fixed.
In the interest of transparency I will leave my original (one star) review below
______________________________________________________________________

When I first got these headphones, they sounded great and lasted for a week at a time. I loved them. Unfortunately, they began to only play music to one side at a time, and within a few weeks, the Bluetooth began disconnection after only a few minutes. Then, they stopped connection altogether.
Thankfully I had a warranty, and the replacement process was extremely easy and painless. I was so pleased that I was ready to hop on Amazon and give a 5-star review.
BUT...
The replacement I was sent was clearly used before because the left earbud was packed full of someone else's earwax. If that disgusting occurrence wasn't enough they began having the same problem of playing to only one ear within a day of me owning them.
If you get lucky and get a working pair of these, they're great, and you will have a great experience, but my experience has been miserable, so I cannot recommend.

title: Tremendous for the price!
body:
Bought this because I'm cheap and wasn't about to spend $150 for some name brand headphones. I'm so happy I went with these "cheap" headphones. The look and build quality easily rivals some of the much more expensive stuff on the market. Mid and high sounds are exactly what you would actually want from a pair of earbuds. The bass sounds are a little less than I would like but still not bad by any means.

Someone at Treblab definitely needs a long distance high five for these.

Thanks

title: I need larger ear cavity's =)
body: Sound quality is good, expected a bit better. Between the ear keeper and the bud is a large diameter hump that discomforts my ears for long durations of use. These will be my back up pair as am a fan of other products from this company. Battery life is 8-9 hrs which is nice.

title: One Star
body: Product stopped working after 3 months

title: my J1 have great crisp sound!
body: The audio quality of my J1 headphones are great. Comfortable to wear during workouts  in the gym and no problem using for phone calls. I wish it had a feature that allows me to advance to the next song.

title: Decent sound quality better then most Bluetooth earbuds
body: Decent sound quality better then most Bluetooth earbuds. comfortable as well, reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because these Do not last 9 hours, 6 at best but not 9 and it takes 2 hours to fully charge.

title: Only worked for a week.
body: I purchased this product to replace a previous pair that I lost playing golf. Since I liked the initial quality of the product I said why not. The new pair arrived and stopped working within a week. The headphones will not charge or hold a charge. The quality is not the same, I do not recommend these headsets.

title: Didn't work past 2 months
body: It was great quality sound. I had no problem with the sound, size, or even the build of the headphones. But the right bud stopped working outta no where are 2 months! Like WTF!

title: LOVE!
body: Awesome headphones; even better than my previous version!!

title: Good quality product!
body: I use them to work out. The Noise canceling works great with the foam ear piece. They went the extra mile and give you 6 pairs to make sure they fit everyone. the sound is good and work well with app equalizers to make them sound the way you want. They out the box. Perfect for working out.

title: Five Stars
body: Great fit and good sound.  Music doesn't sound flat like many other earbuds I've bought over the years.

title: Call quality not so great. Light and easy to wear.
body: So far the Treblab headset has been mostly just ok. The sound quality is nice, they are lightweight  and the design is nice. The biggest issue for me is the call quality. In short,it is not so good. Callers speak of a muffled sound compared to the previous headset. Battery is constant at 7 hours. Once battery warning comes you have about one min before they cut off. Also no notification of incoming calls unless you are already on a call. (Call waiting) will update as needed,but may return them.

title: they worked fine for a couple of weeks then the right earbud ...
body:
I originally purchased these in September, they worked fine for a couple of weeks then the right earbud stopped working.  I contacted customer support and they gave me instructions on how to reset them to see if that would fix the problem.  I followed their instructions but it still wasn't working.  I contacted them again and was told that this must be a defective set and if I would cut the cord between the earbuds and send them a photo of the cut cord they would send a replacement.  I cut the cord, took a photo and emailed it to the them.  If I remember correctly I received an email the same day saying the replacement set was on the way.  The replacement set arrived a few days later and I have had no issues, very happy with them.

These is a very nice set of earbuds and they sound amazing, at this price point I'm surprised they sound as well as they do.

Customer service is also great, they responded to my emails quickly and there were zero hassles in replacing the defective set.  I would have no hesitation buying from Treblab in the future.

title: Worth it!
body:
I was one of those poeple that believes in quality so i got sucked into buying $100 headset withiin a year it died.  Better save your money buying expensive brands... yeah, yurbud your products sucks!!!!!

This product is worth your money!!!! amazing sound and battery last longer.

title: Treblab J1
body: Great headphones all in all

title: Not sweat proof
body:
I bought these in August 2018 and as of January 2019 they are dead.

I used them about 5 to 7 days a week for primarily running. I do sweat a lot which is why I looked for earbuds that are sweat proof.  They had great sound and stayed in my ears real good. So it is sad that they are dead.

To explain what started happening, just last week the voice that comes on when you turn the earbuds on started to sound different and would not connect and were blinking red/blue almost together like. I turned them off and on several times then finely the original voice came on and the earbuds connected. They have done this a couple times and after restarting them several times I could usually get them to connect (very aggravating though). Now today when I was running they just beeped and disconnected and started blinking red/blue almost together again. So I turned them off and now they will not start back up. Very upsetting but I guess  they are not sweat proof. I will give them a 3 star for sound and fit but ultimately should be a 1 star since they only lasted less than 6 months.

title: Pretty decent for the price!
body: I like these!  They really block out the noise of all the chatty folks at work when i need to get in the zone.  I'm still toying with the different earbud fittings to find my perfect fit, but I like that my ears don't get sore wearing these the way they used to when I would wear my hard, plastic ear-buds that came with my iphone.  Sound quality is great and paired easily with my phone!  I'd recommend for sure!

title: The headphones were good while they were working
body: The headphones were good while they were working.  Unfortunately after just over a month of regular use they stopped holding a connection and the battery would drain fast.  Tried with multiple devices to make sure it wasn't the device that I was using.  Problem persisted.  Not a reliable product.  Would not recommend for anyone to purchase these.

title: Junk
body: Junk, must be about 1 ft from telephone. Does not work while phone is attached to hit very dissatisfied cannot use while walking.

title: Love mine
body: Great

title: Decent sound and build quality but the earbud itself is too large and they turn themselves on at random
body: Seems to be well designed, and the sound is decent-to-good, but the earbud itself is huge (much bigger than all of my previous bluetooth headphones, I've had 3 other sets).  My biggest complaint though is that they turn themselves on at random when not in use.  Almost every single day at some point I go to turn them on only to find that they are either already on and connected to my phone, or the battery is dead from being on while not in use.  I am not leaving them on myself.  I see them connect to my phone at random when not in use very often (phone gives a notification when bluetooth connects). I have literally never seen any of my other previous 3 pairs of bluetooth earbuds do this, but these do it all the time, probably 5 times a week I see this.

title: Four Stars
body: Too large and uncomfortable.

title: Good fit with quality sound.
body: Good fit with quality sound. Very easy to operate and doesn't get in the way or uncomfortable during use. More bass would have made them 5 stars.

title: Five Stars

title: but overall the product is very good.
body: Connecting is sometimes interesting, but overall the product is very good.

body: Doesn't fit comfortably in ears; keeps falling out.

body: These headphones are great especially for talking with no background noise interfering with your call I mean at all. The charge is good for quite a while the only issue I had was they just stopped charging. Great product still

title: sound is crap. Don’t waste your $$
body: Bass boost my a$$!!! These are junk, sound is crap. Don’t waste your $$

title: Trelab j1 Bluetooth earbuds
body: Work very well

title: Awesome value for the money
body: Used these ear buds during work, and they were great

title: Best earbuds without breaking the bank
body:
I have been searching for a pair of noise cancelling earbuds that will help drain out sound without breaking my bank or having to be cranked up all the way.  I went through a handful of cheaper earbuds that did not meet my expectations.

It's hard to do noise cancelling in the earbud form for the right price. These hit the mark! I work from home and have extremely noisy neighbors above me, non stop noise and loud thuds.  Wearing these earbuds with the foam ear pieces have been a life saver.  I haven't had to crank the volume up to where I'm going deaf and I hear absolutely only what is coming through my earbuds.  The sound quality is great for the price point and the battery life lasts all day for me.  I couldn't be happier and I have my sanity back.  Highly recommend these over a cheaper pair that claim to do the same.

title: Five Stars
body: Product is excellent! Delivery to match, Thank you.

title: Only worked for 3 months :(
body: Fit is bit odd for my ear but I managed to make it work, sometimes falls out, I used Bose before, no problem with fit. Used this for 3 months until it stopped working... At first my iPhone can't find it even though I tried to restart my bluetooth then it stopped charging anymore. So it is like paying small amount and only use it for 3 months... Better invest with better earphone.

title: Poor noise cancellation functionality
body: I went to a local coffee shop, called my father and before I asked him about background noise, he said...."where are you?  Boy, there's lots of background noise"; so, very disappointed in the noise cancelling feature and also, the actual rubber earbuds are made of a very cheap plastic/rubber compound that doesn't allow you to get a good seal in your ears.  They feel like the $5 earbuds you buy at Walgreen's.  Lots of background noise creeping in.  Finally, very tinny sounding if you listen to music.  When they called it "TREB"LAB....they weren't kidding!  Not recommended.

title: Great for the price
body: Very good for the price point. Sound is a little shallow, but loud and the headphones appear to be well designed

title: Zero complaints
body: The foam sleeves make for a tremendous noise reduction on their own — more than any dedicated foam earplugs I’ve used. Sound quality is great for this price and the battery definitely lasts all day and then some. Very pleased for the price.

title: good sound
body: The first pair didn't work, but they were very proactive about replacing them and I appreciate that.

title: Great sound
body: I wasn't familiar with this brand but bought it because it had a noise cancelling microphone for calls. I wasn't expecting much for sound quality but was very surprised to find out that they have a great sound with full lows while playing music. I'm pretty picky and I would highly recommend these for great sound and comfort.

title: Suddenly broken :( but quick to fix
body:
They were working great for a few weeks and then suddenly wouldn't charge or turn on. I tried doing the factory reset, searched for trouble shooting videos online. Nothing has worked. Very disappointed.
Edit: customer support got in contact with me and sent me a new pair quickly and easily. I just had to attach some photos with the original pair destroyed. Pleased with their speed and politeness.

title: Five Stars

body: They were awesome headphones great bass response nice and Loud the only problem I had was that kind of hurt my ears when they were in but maybe I should have use a smaller ear cushion.. was only able to use them for about a week until my dog felt I should have the cordless ones ....unfortunately..smh

title: Great headphones.
body: Very easy to use. Sound great. Waterproof for sure, I just accidentally ran them through my washing machine  and worked perfect 5 minutes later.

title: Five Stars
body: Love these earbuds.  Great sound. Great fit.  Just what I was looking for.  Thanks!

title: Five Stars

I wanted to like these headphones after seeing a nice review on YouTube. Fit and finish is very nice for the price, but as soon as I took them out of the package they had an intermittent audio malfunction on the right side that just got worse until they No longer worked at all. Bluetooth range is also not as good as the ADURO Bluetooth headphones even though these sound better when working properly.
I will be returning them for refund and saving up for something that works.

body: I read a lot of reviews that were great. But I think the one I received was defective. I purchased it several months ago but did not start using till recently. Two weeks after using it, one side stopped working. And the battery time is between two to three hours. Just my luck!!  Well back to the old ones.

title: Great headphones. The noise cancelation is great
body: Great headphones. The noise cancelation is great, I can't hear any outside noise when wearing them. Love that they send memory foam ear buds with extras. The sound is clear and loud.

title: Everything promised
body: The ear buds, worked great.  The listening distance is much longer than the 30 ft. limit.  I use them most foe audiobooks, and the ear buds are clear and easy to listen to. Last night I left the house and went out to get our mail, and the story continued with me all the way.  I would like to have had a little better user guide, but all ends well.

title: It did not fit my ear. I have small ...
body: It did not fit my ear. I have small ear canals, and the small bud was still too large. It needs to go inside your canal for the hook to fit into the ear structure. The sound is plenty loud but the quality is mediocre.

title: Lasted only 2 months!!!.....Company made it right with a new set to me with no $$ out of my pocket!
body:
Worked for two months then just stopped during a run. Disconnected from Bluetooth and would not reconnect. Reset and connected to charger as instructed. Static in ear and nothing else.

Update.  Will have to give it to this company as far as customer service goes,  they are excellent.  I was contracted thru a company rep. and offered another set of ear buds.  They arrived this week.  I have not had the chance to try out yet.  I do appreciate the willingness to "get it right".

title: ok
body: fine for the money

title: All around good pair of headphones
body: All around good pair of headphones. But If your looking for bass, this pair lacks a good bass. I use these to work out and they never get in the way. My only other problem is that when your listening to one earbud the other one dangles and tends to rip the other side out.

title: Good for walkers but not for runners
body:
The quality of this product is questionable at best.  I was pretty hyped about it after reading all of the 5 star reviews, but they most certainly don't apply to the set that I received.  I would say these are for walkers at best, but are not good for running.  The earbuds certainly have a strong connection to my phone, better than some others I've used and the sound quality is very good, though not good as a quality set of wired earbuds.  Being wireless, this is not expected and being able to run without the wire hooked up to my phone is great.  However, that is where the problems begin - running.

The first and foremost issue I have is with the ear hooks.  These are worthless and don't work in my ears at all.  They're way too flimsy.  The silicone ear-tips also don't stay in the ears while running.  They slip out too easily even before my ears start sweating.  Now there are a some foam ear-tips included that do stay in my ears for a good amount of time, even after the sweating begins, however, they are not sweat resistant and they do not allow any moisture to escape my ear canals, causing it to stay trapped in there.  After a week of using them, I got water (sweat) trapped in the ear, giving me an ear infection.  To be honest, none of the provided ear-tips and ear hooks are worth keeping.  Thankfully, I did have a set of wired earbuds with good solid ear hooks and ear-tips that I was able to put on this headset and I've no issues since.

Aside from the included ear-tips and hooks, which again are terrible quality if you're a runner, these stay connected to my phone very well, rarely giving me any issues.  They even connect to my Gear Sport watch very well.  My other set of wireless earbuds are not as good (connectivity-wise) and cost twice as much (Samsung Level U Pro).

I will state that when walking only, all of the ear-tips work fine without issue.  It's only when I'm running and my ears sweat (and they sweat a lot!) are they not very good.  I'd say with better quality ear hooks that aren't so flimsy and flexible, something this more solid and stays in place within the ear would make this product much better (for a runner).  I was going to give these to my wife to use since she only walks, but after using the ear hooks from my wired ear buds, these work fine for now.

After a follow up from TRELAB, they offered a discount on these earbuds since I was not 100% satisfied.  I would've have given this review an extra start for this, had this device not completely failed to work shortly after that.  If I can give separate reviews for customer service and the device in question, I would rate it as below.  But overall, I will leave this a three start review because the device is not reliable, but the customer support is top notch.

Device quality: 2 stars
Customer Support: 5 stars

title: The connection is good, the sound is good
body: These are some really solid wireless headphones. The connection is good, the sound is good, and the noise isolation is phenomenal. I highly recommend them for this price. You won't find another pair of Bluetooth headphones this good for this price.

title: poor reliability
body:
It is like having the cheap pair of headphones they give you on a plane except wireless. They keep disconnecting and connecting if you put it in your pocket. The only way to fix it is to do the annoying thing where you move the wire around to make them work.

Update: customer support was good, helped me get them working a little better.

title: Five Stars
body: Awesome!

title: Overheating from charging. Updated: great support!
body:
Be careful of charging and overheating. I have had days for a little over a year and they have work great for me. Our use them while mountain biking and they have performed well. However after charging them in my truck as I always do this is what I found. See the photos.

 Update: The company reached out to me and the follow up support was great. The instructions do say to charge only with their cable which I was not doing. Based on their support I am changing my star rating. I will use them in the future.

title: Great headphones
body: The battery alone is a reason to purchase these, not a fan of the shape though.

title: Great product and customer service.
body: Bought these for my son to use during workouts and he loves them!!!

title: Satisfied
body:
I have never enjoyed earbuds before but this one is the best! Sound quality is superb and pairing is
a breeze. At work they perform well. I Recommend them.

title: sounds like a 20-30 dollar pair of headphones
body: sound quality is ok, sounds like a 20-30 dollar pair of headphones. there are grooves on the part behind the earbud that did cut the inside of my ear. was not pleased with this at all.

title: The best headphones for price
body: To be honest I never write reviews but this time I thought I would you can not beat the quilt of head phones for the price I love how that when I wear them I don't hear anything else but my tunes

title: GREAT after sales support
body: These earphones broke after a month (probably a defect) but Treblab reached out to me promptly and immediately sent me a replacement. Great customer support and one that I have not experienced from other brands that could care less about the customer's satisfaction after purchase. Before the earphones broke, they were great quality, loved the hooks, greta battery life (I got about 6-7 hours on one charge), fit well in my ear, sound quality was decent but slightly lacking in the low end (not meant for bass junkies), and the range was exceptional for budget sub $40 earphones. Will be looking forward for my replacement and will update this review if necessary.

title: Happy wife, happy life😁
body: I bought my wife the J1's in the past and she loves them. Whenever she goes and visits family she gets a lot of compliments, so much so that I ended up buying another pair for my sister-in-law. I would like to get her the x5, so that I can get her J1's 😁

title: overall a decent purchase
body: Crisp sound and has a good bass level to it. No issues with walking away to the water fountain while the phone is holding my spot at the bench.

title: Not bad but not great
body:
It's beginning to dawn on me that, when it comes to Bluetooth earbuds, you get what you pay for. With one notable exception (SoundPEATS P9A buds not sold anymore), anything under $50.00 (ish) dollars was going to sound terrible.  I've been through around three sets of buds and just got fed up with the 20-30 dollar range buds sounding terrible or just not working all that well.

These buds have a lot going for them. They stay put with the expanding foam tips on. They have magnetic bases so they stick together and don't get tangled up in jewelry or glasses hanging in front of me. They have pretty good bass response and the battery lasts a day or two if you don't use them constantly. Apparently, the microphone for phone conversations works good but I only have anecdotal opinions from friends.

Now for the bad. Or should I say, where they have room for improvement:
1. With the exception of bass, the rest of the frequency response of these buds is kind of missing. When listening to music, they can sound like a speaker with a pillow over it. The mids and highs just aren't there. That said, I'm guessing most people won't discriminate too much when it comes to their listening. Most of the reviews talk about how the bass response is great for workouts. Maybe that's who they're aimed at. I'm a little pickier with my listening.
2. The silicone tips are plain useless. Besides the little silicone stabilizers, there isn't any way to secure the buds in your ear. Eventually, they just fall out. You'll HAVE to use the expandable foam tips so they don't move. The localized sound reduction is apparent and you really need to pay attention if you're walking around town with these things on. Probably not good for jogging but a treadmill would be fine.
3. I really like the controls on the over the ear hook ear piece (soundpeats et. al.) but couldn't find a set with that feature that sounded even remotely decent. The Treblab controls are all placed inline with the cable. You invariably end up fumbling with the cable to get to the control pod and then finding the proper button to either raise/lower the volume or pause or answer a call. It  can be maddening.
4. This only happens infrequently, but I sometimes get disconnects with my buds. They'll work fine but sometimes, they just disconnect in the middle of a phone call or when I'm listening to music. It's very rare but it's the only pair of buds where I've had this happen.

Conclusion: If you want buds that are pretty robust and pump out the bass during a workout, these guys are for you. If you have a discriminating ear and need to hear something beyond 'oontz, oontz, oontz', you probably want to keep on looking. As for me, I'm probably going to keep looking.

Update 9/17/19:
After expressing my dissatisfaction with J1's, Treblab really bent over backwards to try to get me into a set of buds I liked. Their customer service is superlative. Unfortunately, I experienced the same sound quality issues with the XR700's. Great fit and the all my original positives apply here, but just no midrange or treble. That said, the customer service from Treblab can't be understated. It's far better than their product deserves. I hope they someday come out with a pair of buds that sound as good as they are comfortable to wear.

title: Five Stars
body: love these

title: Sounds good, looks good, highly recommended!
body:
This is a very good quality pair of earphones for a much lower price than all the other name brands! I really don't like the extra ear hooks, but the great thing about these earphones is that you can remove them completely, if you prefer. Also, you get a variety of ear tips, both rubber and foam ones, which is really useful, and a carrying case that fits everything.

The design of the earphones is excellent, without blocky unsightly extra parts on the cord or the earbuds, but I was surprised how much heavier the actual buds were compared to my other earphones. I am a little bit annoyed by the blue light flashing when the earphones are on. This is especially noticeable in a low light environment. However, the female voice that does the status announcement like "Power on" is quite pleasant and not annoying.

The battery lasts a long time, and they sound great. Overall a great product, and I highly recommend it!

title: Great headphones but...
body:
Great noise cancelling, and they seem pretty sturdy and deliver quality sound--  My only qualms are that even the small size of the offered covers is a bit big, making them a bit uncomfortable. The saving grace is that it's memory foam so it can be squished and expand. The other small thing is that the amount of battery left that it reports on my phone is inaccurate, so it dies a bit unexpectedly. Luckily this is saved once again by the fact that they include a space in the carry case for the charger and it charges super quickly.

UPDATE: after having these a year I have found that wearing them for an extended time hits the antehelix because of the limited sizing. It is VERY painful and the customer service sucks. I contacted them with no satisfaction, for something with a lifetime warranty I expected something besides an offer of 15% off. The customer service just rattled off the same thing to me each time and offered no solution.

TLDR Sound is good but the fit HURTS after extended wear.

body:

The charge port is cheap, plugging in and getting reliable connection is difficult.
I’d keep looking rather then buy these. I really wish I could find some decent wireless ear buds for a decent price.

THESE ARE A STEAL.

Very dissatisfied bc they were always kept in the pouch that they came in and treated them with care so no reason for them to stop working the way they did.

title: Great set of bluetooth headphone.
body: I bought this headset  for my wife and she loves it. She can use it when she is working out.

title: Attractive, well made ear buds.
body: These are well made and attractive earbuds and sound great, and the magnetic ends are a nice touch.  Unfortunately I have small ear canals and while I tried different combinations of the supplied bud covers I couldn't  find a comfortable fit.

title: Great for listening but DO NOT use the volume buttons on the earbud cord!
body: These earbuds have great sound quality and a great battery life. My only complaint is regarding the volume control on the earbuds: The handy volume control buttons would be amazingly convenient for when your phone is packed away in a pocket or bag and you are on-the-go exercising or working, however, I can't use the volume control buttons due to the EXTREMELY LOUD confirmation beep that it makes in your ears when you tap to increase or decrease the volume while the earbuds are in use. When my music is playing at a normal listening level, if I tap the up or down volume button one time the earbuds produce a beep SO LOUD that I jump out of my skin and impulsively yank the earbuds out of my ears and have to recover from the shock of the insanely loud sound that just projected into both eardrums. This has to be a product defect. It makes the volume control totally impossible to use and traumatizing to troubleshoot.

title: Considering the price though they’re not bad. If you want a cheap set of bluetooth ...
body: Audio quality leaves some to be desired. Low bit rate and bassy with flat mids and highs. They took a bit to get in a confortable position. Considering the price though they’re not bad. If you want a cheap set of bluetooth headphones that will get you by they seem to work. If you’re buying them for audio quality save up for something nicer.

title: The sound quality is my only complaint.

title: Great Sound, if you are spending $40 these are it
body: Looking for a good set of BT headphones without breaking the bank.  I bought these and a set of JB Tarahs.  These sound just as good as the Tarah does out of the box without changing the JB sound on the app.  Bass was great and I am not one to love a lot of bass.  I am a foam ear tip guy but found the best fit and comfort with the silicone tips.  The sound is great, especially for the price.  I tried the Treblab Z2 over the ear which sounded wonderful too so I figured these would sound great.  Lots of tips and wings plus a case for $40.  They did rub my left ear in a funny spot so I TRIED to send them back but a co-worker listened to them for a minute and loved them, so he bought them.  Thinking about trying the N8 or Treblab pencil style because the sound has been consistently great but not sure yet.

title: These earbuds started off as a fantastic option. I was frustrated by wireless earbuds that ...
body: These earbuds started off as a fantastic option. I was frustrated by wireless earbuds that are not sweat proof or are poor quality in sound. For the first 6 weeks these earbuds were great; long lasting charge, quality sound, and continued to work through runs and workouts. HOWEVER, these are not recommended for work outs and have stopped working altogether. If you are looking for a quick fix (6 weeks or less) these are a great option...however if you want something that lasts longer..look elsewhere

title: Great headphones for the money
body:
To preface, I would rate an item 5 stars only if it were essentially flawless.  The J1s aren’t flawless, but they’re almost definitely the best you’re going to get at this price point.

When listening to music, the sound quality is fairly good out-of-the-box, and very solid if you know how to tweak the equalizer in your music app or media player of choice.  Once you’ve done that, highs are clear and not tinny, lows are relatively free of muddiness, and mids are more than passable.  Fidelity and soundstage are always going to suffer a bit on these earbuds compared to good ol’ cans or tower speakers, but props to Treblab for managing to put up very respectable marks in both of those categories.  For the frequent-flyers and long-commuters, these guys handle podcasts, movies, TV, and audiobooks without any problem.

Hardware is another positive story overall.  On the plus side, the J1s feel premium, with metal accents and an understated design.  The enclosure for the inline mic and toggle buttons is compact and unobtrusive, and the flat cable is tough to tangle.  The mic is clear enough on phone calls, and bluetooth connectivity is stable.  Battery life is flat-out awesome.  The only problem I encountered was that the included ear fins were a bit too short and flimsy to hold these guys, and I ended up using a set of rubber fins from an old, broken pair of sport buds I had lying around.  That didn’t end being a huge deal for me and, it was made up for by the inclusion of foam tips in addition to the silicone variant.  Anyone transitioning from on-ear headphones will likely find this to be more comfortable, and in my experience the foam creates a better seal and benefits sound quality.

TLDR — Awesome value, awesome sound quality for the price-point, awesome battery life, solid build quality.  Those with large or abnormally-shaped ears may experience issues with fit.

title: Great Bluetooth earbuds.
body:
I love these earbuds. They sound great and their fit is perfect. Usually after hours of using other earbuds, my ears hurt from the fin that secure them. With these I never have sore ears.

My only complaint is the distance for use. It says 30 ft. My set doesn't reach that far. When I have them in my back pocket and bend over to pick something up, it starts to cut out. The connection through walls isn't as good as other earbuds. This cuts out more than my other ones.

The earbuds overall make it my daily use pair. I use them every day at work. I would suggest these to anyone who wants a great sounding and comfortable set of earbuds.
