Only thing I wonder about is that when I bought it, price was  $30 and after a week it came down to $20.
There is no option to contact or talk to the seller or their team.
Also if this could fix on the ear, this would be best for sports.

It doesn't always happen but it can be a bit bothersome to some people.

title: I really like these headphones
body: I really like these headphones.  The sound quality is excellent.  It could use a bit more bass perhaps, but too much bass isn't a good thing either.  So I suppose it's the right balance.  I purchased the headphones for working out, and they, well, work out just fine.  Those of you reading this, if you're like me, you want to know if they stay in your eyes snugly.  The answer is yes, for the most part.  Every now and then, yes, a bud will slip out, but  for the most part, they stay put.  I'm glad I bought them.  They work great.  They have good customer service, too, as I've heard from them via email before I received the product and after.  That's a smart business model and I appreciate their diligence and care for their customers.

title: LOW BUILD QUALITY!  DON'T EXPECT THEM TO LAST!
body: I loved these earbuds, until their cheap build quality became evident a few months into their use.  The cord connecting to the controller became loose and I hear a short as it wiggles around.  ( have to keep pushing it back in to make them work.  This is unfortunate, as I did nothing to mis-use or abuse these earbuds.  On the contrary, I've babied and been extra careful to protect them.

Update. The company responded and sent a new pair but once again these ones were terrible. Completely different issue though. Now when I try to turn it on it will start to pair and then turn off after 5 seconds.  Even after being left to charge.

title: I also love the magnetic clasp

It is important to make sure you chose the right buds for your ears before doing any activity. It does not take long to figure it out and Treblab provides a variety of choices in the package. I also love the magnetic clasp. My only set back is the sound quality. Its not bad but a little too much treble. If it was not for that I would have given a 5 star.

title: I like the sound quality of these earbuds and the connectivity ...
body:
I like the sound quality of these earbuds and the connectivity is steady and works well.  My only quibble is that they tend to fall out when I'm running.  I have rather small ears and even though I have replaced the rubber pieces for smaller ones that are included in the package, they still manage to fall out of my ears which tends to make me break my focus and throws my pace off.  They are useful overall though and particularly when taking long walks.

UPDATE:  I've had these for less than a month and they are no longer working.  They no longer connect to my phone and frankly are now useless.  They are still in excellent condition and weren't damaged or dropped but they are just not working any more.  Not worth the money in the end.

UPDATE:  After receiving a replacement pair from the company, I decided to give these one more try and though skeptical at first I am very pleased with them.  They have remained connected to my phone and while they do still fall out of my ears occasionally when running, it does not happen as much as before.  I am pleased and grateful to the company for such incredible customer service.

title: Great ear buds
body: I had a pair of Trelab XR500's that I really liked the sound quality of for my eclectic mix of music preference. Most of the use was while riding bike for hours but with sun glasses the pieces that hold the outside of the ear gets annoying. One day they walked away and never came back. Having liked the quality and price I went back to Trelab for a replacement pair but this time with the style that has the retainer inside the ear. They feel good good for hours and sound great. Maybe not quite as deep as the XR500 but pretty damn close and stay out of the way and in my ear. If these walk away I will by again.

If your looking for a set of wireless earbuds you can do nothing but WIN with the TREBLAB J1

title: Good

title: BROKE Quickly. Easy to keep around the nick. Easy to connect. Good sound. Good isolation.
body:
I've been using mine heavily for the past year... It doesn't work now. First, audio stopped coming out of the left ear, then it started draining the battery quickly to the point of it being unusable (battery discharges in about 30 minutes).
However, I'm buying a second one because for this price audio quality was very good, noise isolation is great, battery life was really good (used to last over 6 or 7 hours on one charge). It's very portable and easy to connect and start listening right away, never had any issues until it eventually broke (I was a very heavy user), the wire is short and the earbuds themselves are not that bulky compared to other wireless earbuds... I loved the aptx low latency feature, great for watching videos with no delays... I can keep talking forever about how good these were... Unfortunately they broke quickly!
In short, I'm making my second purchase right now...

title: Extremely Great Sound for the Price
body: These guys are the perfect wireless earbuds for me. I've used them extensively and there is no problems. Ear tips have a perfect fit and sound quality is on par with other high end earbuds.

title: Get on it.
body: I have been an Amazon for years. This is my first review. I have owned 3 JBL speakers and my speakers are used daily. This under $35 speaker gives me better sound than any of them. I LOVE it. From the sound to being able to control all functions from the device itself without needing to grab your phone to the length of battery life. It’s great for the pool. No worries about getting wet or leaving it outside overnight. This things is a trooper. A very loud, awesome sounding trooper. Don’t hesitate.

title: Great earphones - my wife loves them
body: My wife has been using them for 2 weeks now; she loves it

title: Amazing Wireless Earbud Value
body: Best wireless earbuds I've owned and at a price that you can't beat. Great sound with excellent passive noise canceling for the price. I bought a set for my wife and bought two more sets just in case.

title: Has great high and mids but little bass
body:
Has great high and mids but little bass.Great for working out, battery life last around 7-8 hours.
After 8 months the right side of the earphones suddenly stop working.

title: I am pretty disappointed.
body:
It’s only been a couple months and one of the earbuds no longer work. I am pretty disappointed.
UPDATE: the support was good and they were able to provide me with another set that is working well.

title: Best bang for your buck hands down
body: Experiment with the provided earned tips and ear hooks to get the right fit, feel and sound quality. It matters.

title: Awesome earbuds
body: Very nice earbuds well built connect very easy sound is excellent range is great batt life is great only downside is the ear wings suck they are straight vs a curved in ward I also like the pointed ones vs rounded thankfully the ones from other earbuds fit if it was not for the ear wings I would have given 5stars

title: Favorite Bluetooth earbuds
body: earbuds arrived on time and as advertised.  I have had several Bluetooth earbuds and these are my favorite so far.

title: Expect to last anywhere from 3-7months depending on use
body: 5-6 months that is all the last, right bud has a loose wire

title: Perfect
body: Great headphones!

title: I use this product everyday at home and at work
body:
I work a 10-hour shift and I wear these at work everyday. I have tried a handful of both wired and wireless earbuds and these are by far the best all-around pair I have tried.

Battery lasts as advertised. I can get almost 9 hours out of a 2 hour charge. They last my 10 hour shift because I charge them while I am on break.

About a 30-40 foot range. I can leave my MP3 player at my workstation and walk freely around at work.

Quality construction. I use them hard both at work and at home and they look brand new. You have to play with the different size buds to get the one that fits but once you do the wing helps them stay in your ear even through the most rigorous exercise.

Sound quality. Here is where they lose a star. The quality of sound could be a little better. But downloading an equalizer app helped. They are also advertised as being noise cancelling. They are but I feel they could be better.

In an effort to find something wrong with these earbuds I think I am being a little picky with the sound quality. These are an all-around good quality product and I would recommend them to anybody.

title: Great headphones!
body:
Have had this headphones for 4+ months and I have absolutely no complains.
I used them for working out and they stay in place, sound quality and the noise cancellation feature is amazing.

title: Great Value in Exercise-oriented BT Headphones!
body:
I had an initial problem, but the product was replaced and works very well for me. I am impressed with how they stood behind their product!

The sound and feature-set are incredible for the price. The build quality is sufficient. BT performance even more so. I would absolutely recommend these to anyone looking to save some money of the Jaybird or similar high-end brands. (I own both. While the Freedom's are indeed better in essentially every aspect, they aren't 120 bucks better!)

title: so far these have been the best. Sound quality is unremarkable (neither here nor there)
body: I bicycle commute every day to work and have used quite a few different bluetooth buds over the years. From $30-120 buds, so far these have been the best. Sound quality is unremarkable (neither here nor there), but the design and build quality are decent. With other buds I've experienced troubles with bluetooth connections, battery life, and the rubber ear retaining "tabs" coming off and losing them. I've never had difficulties connecting these, battery is still going strong, and have never had one of the retaining tabs pop off. After 6 months of daily use twice a day they've finally developed a short in one of the buds, but that's after being pushed and pulled beneath helmet straps and neck gaiters every day. Apparently they have a lifetime warranty as well, but I'm just going to buy another pair as I think I've gotten my money's worth.

title: Paired up fine and worked well
body: Paired up fine and worked well.  Sound quality was not great at all.  Had to send back, could not sacrifice sound quality despite price.

title: Great bluetooth earbuds
body: Excellent product, can easily get 8 hrs of continuous use out of these, just remember....don't over charge them!

title: There are headphones Cheaper and better
body: It’s not comfortable for ears. Battery life is short. And the mic is the worst.And worset of all thae right one doesn’t work completely!

title: TrebLab makes great Bluetooth products.
body: I have two other TrebLab bluetooth head sets one that I kept at the gym and one for home.  I ordered these because they fit in ear more and I can use them underneath hearing protection ear muffs.  They work and sound great!

title: Not worth the cost
body: I've had these earbuds for a few months and it stopped syncing with my phone. It was nice while it worked.

title: One ear stopped working but customer service rocks!
body:
UPDATE
Customer service is excellent.
The company heard my issues and covered the defective product under warranty.
Received replacement pair of headphones even though old pair was discarded. Trustworthy.

Well, I really liked these headphones but after about 14mo of use the left ear started cutting in and out, often just flat out does not work much of time.  No recourse here so bummed.  Going to buy something else I guess.

title: Great bang for the buck....Good sound isolation and HD.
body:
Update after a month of use:
These are are a great deal.  Very good sound, noise reduction works, I have had no reliability problems. My go to earbud now.

Sound quality is surprisingly good for the price. It is slightly muddy in the mid range but has a full sound spectrum. Also has a decent sound stage for an ear bud. Noise isolation with the foam tips is very good. The active noise canceling advertised appears to be limited to the mic, as per the Qualcomm chipset specsheet. Have not called anyone while riding my motorcycle yet. Battery life tested so far is six hours without dieing.
Sound quality is comparable to my Sony XB950N1 cans, but I don't use them for mowing (is not a riding mower, is hot and dusty). Sound definition is not as good as  my benchmark Samsung Level Pros.
I bought the J1s for listening while mowing or woodworking where I need good noise isolation in a sweaty or dusty activity. Very good for that purpose.....wore them mowing today.

title: Microphone doesn't work, Now they don't work at all.
body:
I have had multiple issues with these headphones.  I would not recommend.
The Microphone doesn't work and now the headphones can't connect with my phone.  these are completely useless and have been problematic from the beginning.  Now I am outside of my return window and not able to get an exchange or refund.

title: Amazing Quality & Sound
body: I have always used wired headphones so for my first wireless and bluetooth set i was skeptical as one should be but wow was i shocked, the quality of these earbuds along with the excellent battery life, sound and the magnetic ends i am very pleased.

title: Echo
body: Not good sound

title: Highly recommend
body: I use these for running.  I've tried several wireless bluetooth earbuds and each one has some element that drives me nuts.  I've been using these for a couple weeks now and I love them--I haven't found anything about them that I can even mildly complain about.  They fit very well, have great sound, and connect to my iPhone immediately.

title: They fall out all the time otherwise really great product. Sound quality is amazing
body: The only reason Im giving these a 4 is because the earbud is too big for my ear. They fall out all the time otherwise really great product. Sound quality is amazing.

title: Great sound!!!
body:
Update: 02/19/2019
Got a replacement and this one is great!!!,  thanks for your follow up

Im getting from the left side a really  annoying weird tone,its like a pairing sound whistle like punching my ear,  they are frequent when using it for  phone calls at the point that I have to take that side out or even just put the call on speaker. While playing songs,  that weird  sound overpower the original melody and instead of listening to your music,  you just start counting how many times it does it.

I purchased it while I was in USA, now I'm outside and will travel back after the return time frame expires and will cost more to ship it back international right now.

I'm very disappointed or I just got a bad one.

title: Big
body: They sound great but are too big.  They didn't want to stay in my ears.

title: Good sound. 6 hour listening time. Great value.
body:
***Update: After 8 months, the left ear buds no longer work. Very disappointed since I only use these twice a week for a workout.. ***

Easily one of the more affordable and great value bluetooth wireless earbuds out there. The battery lasts 6 hours on average, so I'm not sure where they get the 9 hours from, maybe on very low volume it lasts that long. Trust me, it's 6 hours for normal use.

The bass is definitely lacking, there is no noise cancellation, but the sound is crystal clear, and if you use the memory foam, then you can barely here outside noise when music is on. (so maybe noise dampening)

Overall, I like the feel of the buds, the sound is decent, and the price is amazing. I got it for $19 and free shipping because of Prime membership. It was during a special pricing promo i think.

I wouldn't say there isn't a latency or delay, for most netflix and youtube, etc there isn't a noticeable delay at all. None. but with some apps, like the xfinity app, it does have latency. I'm not sure if the issue is the app or the headphones, but I tried watching Xfinity streaming app on my wired headphones, and there wasn't any latency issue. But for general video watching, so far NO Delay.

title: Five Stars
body: Great for ailing or the gym.

title: Five Stars
body: Excelent product!!!!

title: literally no bass
body: worst earbuds i have ever used in my life. Do not purchase

title: Would like to return
body: I received these headphones on April 3, 2019 and have used them for four workouts.  Today they completely died.  I thought maybe they needed to be recharged but when I plugged in the charging cord nothing happens, the indicator light does not come on.  Please let me know how I can return them.

title: Great sound quality is in the Bag!
body: I have used them to listen to movies on youtube and the sound quality was great. They were easy to set up and use. The little pouch keeps them safe when they are not in use.

title: I highly recommend the J1 earbuds
body: Only used for one day, but for the price, product quality, features and sound exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend the J1 earbuds. They will not disappoint..

title: The sound is really good but they constantly disconnect with my phone
body: The sound is really good but they constantly disconnect with my phone..!! Would not recommend these head phones...

title: Best running headphones I've tried
body:
EDIT: After several weeks the right side intermittently cuts out.  Sometimes when I press on it to push it into my ear the whole thing turns off.  Probably a loose connection internally.

ORIGINAL REVIEW: So I've been through 4 from Amazon and 2 from Walmart and these are the best ones I've found for running.  They're the only ones that fit inside the ear and stay there.  I like the fact that these came with foam tips as well as the standard tips to give you more sweat resistance and noise isolation.  I would have given them 5 stars because they fit all my needs and are really great, but I chose these over a similar product because of the "noise cancelling" in the description.  As far as I can tell, that's just false advertising.  They do block out noise, so I think they are great at "noise isolation" but do not seem to support the active noise cancellation.  The deception is not worth me returning them since that was just an added bonus I was looking forward to, but it did leave me feeling a bit more skeptical of the company.  Also, watch out because the cord material is a bit cheap feeling and crimps easily, but that was expected from the price point.

title: Five Stars
body: Great. Sound bass comfort unbelievable

title: Outlived a pair of BOSE wireless.
body: What I liked most is that they outlived my brothers wireless BOSE headphones. I bought these around the same week my brother bought his to be able to listen to music while at the gym. After 6 months of daily use I found out that Treblad competes against the bose in price, functionality, and durability. My brothers “premium” $200 headphones fell apart after 4 months of everyday use and just after a 6 month period completely died. My J1’s still sound like the first day I turned them on and are still in one peice. I work in construction and habitually go to the gym so these headphones have definitly experienced drops, dirt, water, and sweat. If you are hesitant because of the too good to be true price DONT BE. I even wish I bought them sooner. Treblab definitly will be my next pair of bluetooths whenever my current ones die.

title: Music sound and calls quality are great. Love it
body: I like everything about this Earbuds, sound quality, battery life,and they feel really comfortable on my ear. The price is worth it.

title: Great product! Good quality sound
body: Great product! Good quality sound. Use it while I’m working out. Good fit and yes, it’s sweat-proof. Bass could be a tad better. Overall extremely happy with the product. Great product with affordable price.

title: Very good sound quality
body: I listen to audiobooks from library on my iPhone as I walk 80 mins/day. 2nd set of Motorola S10's died and decided to switch. Bought J-1 from Treblab and wore them during walks. One day my downloaded audiobooks ran out (sometimes I walk where there is no cell signal and so I download), since I was in our backyard with cell coverage, I switched to iHeart radio to listen to my favorite Smooth Jazz channel. Wow! was I ever shocked at the sound quality! Surely did not expect it on such tiny earphones, and am very pleased.

title: as advertised
body: Fit is not as I hope but other than that no problems

title: I now have two pairs of the J1. I ...
body: I now have two pairs of the J1. I keep one in my car and I use the other at night to listen to audio books. They last all night.

title: Opened Used Product
body: Super Pissed,, Sent me an opened and used product! ear wax and all. WTF can't even tell you if they work or not I'm not putting these in my ears.

title: Very good sound quality
body: Very clear sound nice and crisp, battery life also very good. Use them at the gym they stay put, great quality.

title: Great sound
body: Excellent set of earphones, highly recommend for sound quality and noise canceling.

title: You wont be dissapointed.
body: Great ear buds for any price. I use them 11+ hours each day for the past three months and the sound quality and noise cancellation is great. I can't see spending more money when these are as good as I've seen.

body: These work exactly as promised.  Haven't tested how far away the phone can be when wearing them but sound is good.

title: Doesn't work more than 2 months
body:
My first earphone worked well for couple of months but right speaker died first and left one after a week. I rated the product one star in my previous post.
Later a gentelman from Treblab contacted me and offered me a replacement for my nonworking Treblab earphone. They sent me a new one last month, I am trying not to use it as much as I was using the previous one and it is working well so far. Therefore I am changing the rating to 4 star specially for the nice customer relation of the compay.

title: sound is good

title: Heavy & uncomfortable
body: These seemed okay - but I have pretty small ears and they wouldn't stay put, these are really bulky heavy earbuds - they stick out pretty far too. I can't believe not more people have mentioned this in their reviews. The sound was better than the ear buds I have - but I can't handle the uncomfortable, irritating way they won't stay in place. :(  I'm returning them.

title: Four Stars
body: So far so good

title: Very good wireless earbuds
body: Great product.  Easy to use,  keeps charged for many hours,  very good sound.

title: Happy purchaser
body: I bought 2 pairs from other brands and one of them needed to be returned. I rarely return things I buy from Amazon since I use my own criteria of add 5 and 4 rating %. If sum is close to 90, I buy. It seems this approach doesn't work once in a while. The pair I returned was average 4.5. Awful sound hurt my ears and soon I returned. I read reviews for J1 only by 7 people a couple of weeks ago. All were convincing. I took a chance and I see 30 plus people have rated 5 stars as of today. In addition to excellent sound and price, there was one pleasant surprise. Not sound related but as a practical matter, you will enjoy the magnetized earpieces. Two becomes one when you store.  My rating is 5.5.

title: Five Stars
body: Great set of earbuds for the money!!! Would buy again...

title: sound quality and ease of pairing are very good. need a little bit of work on keeping ...
body: sound quality and ease of pairing are very good.  need a little bit of work on keeping them in my ears because they have a tendency to migrate out of my ears while working out.

title: Absolutely loved. Was my first ever Bluetooth headphones
body: Absolutely loved. Was my first ever Bluetooth headphones. The bass was a little low and at high volumes it would Crack but other than that it was awesome.

title: Great earbuds!
body: These are the best ever! Great sound quality, reasonably priced, lightweight, long life battery, and design that makes them unobtrusive.

title: I really like these, so far!
body:
So far, I really like these.  Some have complained about sound quality, but they sound pretty good to me - especially for the price.  I'm using Comply foam tips with these and took off the little ear clip thingy.  They stay in my ears and are comfortable to wear.  I also haven't had any complaints about the mic quality during phone calls.

Time will tell, but so far I like the J1!

title: Quality
body: Perfect sound

title: Easily the best headphones ive ever owned
body: Easily the best headphones ive ever owned. Ive gone through a lot of headphones and a few bluetooth ones....these are by far the best. Great bass and dynamic sound qualities and the extras they give to customize the fit are really nice

title: battery is nice. I have been using the foam tips since ...
body: I have used these for a week now, battery is nice. I have been using the foam tips since I work out in a rather loud gym. I have been very pleased with them they have great sound and the blu tooth is very strong.

title: And that's the only good thing about them
body:
Music sound quality quite okish. And that's the only good thing about them.
Earbuds are quite hard and do not fit well. Additional holder is just to soft to keep it in your ear.
Very bad quality of calls.
Placement of battery unit is just bad, very disturbing while running.

title: Tinny sound, no bass and uncomfortable fit - avoid!
body: Nice price point, however I really did not like these headphones. Found them uncomfortable, could not get them to stay in when running, when they were in my ears they felt heavy and stuck out a long way. Sound was tinny with weak bass. Volume control buttons had an incredibly loud beep every time I adjust them and the skip track functionality did not work very well. Sent them back and replaced with Beats X wireless headphones which I am liking a lot more.

title: Can handle a tuff workout!
body: With tese are head phones you don't have to worry about failure

title: Outstanding value. Great sound, Long Battery Life at a very good price.
body: Love at first sight. Why? Because of the value-for-money overall, it's the best I've ever owned. Let's try to agree for moment that for $29.00, it's a bit ambitious to expect Bang & Olufsen sound quality. Or even Bose. But here is where the Treblab J1's deliver: robust bass, satisfying mid range and highs. Plus, very good phone quality for both the user and the caller. The fit, as most of ear-buds, relies on the type of ear-tip. Treblab J1's offer a ridiculously generous array of tips in foam and rubber and the sound isolation is superb. They just fit very well for me and I really have to remove them to hear someone speak. Are these the best ear-buds I've ever owned? Absolutely not but because wired earphones and a built-in DAC to your device is always going to sound better. But, the sound quality is extremly good and then, on top of everything else, you get almost nine (9) hours of standby and 5+ hours of music or talk time. Finally, as with most earbuds, the sound breaks in after a little while. It gets richer and warmer. Outstanding value for your money and they are built to last.

title: Five Stars
body: Great sound!!

title: Great sound, good battery life
body:
This is not my first pair of bluetooth ear buds but they are my favorite. In fact, I bought a second pair because I don't want to be without them.
I use these when I run my quilting machine, both to stay entertained with music and also to protect my hearing since the  machine is louder than I'd like it to be.
I'm not sure what the battery life is but I'd say it's at least 6-8 hrs. If I run out, I grab the second pair.
The quality of sound is much better than with the anker brand I bought for a similar price. I like nice bass and I appreciate hearing the individual instruments in the music I listen to. I am very pleased with these.

title: Good but not for me
body: These are good earphones and I bought them to do jump rope in because I thought they would stay in my ear but the little control button thing kept moving around and bouncing all crazy. I think I’m returning them but they are overall good earphones.

title: Four Stars
body: everything I expected at a good price

title: Lasted 1 year before broken for unknown reason
body: I LOVED these headphones!  They worked awesome, held a decent charge... one day they worked then the next one side totally out.  I keep them in their case so didn't drop them and can't figure out what happened, but sad they only lasted a year.

title: Best Earbuds *under* $50..
body: Overall good earbuds. They have good levels of bass (which was very important to me), but somewhat fall short with their midrange and seem to be a little tinny with the trebles. However, for wireless earbuds under $50, these are probably the best you can buy.

title: Great for the price
body: I'm on my fourth set of these (first one got washed, second and third were destroyed by the dog). But I really do like this product. Batteries don't seem to last very long, maybe 3 hours total before needing to charge. But sound quality is decent, they never fall out of my ear.

title: Hardware failure after 2 months of use.
body: They were good for the first 2 months that I had them, then all of the sudden the sound got very quiet (even on the highest setting).  These are useless now.  Watch out!

title: Consistently crappy
body: After a month or so, the right bud stopped working. A replacement set was sent and also failed in the same way around the same time. Disappointing.

title: Five Stars
body: Excelent

title: The sound is amazing
body: These are the best wireless earbuds I have used. The sound is amazing. The fit in the ears is awesome. I can wear them during my workouts and they stay in my ears. With the extra ear gels I found the right fit. I find myself charging them usually after 20+ hours of use. About once a week for me.

title: Five Stars
body: Very happy with the connection and sound for the price.

title: Doesn't last
body: These have been used only for 3 months and suddenly stopped working. Not sure if it's the battery, but no matter what they should last longer then this. Very disappointed.

title: Quality budget wireless earphones
body: Good quality but packaging could have been better. Sound quality is good for the price and passive noise cancelling works well. Battery life is good and charges fast but I noticed that the battery level shown on my iPhone X does only shows 70-90% every time. When battery is low, battery level displayed on my phone is stuck at 70%. Works with Siri btw so props to you guys.

title: Love it!
body: The sound on this headset are really amazing, so far they are doing at good job, I may buy another set 5 stars so far !

title: Two Stars
body: Great product.. I love it

title: Returned

title: Awesome headphones
body: These are great headphones, they come with tons of replacement rubber buds in different sizes to get the perfect shape for your ear. The noise cancellation works great, and they super easy to connect with Bluetooth. Definitely worth the price

title: AWESOME PRODUCT
body: I purchased these just for work because of the stated battery life of 8 hours of playtime. I have been EXTREMELY IMPRESSED that these earbuds cancel out as much noise as they do. I work in a very loud factory and it’s very hot in the summer. These J1 earbuds have handled the sweat and noise EXTREMELY WELL!!! I have used these for 12 hours before recharging. I have only had these for a couple weeks so I am hopeful they will last. All in all I give these J1 earbuds a 11 out of 10 rating. AWESOME PRODUCT!!!!

title: Headphones quit working 5 weeks after ordering! Unable to return/exchange due to 4 week return window being closed.

Super bummed - got these headphones after doing tons of research and they seemed like a good buy. Went to change the earbuds out to another set provided and a wire pulled out, after being super gentle and careful swapping them. Now they don’t work at all. Really disappointed in this purchase - won’t be buying from this seller again.

title: Used them 4-9 hours everday for 16 months.... great buy!
body: Great quality. I order mine in April 2018 and the just broke today (16months later).... started with the right ear going silent yesterday and today it just keeps shutting off even when fully charged. Still a great buy at $40...... I used them at work 5 days a week,  anywhere between 4-9 hours a day. So all together I think they did a great job... gonna upgrade to another model! Definitely a great buy!!!!

title: Great Sound Profile. One of the best beyond it's category.
body:
It is hard to find the right sport headphone for me because I always look for the best possible audio quality and sound profile. I always prefer warm sound with deep bass, clear mid and high, with decent sound stage for the very least. While most bluetooth sport headphone tend to aim towards high bass and crystal high (V shape sound profile), Treblab J1 is not like that at all.

Nice amount of bass with clear mid and high. No overpowering. No ear fatigue. Love them.

title: If you are in the market for a good sound and affordable earphones than Treblab is the one.
body: Product are great. Price are very affordable.

title: Worked fine for a few months
body: Ear buds worked fine at first. Noise quality wasn't the best but decent. Battery life was good. Couple months later and battery life is only 4 hours. Would not buy again. Nightmare to get a warranty replacement pair.

title: Didn't even notice the scary shadow at work with such great headphone

The only thing I didn't really like was the auto voice telling me its turning on and off.

title: I love that it is light (only a cable behind your ...
body: I need a headset for the work I do and this is really a quality product. I love that it is light (only a cable behind your neck) and the sound is much better than the LG I had before. The buds stay in your ear very well and they give you two types of protectors to try. The harder ones hurt my ears but the foam buds are excellent. Call audio is great and I have had no complaints. The battery life is good but it barely lasts all day for me since I use them a straight 8-9 hours. These are the best I have used thus far.

title: only one works
body: bought them back in march 2018 and a month later only the left earbud will work tired contacting treblab and didnt work disaponinted in the product.

title: They're good, just not great
body: For the price I found these to work well for everyday usage. At first I did have some issues finding a proper fit despite the various fins and tips since this model lacks an extended or angled bore however once you've found what works they do seem to stay in just fine with a good seal. Something I noticed was that while it does have passive noise cancelling I was not able to notice any active kind even after reading over the included paperwork. Aside from that though the sound and battery life was good at over 6-8 hours of usage. I would definitely purchase from them again but I'd like to see if they could slim down the overall profile since they do stick out a bit and possibly even out the weight by adding a 2nd battery from the left earphone.

title: Voice Synced with TV Program Character's Lip Movement
body: I watch television programs using these earphones. They are comfortable to wear, blocks out external noise and when the TV characters are speaking, their lips and the voice match.

title: Amazing sound
body: Great earbuds, great sound, superb

title: Great for mowing!
body: I mow for a municipality in the summer and these became my goto headphones. Great sound quality and noise cancelling. It came with some foam plugs that were super comfortable but fell apart fairly quick. But the others that came with are holding up great though. After sitting over the winter the battery is only lasting about 2 hours now where before was 8+ but I got more than my money's worth out of them. Atleast 1000 hours used.

title: Excellent earbuds! Fantastic sound. Wireless is Awesome, i'm never going back!
body:
Understand i've had them for less than a week but so far...the sound is fantastic, fit and function also fantastic, battery life is also good for an entire day of listening (8+ hours at low to mid level volume).
Bass seems to be what most want and the form factor limits what this style can produce, in my opinion the bass output is phenomenal for the size limitations inherent in earbud type headphones...more than i ever expected from them. I don't listen to bass heavy music but i never expected any earbuds to sound this great. 20% music, 80% audiobook listening, 100% phone calls, is what i use them for and i couldn't wish for any better sound quality.
Bluetooth...it works well, we're going to get different reception quality depending on many factors including location, building, and interference from other wireless signal density in the area...at home i get about 25 feet before problems occur, at work i get about 35 feet so your results may vary...like all bluetooth devices.
Style/ build quality...i chose the white and am happy i did, i have tons of black cables and headphones and these stand out among them as well as looking good...black is overdone and overrated. Build quality is good for the set i have 'so far'...it's impossible to predict long term but they seem sturdy despite some pictures of them broken, they are super light and i tend to handle them carefully, so far so good (which may change in the future as i put more mileage on them).
Fit....with all the options they include if they don't fit you then you are not human. Mine fit perfectly as shipped. They do not protrude far from the ear if at all, all ears are different but mine seem to swallow these and fit nearly flush with my outer ear. The pictures online make them seem larger than they are for a good reason, an actual image of size would be too small to see clearly.
Value for money?...i've only used wired headsets thus far, these are my first bluetooth earbuds so i can't give you an experienced perspective, i can and will tell you that these sound better than even my wired apple earbuds and every set i've owned so far...i'm happy with them for the price i paid.

title: Amazing sound - love the bass
body: I have put these through so many workouts at the gym and they have never failed. The sound has been amazing, with deep rich bass. I just bought another pair for my wife.

title: Five Stars

There is no phone number on their website, and they responded to my first email by asking if everything is resolved? After doing nothing mind you. And they do not respond anymore after that. I've emailed them three times. Horrible customer service.

I would recharge but as soon as you pulled the cable they would automatically turn back on. You had to make sure it was off or it would drain the charge. Now after having them 33 day its now May 31 2018 and they will not charge and are worthless. This is the third different brand I have had since Christmas and I can't seem to find anything that last. I do 2 hour workouts with a lot of cardio and  at first they made it through fine but now just junk

title: Beautiful sound but come out of my ears
body:
The earphones sound great for the price, not as good as the expensive brands, but these are not in that price range. The battery lasts a long time and doesn’t take very long to charge. The marshmallow buds are as good as earplugs when you are in a noisy area, airplane, etc. They put extra pressure on your ears so they can get uncomfortable after a long time wearing them.

It is probably just be my ears, but the normal buds slide back out after time. I have tried all three sizes and only the large ones fit my ear canals. It feels like I spend a lot of time pushing them back in again.

title: Worked dependably, daily for 2 years.
body: I wore the first pair that I purchased, in airports and planes. They created my own island in the sea of people, and noise. They dependably lasted for 8 hours consistently, until constant use frayed a connection in the right bud. I bought another pair immediately, they are a trusted companion.

title: Great value! These headphones feature fantastic build quality for ...
body: Great value! These headphones feature fantastic build quality for the price. Sound better than most headphones that cost 3 times as much.

title: Great headphines for the right price.
body: Great sound and very comfortable to wear.  I like the case it comes with so there is a safe place to out them when not in use.  The magnetic backs are a plus so they don't fall off.

title: Good for its price
body:
They were awfully uncomfortable the first week. I was going to return them but got too lazy to. Then my ears got used to how they fit, and it stopped hurting.

I purchased MPOW's as well, hoping they'd be better. One thing I will say is that this sound quality's a lot better than the MPOW IPX7. Also, the magnets on each ear bud is a neat feature. Keeps the wire from dragging to one side; an issue I have with old wireless earbuds.

title: Nice Sound/Poor Design
body: I recently purchased three different sets of bluetooth earbuds to test. This one was the clear winner—until today.  While changing the tips, the bud came apart. The wire connection was destroyed.  Who designs a two-piece earbud when changing the tips requires you to pull on the ends?  Disappointed.

title: JUNK!
body: Battery began to fail after two weeks.  Now after just one month the battery will not take a charge.  JUNK!

title: update... Didn't last! :( Pricey for 4 month lifespan
body:
UPDATE January 2018:  I hate to say this because initially loved these, but for the price I am now skeptical of their construction.  I'm not a "rough user" of headphones.... I don't take them to the gym, I usually use them while sitting at my desk or relaxing.  I use the protective case that comes with them, and I don't use them daily - ,maybe 2x a week. Three months after purchasing these I started to notice the left channel completely dropping out.  I thought it was perhaps a charging or Bluetooth connection issue, so I reset everything and started with a fresh charge.  Ten minutes into music, once again, the left channel starts poppin in and out (I'm sitting perfectly still at my desk) and finally quits. There doesn't appear to be a "loose wire/connection" and as I said, I am never rough with them so if it is a faulty wire it's a product of manufacturing.  I notice some reviewers have had similar issues.  I was so high on these buds that I WAS going to buy sets for my teenage sons - but considering they are substantially rougher on earbuds than me, I'm glad I didn't waste the money.  I hope TrebLab continues to improve; I think they have a good product, I'm just not sure of quality control in their manufacturing.  :(

FIRST review 7/21/17: I consider myself somewhat of an audiophile, having spent decades in the music industry, and fortunate enough to be exposed to some of the best equipment around. I grew up with the typical over-the-ear "cans", (and still prefer them for the ultimate ambient immersion in music) and earbuds - well - those were a necessary evil for today's mobile world.  My favorites through the years have been the Shure Pro line, but again, those are not Bluetooth, nor no they have a mic. For me they offer a decent music experience in a small (but expensive) package.

I gave up on trying to find decent earbuds to enjoy music on the go AND use my phone for calls, so I splurged on various earpieces (mostly Jawbone) to at least go hands-free. My last one just stopped holding a charge a few weeks ago. On a total whim I saw these on a "Deal of the Day" for $30, and thought what the heck - the reviews were decent.  They charged quickly, connected effortlessly, and I was absolutely blown away by the sound. Great bass but also the highs and midrange offered crystal clear  and amazing STEREO (left/right definition) and Bluetooth?? Technology has made me feel like a dinosaur lately.

The come with a huge variety of earpieces, and a great case. I'm still shocked at the sound for the price I paid.

title: Five Stars
body: As advertised.

title: Good Ears
body: the sound quality is outstanding and for someone like me that normally wears hearing aids that is saying something I don't know what else to say but thanks.

title: Returned.
body: Decent mid and high range, but very lack of low end frequency that not fulfill the nowadays songs . and the battery life is just not long enough as I often find myself out of battery when I really need it. This item is just overrated in terms of its sound, that made it not suitable for audiophile. However, very nice build quality.

title: Five Stars
body: The earbuds are great, smooth and clear listening.

title: Nice for a month or two!
body: You get what you pay for, I used for a couple of months they started to act up after a while.

title: they are very convenient and easy to pair with my devices
body: I bought both the Treblab J1 and the X2 wireless earbuds, I've been using the wired earbuds before now.  It's taken me awhile to get used to them but I believe they are winners in the earbud game.  They both have very clear sound, I listen to both music and for movies on my iPad.  My husband has noice cancelling Bose earbuds and I've gotta say that my noise cancelling X2 will give him a run for his money any day, and I only paid a third of the cost.  These buds have a very high quality sound, which was number one on my list, they are very convenient and easy to pair with my devices.  I'm still getting use to the phone sounds and clicking for accepting and hanging up on calls, some of calls have been "hung up on" while I've been busy walking or working out and mistakenly pushed wrong buttons.  There is also the occasional announcement that you are "connected" as you may be moving around in the 30 ft. zone and earbuds will reactivate or reconnect.  That aside, I'm happy and totally satisfied that I made the right choices.  And for the price...I was able to buy 2 styles of the TREBLAB earbuds...definitely a great buy for a super high quality product!

title: Great support!
body: Excellent earbuds good bass and sound quality. I had a question and reached out to the support staff and they resolved my issue quickly and in a friendly manner. Would recommend to a friend!

title: Charge duration is a bit short, but over all nice.
body: Good quality and sound. Very comfortable. Charge duration is a bit shorter than I'd like, but over all I like them a lot.

title: Dependable and Reliable
body:
Great pair of Headphones, i use them whenever i am going anywhere i want to listen to music discreatly

Pros:
They fit nicely in the ears with 3 sizes of lobe pieces as well as 3 sizes of ear hole pieces
Comes with a travel case that can easily fit the headphones, charging cable and extra bits
The Travel case is small and fits into my pocket nicely
Long lasting battery on medium to low volume
Battery is rated at 400 mAh so small portable battery can charge them and your phone on the same charge
Bluetooth connection is very stable

Cons:
Not particularly loud on max volume
Microphone is below average, when using it as a headset the people on the other end had trouble hearing me
When using only one the other end drags the end in your ear out easily
Takes several hours to charge using included cable (personally I'm afraid to use any other cable due to the tiny battery size)

Notes:
Battery life indicator beeps within about 5 minutes of it dying at current usage

title: Believe the Hype:  Amazing.
body:
I am a road cyclist and after upgrading to an iPhone XR I had to begrudgingly give up my wired Klipsch headphones. I have custom foam tips for these and they’ve been perfect.
Forced by Apple to go Bluetooth, I found many positive reviews for these headphones but my fear was that they were going to be too big (protrude too far) And produce a lot of wind noise when cycling.
When I learned that these headphones INCLUDED the foam tips along with the huge size selection of standard tips- that was my tipping point.
The sound of these headphones is absolutely amazing. I rode 40 miles with these this weekend and the wind noise was non existent. I have yet to drain the battery to see how realistic the claimed life is, but so far every possible listening experience- from fit to sonic performance have been fantastic. And if you LOVE bass- use the foam tips. Deep and rich boom!

title: USED & UNSANITARY
body: Ordered new earbuds, what I recieved was used. Opening the box, I first noticed the tape was peeled away from the box. Inside, the little zip lock bag with ear tips & buds was all wrinkle, like it was previously handled. The USB  charging cord was unraveled & twisted back loosely with a twist tie. Don't know how they sound, I dare not to stick these in my ear.

title: Music for working out, or outside
body:
I am excitingly satisfied with my TREBLAB J1 Bluetooth Earbuds.  I work outside in the heat and humidity of the deep south, where sweat is ever present from early morning until quitting time.  Other brands of earbuds were uncomfortable, unreliable, and had poor performance, poor quality, and short battery life.
  I compiled a wish list of what I was looking for in a new set of earbuds.  After many hours of searching tech reviews and customer satisfaction surveys, TREBLAB came to my rescue.  I didn't ask for much, only:
  1.  Good Bluetooth connectivity
  2.  Quality sound
  3.  Proper and comfortable fit
  4.  Long battery life
  5.  Noise reduction
  6.  Low profile
  7.  Sweat and water resistant
  8.  Clear mic
  9.  Reasonably priced

TREBLAB J1's met and exceeded ALL of my criteria.

My ears are happy, my heart is happy, and my wallet is NOT empty.
Make your next  earbuds my current earbuds.

title: Quality
body: This is Christmas gift for my DIL and granddaughter. I hope these are great quality. I LOVE American made products. Thanks for supporting our country

title: Great value, awesome sound!
body: I'll admit, I'm not too bright sometimes. I did a load of laundry yesterday, and found my headphones in the dryer, having already gone through the washer. Not expecting much, I tried to turn them on. They still work! Definitely pleased with this purchase!

title: Real happy with the bass these deliver. Not bad earbuds for the price. Just get a good seal in the ear and they deliver.
body:
So I read a lot of reviews about these earbuds and saw several people say that they did not deliver good bass. I am a bass head, I actually play electric and upright bass and for the money, these deliver enough bass for me. I realize that my comment is subjective and anecdotal, but these deliver as much if not more bass than my wired earbuds. I have had many wired brands, expensive, cheap, middle of the road, you name it, and honestly, these deliver for me. NOTE: Like any earbud, you need to create a tight seal when placed in the ear. Maybe that was the issue with others reviewing these. They were unable to get a good seal. These come with several tips, even memory foam. I use the foam to get the best possible seal. I noticed that if they do not have a good seal, the bass drops off. Once in my ear though, they stay in and are loud to me.
Pros: 1 Easy to pair
  2 Fit well in ear
  3 Good bass
  4 Battery last a while
  5 Magnetic backs are handy.
Cons:
  1 Tips are hard to take off and put on. I ripped a tip pulling it off.
  2 Highs are not as crisp as I like, but the bass makes up for it.

title: Has Potential but Falls Short
body:
======UPDATE as of 04/11/18=======
Treblab did give me incredibly good customer service. I was impressed by how quick they were able to assist me. It did take longer than expected at first but that was due to a technical error. They granted me a full refund because it did not fit my anatomical features. The J1's are good headphones if it wasn't for the fitting aspect but this is particular to my features. Even if I did not particularly like the volume control on the side of my head, it did work very effectively. For functionality purposes plus the quick turnaround and customer support, I have updated my rating to 4 stars.

I want to like the J1's. In fact I was touting about it to everyone I know based on reviews. But I believe there is a better product also sold by Treblab compared to the J1. I like to use the product a few times before writing a review and was gifted the headphones for Christmas but I am not satisfied with it. Here are the pros followed by the cons:

Pro:
- Long Battery Life - I have used it 5 times and it just died on me (total of 9-10 hours at the gym) so charging is in order.
- Comes in a compact, portable,round case that can be taken anywhere with a netted pocked inside to hold earbud tips
- Sound is prevalent and volume can be increased quite high compared to other headphones.
- Pairs instantly once Bluetooth is setup with your phone.

Cons:
- I thought the earfins would be effective. However, no matter how I position these hoping that it would somehow align with some crevice or nook of my inner ear, they are just not comfortable and do not provide the extra support for the earbuds to stay in.
- The foam eartips are comfortable but really block out all noise possible (if that is what you want). They are better than the rubber eartips which literally do not stick inside my ear. No matter how I position them, they keep falling out. It is incredibly frustrating.
- The tangle-free thin wires of the earbuds are a great addition for any company that is selling wire-based headphones. However, they never stick around the back of my neck, where I positioned them. I used the added wire management tool which was not as effective as I thought it would be. I had to use tape to hold the wires together so that both earphones would stay in.
- I think the biggest downfall for the J1's is the volume control on the right side. It hangs right next to my face and I cannot do anything about it. It weighs down the right side so that there is not enough balance with the wire management tool to keep the wires flat on the back of my neck.
- The music at times seems hollow but the bases are nice and present.

Based on Treblab's reviews by customers, I want to like the company. I have been searching the other alternatives to this J1 model that alleviates the problems I described above. I believe the XR800 is made with similar features but has a on-ear hook that will help stabilize the headphones and keep them in my ear the entire time. In addition, the volume control is on the headphone as opposed to being attached to the wire, plus the wire management tool looks like it's a part of the wire setup as opposed to something that is added on to it. Hoping I could exchange these J1's.

title: Not worth the money

These Treblab earbuds are really uncomfortable to wear and always come loose even after trying on different setups with the tips. The material is quite stiff and they make my ears sore. I've never had that issue with any other earbuds. I really wanted to love these but I don't. Another huge knock for me was the magnetic feature. It was one of the main reasons I decided to purchase these but the magnet is really weak. With a light touch,  the magnet will come undone.  It's not secure at all. I almost lost these many times because I my hoodie strap will touch it slightly. Luckily I caught it on time. The phaiser magnets are much better in comparison.

body: These damn things are freaking awesome. So they don't have Bose type of base, but damn! Listen to my play list on my phone and when a call came nice and clear, talking and listening. Watch the volume though, they will crank up. Great sound and the volume will crank it up. These are righteous.

title: [Updated] Good product, AMAZING service!
body:
My first pair failed after a few months. I thought I would have to jump through many hoops to get a replacement, but the process was simple and the representative was kind and helpful at each step. It was so refreshing to see how much this company cared about its product and customer service!

I was hoping that some of the shortcomings of the actual product could be attributed to the defective pair, but alas, the biggest issue remained:
The Bluetooth connectivity is hit or miss (this was something I noticed after extensive use post-review, and once again after I received my replacement pair). My phone (Galaxy Note) is in my back pocket, and the J1s are charged up, but every commute I had instances of "skipping" or disrupted broadcast. I suppose it is possible I got the ONLY TWO sets that have this problem... or maybe my body absorbs Bluetooth signals. At any rate, it prevents me from being able to give this product 5 stars.

I am enjoying the J1s, as long as I keep my phone in my hand or lap or on my desk.

<Original Review>
Bought these for myself and as a gift.

PROS
Sound quality - (Note: I am not an audiophile) Audio is crisp, clear - honestly, not much different from wired earbuds.
Battery life - so far it has been lasting the 9+ hours as advertised.
Magnets - strong magnets. It is satisfying when they snap together
Noise cancelling - It's about what you can expect from passive noise cancelling. There are plenty of extra ear pieces (which is good because the foam ones seem to disintegrate in my ear)

CONS
Ear pieces - the foam ones fall apart in my left ear for some reason.
Microphone - pretty hit or miss. I thought there was technology to negate wind or something when speaking. I was talking in an office, and apparently background chatter was too much, or the mic did not pick up my voice enough. Really disappointing because I gifted this to a friend who is a salesperson to use for sales calls... and he had to go back to his other bluetooth earbuds.
Battery gauge - (I could be missing something) but there is no way to know how much charge is left on the earbuds. There is a voice signal when battery is low, which means you have about ~15 min left of listening. But aside that, you cannot know if you have 90% or 30% charge left.
Charging - The cable has a tag that says "USE ONLY THIS CABLE TO CHARGE". It looks like a normal micro-USB cable, but it's slightly smaller. I accidentally plugged my regular micro-USB into the earbuds, and it fit snugly. Then I noticed the tag on the included cable and switched. It fits more easily. Not sure what the consequence of using another cable is... but it is inconvenient in any case.
Pairing - Pairing with a single device (my phone) is perfect. Trying to subsequently pair it with my ipad or laptop for work is very fiddly. I think I was spoiled with the BOSE QC35s because they can pair with so many devices.

Overall, I think the product is acceptable. They work well for listening to music for a workout or on commutes, but the mic is not reliable for calls, especially work calls. The cable, pairing, and knowing how much charge is left are minor quibbles.

BOTTOM LINE: The audio is good, but did not blow me away, and the mic is mediocre. I am generally pleased with this product, especially for the price.

title: Support was great
body: These were great I bought them in September 2018 and I use them mostly for audio book listening. A month ago they started having issues with the charging lights not working. then they slowly died. I contacted the company and they took ownership for them.  For the cost of them I wasn't expecting much, I really wanted to make sure there wasn't a reset on them. I will buy them again now.

title: Different but Awesome
body:
These headphones are amazing. That's the shortened version of the review.

This is my very first pair of Bluetooth headphones I've ever owned. I'm not an elderly person, I'm not unable to figure out electronics, I'm also not somebody who refuses to accept change. I just have never liked the idea of wireless headphones. Especially the airpods because I think people look absolutely ridiculous with those in their ears. These headphones however, are pretty damn good. I've only charged them once, work out about 45 minutes 5 separate times on the charge, and there's still over 50% battery life left. It's not weird getting used to them like I had thought, and the sound quality is probably the best I've ever heard from a pair of headphones anywhere near this price range. They do cancel almost all noise from inside my gym. All I've heard was weights crashing. I don't heard the gyms speakers, other people grunting, or anything else. The sound is also pretty loud. I'm uses to having the speakers at almost the highest setting for loudness, and now I'm just barely passed halfway. Time will tell if they hold up to sweat and daily use in the gym, but if I get a year out of the, I'll be impressed.

title: Bought for wife. She loves them.
body: My wife uses these at the gym and loves them. They don’t fall out during aerobic training.

title: Poor fit, poor sound

title: I like it
body: I previously gave 5 stars because I love the sound quality but they customers service sucks. I got the J1 and loved it, so I decided to get more(I am always on the hunt for a good headphones) one for my wife and I. I got 2 of the N8. A few days later I have email Treblab that listening to music with the headphones is great but talking not so much. We have been exchanging emails back and forth ( i have been almost one month), they wanted me to do a factory reset... I did it and still the same issues.  I emailed them again and no answer yet since it have only a week,  now i am getting pissed off. On the 9-17-2018 my J1 left hear bud is not working. All my headphones are useless now. Guess what I did, I emailed them about my new problem and claim number now I am just waiting for them to get back to me.

title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THEM
body: I've had these earbuds now a week and I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THEM!!!! Great value didn't need to change ear clips, right out the box they fit. I definitely love Treblab unique design of the J1 earbuds.

title: Sound quality!
body: Fantastic sound!

title: Four Stars
body: Excellent sound for the price, and the earbuds are very well made.

title: Amazing
body: Extremely great quality! The sound is crystal clear and the bass is so intense that I actually had to activate the bass reducer in my Apple Music app settings! 10/10!

title: Four Stars
body: Good sound. Not exelent

title: Great sound quality and great value.
body: The J1s have very good sound quality and the long battery life gets me through my long runs.  They come with an assortment of ear pieces and after finding the ones that are the most comfortable, I don’t have to worry about them falling out.  And the icing on the cake is they are substantially less expensive than comparable big name brands.

title: Fine when they work
body:
These served their purpose at a fair price when they worked, but after 2 pairs lasting roughly 3 months each I'm done with them.

I pretty much exclusively have used these for running when they worked and they did fine there. They don't have a functional cord shortener like comparable products so you'll need to be ok with the cable riding on your neck. They are advertised as being waterproof, yet both pairs stopped working in the same amount of time with the same use. So either they are not waterproof and sweat is causing them to sotp working or they are simply poorly made. Eitgher way I wouldn't recommend these.

They've been cared for as directed, yet each pair stopped charging after 3 months. They replaced the first pair after it stopped working, but would not replace the second pair and only offered a discount code to purchase a new pair when the second pair had the same issue and stopped functioning.

If you're looking for a decent pair of minimalist wireless earbuds at a cheap price I'd looks elsewhere as these have unfortunately not met expectations.

title: Great headphones for the price

I wanted a pair that would be comfortable (these have multiple size earbud covers to tailor to your own preference) and have decent audio for running outdoors.  I've used them several times now and am not disappointed.  They pair quickly with my phone and keep a charge well.  They only thing I wish they had was a clip on the cord to attach to a shirt  to keep the cord from migrating to the right hand side, which is the side that the control switch is on and probably weighs a bit more than the left side.  But for the money, they're all I needed!

Pairing is painless and the audio feedback on Power On/Off provides positive feedback as to the state of the earbuds. Passive noise cancellation is better than I expected - I was using them while sitting only 7 - 8 feet from a TV my wife was watching and the TV sound was basically inaudible. The travel package is nice and compact - much smaller than my noise cancelling headphones. Appears to be a very good purchase - no regrets."

title: Great Buy

title: Good Sound, Decent Battery Life
body: Difficult to pair with more than one device at a time. Sound is excellent. Some of the foam tips are a little large, and the remote control is a little bulky and heavy (but not as much as some others I've used). Battery lasts about 4 hours of continuous listening, days if turned off and waiting to be used. Charges in 2-3 hours, but you need your own charger (cord is included). I would buy these again.

title: Awesome earbuds for the money
body: Awesome earbuds for the money.  No complaints.  Even though they do feel solid, I will be as gentle with them as I can be.. from other reviews it sounds like the ear pieces can break apart.  We shall see how they hold up.  For $40, the audio quality is damn good IMO.  The lows produce a nice rumble in the ear and the highs are crisp and clear.  They make my skull candy ink'd buds sound like trash.  I take a lot of calls on my earbuds too, no complaints from callers. They report I am loud clear across multiple calls so far.  Best $40 I have spent in a while...

title: Not bad for the price.
body:
I've used these earbuds for a few months now and feel that I can provide an objective review based on the experience. Overall, the product does what it is supposed to do. I would not recommend the product for an audiophile, but the rest of us mortals who just want to listen to music while at the gym or going for a run will do fine with the Treblab J1. There are 3 points that should be noted:
1) maximum battery life is 5 hours (I workout 2.5 hours per session and always have to recharge after 2 sessions)
2) for a regular sized person, the cable connecting the earbuds is about 6 to 7 inches too long.This somewhat negates the benefit of wireless earbuds which to me is freedom from wires.
3) sometimes the + volume button makes a strange, loud, searing noise.
4) the ear pieces are not perfect, but then, my ear canals are not perfect either!
I have learned to work around these issues, and overall, I'm enjoying the product.

title: Fabulous Ear Buds!

They’re also good for calls although sometimes there is an issue of it hanging up the phone call when I try to switch modes from talking the call on the phone versus taking it on the Treblab J1 earbuds. title: Gave em Another Chance
body:
These headphones were good at first, gave me a comfortable fit and really decent sound quality. I use them for indoor running and weight lifting. However, after only a couple weeks of use they started to cut-out, loose connection, and finally they died. I need music to power through my workouts so I really annoyed with these earbuds.TREBLAB J1 Bluetooth Earbuds, Best Wireless Headphones For Sports Gym Running. [2017 Upgraded] IPX6 Waterproof Sweatproof, Magnetic Secure-Fit Headset. Noise Cancelling Earphones w/ Microphone Mic

Update: I am upgrading my feedback for the following reasons:

1) Produtech have really great consumer service, they reached out to me and resolved my dissatisfaction by issuing me a replacement pair of earbuds. I had a great experience with this seller and would not hesitate to purchase from them in the future.
2) My replacement earbuds have been holding up pretty good so far. I am a runner and a good pair of earbuds is a MUST for me to be able to enjoy my workouts. The fit is good, I don't worry about them falling out of my ears, even when doing burpees, and mountain climbers. The sound good, not great but pretty good, I get full range sound with decent bass. The bass is a must for me, I've returned other wireless earbuds for lack of bass.
I'm happy with my replacements so far and will be buying another pair for my wife. I believe that my first pair may have failed due to sweat getting inside the circuit, I sweat a lot. I recommend that you try to keep these earbuds as dry as possible. I run with a little sweat towel that I use to occasionally dry my ears and the earbuds. After my runs, I let the earbuds sit outside of the storage case for a couple hours to dry completely out before attempting to charge them (Highly Recommend this to prevent issues). Other then that, these earbuds are a great value compared to several others that I have tried at this price point.

title: Awesome product. Easy to use

title: Sound Great, But...
body:
I bought these a couple weeks ago and finally tried them out a few days ago.  They sound absolutely fantastic, but I have a few issues with them.  I was hesitant to buy them as I've never used earbuds with the inner fins to hold them in place, and I was afraid they would be uncomfortable.  And they are.  It doesn't matter what size fins I use or how I position them, they actually become painful after a few minutes.  However, using the noise-cancelling foam tips keeps the earbuds in place without the need for the fins.  The silicone tips don't hold them in, but I prefer the foam tips anyway.

So, that was solved and I was happy again.  Then, after the third or fourth time I wore them my ear was a bit itchy after taking them off.  After figuring out that there was something inside my ear and having to dig it out, I was holding a small round piece of metal in my hand.  I immediately recognized it as the mesh speaker cover from one of the earbuds.  Not only had the cover come off as you can see in the attached photo, but it actually fits through the opening in the foam tip with no problem at all, which allows it to go all the way inside your ear.

So now I have a major dilemma.  I love the sound from these things, and I know that I could simply put a tiny speck of glue on the mesh and put it back in, but the combination of the intolerable fins and now the questionable production quality of the product makes me seriously think I'm going to return them and go with a different brand.  If it was only the fins I could deal with it with no problem, but I really don't like having to dig pieces of my earbuds out of my ears after using them.  But I hate the idea of giving up the fantastic sound of these things.

title: Buy something else.
body: These were the worst.  Tried all 3 sizes of earbuds and none of them would stay in my ear.  The bracket thing that is supposed to help with stability sits so far back on the earbud that it seems to push the headphone out of your ear. Couldn’t run, lift or do anything like breathe without them coming loose.  Never found out if they were moisture wicking because they wouldn’t stay in my ears through a workout.

title: Overhyped
body:
Uncomfortable
Coming from a more comfortable fit from Klipsch, this was to be expected but I haven't had headphones this uncomfortable in a long time. I've owned everything from Beats to Skullcandy's. I have tried all the included tips and fins and the headphones were still very uncomfortable.

Poor Noise Islation
These headphones boast their noise isolation but I was fully able to hear the subway while IN the train. I have plenty of other headphones that completely block out noise

Volume Not Loud Enough
I had to listen to most of my music at full volume while I can get away with 75% volume using other headphones

Poor Sound Quality
Tinny sound from songs that are crystal clear in other headphones. The bass in songs muffles the vocals entirely with these headphones.

Poor Connection
Even with its boasted aptX technology, I found myself noticing songs skipping every once in a while. Not a major con but enough to be an annoyance. Headphones had greater than 75% charge when I was finished with my commute so it wouldn't be a power issue.

Final thoughts:
These would make a great pair of headphones if they fit well in your ears and you'll be using them solely indoors as the noise isolation is just not enough for a city environment, and its poor handling of connections with wireless signals in a crowded city will drive you nuts. If you don't live in a city area, this may work for you.

Update:
The manufacturers/sellers have attempted to contact me with a canned response to my review which completely disregards everything I have mentioned in my review covering multiple pain points.. I'd take away that final star if I could, for the insult.

I also own a pair of Anker SoundBuds Slim, in my opinion the sound is similar to the J1. The BIG difference, in my case, is that the SoundBuds work well when carrying my cell in a pouch around my waist while the J1's connectivity is spotty.
